name: mdb2168
text: I get take out for my family from time to time & their absolute favorite is the Braised beef short ribs, spinach salad, roasted veggies & white chocolate bread pudding ! It’s a must !

name: Shannon Denney
text: I've eaten at Tre Luna 4 times now, and it gets better every single time. The grouper was mind-blowing! So, so good. BUT I have to admit that I'm kind of a smoked salmon pizza lover and their smoked salmon pizza is AMAZING! The crust is to die for and every bite was perfect. So glad to have such an awesome restaurant in Hoover.

resp.text: Customers like you are what make us better, Shannon. Knowing your experience was mind-blowing is one thing, but using adjectives to describe it like "awesome," "perfect," and "amazing,"? All I can say is this: I can't wait to have you back. I look forward to hearing what adjectives you'll use to describe us next time. -Erin Mooney, Owner

name: laesa yow
text: Great food😍😍

name: Cheryl Brewer
text:
Sophisticated but not intimidating. Interesting menu but not over the top. Reasonable prices for the quality. Great service yet not snooty. We had the marinated shrimp and burrata appetizers during happy hour, so we enjoyed discount pricing. Very nice. Great way to explore without a huge investment. Nice outdoor dining are.

We plan to return soon. Nice job.

resp.text:
Glad we could guide you through a delicious culinary adventure, Cheryl. You can't go wrong with fresh shrimp and homemade Buratta. It's our privilege to provide high-quality food to our high-quality guests, and we will always make sure everyone feels welcome. We cant wait to give you the same great service and meal when you return.

Best regards,
Erin Mooney, Owner

name: Catherine Ross
text: My husband and I just got married a couple of weeks ago and Tre Luna catered our reception. They were incredibly helpful and responsive leading up to the wedding. They were always happy to answer questions or make adjustments — I was very impressed with their service and responsiveness. They did a lovely job at the wedding. We got a lot of compliments on the food, and it was awesome too because they sent us with special bags of food which we ate when we got to our hotel after the reception. Great people, great service, great food. Very thoughtful!

resp.text: Thank you so much Catherine!

name: Will Sparkman
text: Could not have asked for a better caterer. Tre Luna stepped in just weeks before our wedding in November when the first caterer we had for our reception decided to close shop without any warning. They were able to do their version of our original menu with our budget from the previous caterer and provided fantastic food and service! They were very professional and handled our time crunch flawlessly. Love their food and they were a joy to work with!

resp.text: Thank you Will! It was a pleasure working with you!!

name: Restaurant Guy
text: 3rd trip in 3 weeks to Tre Luna. I had the Lasagna the 1st 2 visits and it was wonderful. Other people tried the Chicken Francisca and loved it. Tonight we tried the pork chop, Chicken Francisca again, the beef tenderloin special and the chicken parmigiana. It was all good. I given 5 stars previously but tonight I’m giving a 4 because the service was a notch down from the last 2 weeks but we’ll be back soon.

resp.text: 3rd trip in three weeks? All I can say is: Wow! The pork chop and beef tenderloin are both pretty special, and I can't wait to hear what you try on your next visit. Bummer to hear the service wasn't top-notch, but I'm confident my team will get it right next time you're in. See you then -Erin Mooney, Owner

name: Pam Abernathy
text: Just what my son needed he works there.

name: Sara Walker
text: Tre Luna offers delicious food made in house.  Brian will customize a menu specific to your event.  Erin brings next level customer service and knowledge on how to ensure your event is not only a great success but that you get to enjoy it with your guests.  They do amazing hot lunch catering for delivery and they do not disappoint.

name: Alicia Sherman
text: We asked Tre Luna to cater our small wedding reception and we could not have been happier.  I more or less gave them creative control and they knocked it out of the park.  They didn't over complicate the process which was so nice since I had so many other elements to stress over.  Would absolutely recommend and we will be using them in the future!

resp.text: Thank you Alicia! It was a pleasure working with you!  😊

name: kim hickman
text: Great service and great food! We felt very welcome and were well taken care of. We will be back. Had burrata for the first time and it did not disappoint!

resp.text: If there's anything better than great food, it's great service, Kim. I'm thrilled you got the best of both worlds with us. We will always be happy to welcome you, especially when there's Burrata involved. Hope to see you again soon. -Erin Mooney, Owner

name: David Labovitz
text: I can’t say enough good things about this place.  I’m not one to write reviews often but this place knocked it out of the park.  Not only was it a very nice venue,  it was some of the best redfish I’ve ever had.   The waiter (Paul) and the owner (Erin) couldn’t have been more inviting.  We had a toddler there who was pretty fussy but they brought him things to play with and even held him for a bit so I could get in a few bites.  We will definitely be back.  Highly recommended.

resp.text: Thank you so much David! We hope to see you back soon.

name: Emily Weeks
text: What a delicious dining experience!! Tre Luna was easy to work with, their food was delicious-- everyone raved about it! I will happily recommend them to anyone ! Thank you! Jeannine Weeks

name: Pam Armstrong
text: Food is incredible! Service is the absolute best.  I would recommend them for anything big or small!!

resp.text: Thank you so much Pam! We are grateful for your support and appreciate you!

text: Tre Luna never disappoints. From the service to the food, they are always spot on!  I am happy to recommend this business.

resp.text: Thank you Bart!

name: Amy Davis

resp.text: Thank you so much Amy! We appreciate your business.

name: Emily Johnston
text: The best meals.  Never had a morsel that wasn't delicious. And since I have an issue with portion control and over eating, this keeps me in control!

name: Chasity Lowe
text: Food portions are always perfect! The food is always fresh and flavorful! Ordering is so convenient, especially for a teacher. Coming home in the evenings, I have my plate full and do not have the time to make myself healthy meals for lunch. I always enjoy the times that I am able to order from Port City Preps because it is easy and the meals are spot on for what I need. During the pandemic when they started offering the take and bake family meals, these were also so wonderful! My family sometimes passes like ships in the night around dinner time so it was great to have something better than a bowl of cereal or a frozen pizza that we could all enjoy together without having to stay up til 8 or 9 to cook a meal. Would recommend this company to anyone! Great food! Great customer service! Great people!

name: Katie McGraw
text: I have been ordering meals for about a month and every single plate has been phenomenal! Perfect portions of delicious food.

name: Reid Smith
text: The food is incredible. The website is extremely user-friendly. I’ve never had any trouble and they are very timely and efficient with your orders definitely recommend to anyone looking to eat healthier in a much easier way than cooking when you don’t have the time.

name: Amy Rowe
text: Port City Preps is the most excellent food delivery service I've ever used. The menu is always expanding, the food is always fresh and delicious and the prices can't be beat. I seriously would spend more at a fast food joint every day but with Port City Preps, I can have HEALTHY food delivered directly to me at home or at work for a price that always fits my budget. I HIGHLY recommend Port City Preps!

name: Courtney Haupt
text: I use Port City Preps as a meal prep company for myself and gym athletes. You can trust the ingredients and all the nutrition info is easily labeled on the website and food packaging and that is something that is important to me. I have also used Port City for several catering events and the Craig has always been able to work within whatever budget I had.  Craig was also able to come up with some creative and delicious ideas that everyone at the event loved - not to mention there was always extras!

name: Samantha Catlett
text: Port City Preps catered my wedding in June 2020, they did a phenomenal job! All of our guests raved over the bacon wrapped scallops, broccoli balls, crawfish bread, and chicken kabobs! The staff was extremely professional and took excellent care of our guests. The display was beautiful. They had to overcome a venue that was entirely outdoors on a very humid summer night, they pulled off our 100 person buffet style reception without issue! I very highly recommend. You will not be disappointed and neither will your guests.

resp.text: Thank you Samantha for taking the time to leave a review of your experience, and thank you even more for letting us be apart of your special night! It was a beautiful wedding, and we were so happy to be apart of it.

name: Josh Williams
text: Their Big Mac wraps and fried rice bowls are great.

name: Alexis Dove
text: Owner and Head Chef Craig does not disappoint. He uses fresh, local ingredients to create delicious meals. From take and bake casseroles to healthy individual meal preps I’ve never had a meal that I would not reorder. The added convenience of Port City Prep’s delivery services makes ordering from them a no brainer!

name: Kristen Haring
text: I was lucky to have Port City Preps cater my wedding. The food was amazing and was everything that we envisioned. Craig was very good about staying in communication with me. They set up and cleaned up and made it one less thing for me to worry about on my big day!

name: Tristian “Willis” Grove
text: They make healthy food taste like unhealthy food if that’s what you want. The menu varieties is what keeps me using their services!!

name: Jack Morrisroe
text: We have used this business multiple times for both catering and family meal orders. The quality of the food and freshness of the ingredients make port city preps stand out. The reliable and experienced catering service brings us back as a repeat customer.

name: Jordan Barbarin
text: I absolutely love these meals, my family gets them weekly! I love the fact that they rotate the menu and are constantly adding new things. It makes it a lot easier to stay on tract. The creative spin these guys put on some of these meals is nuts, things you wouldn’t think to make at home. All around 5 stars. I do recommend!

name: Victoria Jones
text: Loveeeee Port City Preps! Been using Chef Craig’s services for over a year now. I get the weekly meal plan and hand select all of my meals for the week. The food is always fresh and delicious. When I started my weight loss journey, I was struggling with the diet part. So I began using Port City to help count calories, fat, etc and it was PIVOTAL for me! I lost so much weight thanks to his easy meal plans. I also plan on using Port City to cater my wedding! Will always highly recommend!

resp.text: Thank you so much for taking the time to leave this review! We appreciate you for being a long term customer more than we can express, and we look forward to sharing your big day with you!!

name: Ellen Talbot
text: Craig is talented and his food is incredible! His presentation as a caterer is also really impressive, the total package for sure. This team would be a great choice for any event!

name: Chelsea Moore
text: My family loves PCP! Having the food delivered straight to my front door saves me so much time! The food is very fresh and taste amazing and customer service is spot on. Highly recommend!

name: mandy parker
text: Great food and just as great customer service. Makes eating healthy enjoyable AND easy with delivery. Definitely recommend!

name: Sean Phillips
text: I have tried other meal prep companies but Port City is a step above. Chef Craig's meals are next level. Keep it up guys!

name: Ellen Talbot
text: Craig is talented and his food is incredible! His presentation as a caterer is also really impressive, the total package for sure. This team would be a great choice for any event!

text:
ive been ordering from Craig for a couple years now! The food is always fresh and juicy(grilled chicken). he's helped an on the go, really busy Dad lose 35+ lbs  by providing healthy, clean, and delicious meals :)
he got a customer for life over here!

name: Atutudes
text: Delicious healthy food, reasonably priced, and delivered. Win/Win/Win. I have thoroughly enjoyed everything I have received. Chef Craig is a gifted chef.

text: Delicious and healthy meals! I order on Sunday, my food for the week is delivered to my office on Monday morning. It makes eating healthier the easiest thing ever, without sacrificing tasty food!

text: Their Big Mac wraps and fried rice bowls are great.

name: HankMardukas15
text: This place makes it easy to eat healthier. Place an order and they deliver the next day. They offer very healthy options that taste well above average. It has changed the way we eat. Very happy with service as well. They will only continue to get better as the business grows.

name: Tyler Kennedy
text: I've been buying several meals per week for over a year now, all delivered, and can't think of a single issue ever occurring. Food is great, healthy, and service is excellent.

name: Lauren Sanders
text: Incredible food & top notch customer service. It makes this ER Nurses life less chaotic when it comes to deciding what to bring for lunch & I know it’s going to taste wonderful & is healthy!!

name: Keefe Ollis
text: Great food!! Went to a wedding they catered and wow!! Ended up buying from the meal prep side of the business! Keep it up!

name: Allissa Willamor
text: This place catered my wedding and let me tell you, I was more excited to eat at my wedding than anything! They let us come in and taste different things. They cooked us up something special since I don’t eat meat and it was the best thing I’ve ever had. They were very prepared with everything and even went to the venue the day before the wedding to get a feel of the kitchen. The set up was very classy and they kept everything stocked and nicely kept. Paper plates, cutlery, and napkins were provided as well. They were very attentive and picked up plates during the reception. We didn’t even have to lift a finger. When everything was finished they cleaned up and packed up and left everything spotless like they weren’t even there. I recommend this place to anyone looking for a caterer for any event!

name: Jessica White
text: Delicious and healthy meals! I order on Sunday, my food for the week is delivered to my office on Monday morning. It makes eating healthier the easiest thing ever, without sacrificing tasty food!

text: Cannot say enough good things about this company and the people working there! We called on Friday and they had it set up for us early on Saturday. The entire experience was great, the people who set and broke down were so sweet and considerate. Really cant rave enough about them - THANK YOU SUMMER FUN! :)

They are the absolute best. Highly recommend. 10/10.

text: I used them for my daughters first birthday party. Got a big misting fan. I was suppose to pick it up the night before. They over booked it so they offered to bring it to me the next day. I didn't make it to my house until noon which was okay the party wasn't until later then they cane back and picmed it up four hours later. I paid for an all day rental. They are nice people just a little disappointed in how the events turned out. I will probably use them again so they can redeem the loss.

text: 1-star for lack of hours. I find it hard to believe that the Subway Restaurant in a major hospital is closed all day Saturdays and Sundays. Otherwise, when the Subway is open the food is good and service is excellent.

Walked in to the Subway located inside of Cullman Regional at 9:50 in the morning and offered a friendly, “ Y’all open for business?” Was met with a condescending “If you made it in the door.....Yes”. Then the server turned to her co-worker and shrugged her shoulders and huffed. I apologized for the inquiry and walked out. I am only here with a family member having tests run. I would hate to know someone going through a more serious situation might be met with the same greeting. Customer service is apparently a lost art these days.

Wonderful customer services that just stomps subway to the ground. Even the price is worth it because you have way more options and the sandwich is always delicious 👌

text:
Love this place!! I use them for Catering and they have exceeded my expectation repeatedly. the Catering manager was very nice on the phone and was excited to walked me through the catering menu and helped me make my order very delicious. My clients LOVED it!

I also eat there all the time on the weekends and they have healthy options for me and unhealthy options for my husband!

name: Jake Ellis
text: No sense of urgency. I came at normal dinner time (6:30pm) and there was only one person making sandwiches. He was chilling and taking his time. Took 20 minutes to make a simple plain chicken and cheese sandwich. Will not be back.

name: Dia Malik
text: This is a good alternative to Subway as the meat is not processed. The process is super simple too. All you do is grab a bag to the corresponding meat and check mark whatever toppings, bread, and size you want. I love this versus having to say every topping at Subway. The also do thin bread and lettucewichs for people on a diet. My only complaint is the bread selection which consists of white and wheat. I would love for them to try something with a little for finesse.

name: Erin Price
text: So, the sandwiches are actually pretty good as far as fast food goes but I've had to go head to head with the employees too many times at this location. My suggestion: order online!!! When I buy online the pricing and order are always correct. Also ... Skip the bowl. I was really excited to try this option but it's not enough food. The don't put enough lettuce/spinach. The topping ratio seems fine but the filling not so much... Too much money for a 10 bite salad.

name: chelsea h
text: Unfortunately you cannot give 0 stars for service. I tried placing an online order at 10 am this morning (trying to give them ample time), there was a glitch and my credit card kept getting declined. I called the store and asked to fax the order and pay when I get there, the girl said of course except she didn't even know the correct fax number. I'm ordering sandwiches for a lunch at my office, so there is a time constraint so I figured I can just print off my orders and hand them the list however when I got there the lady made me fill out their stupid bags for all of my orders, so I'm not sure the difference if I just faxed them my order for pickup, thus me not filling out all of the bags. After having to do all of this, I was highly annoyed. The manager told me an order like this (8 sandwiches) would typically take two hours, so if you're in a rush and there are 7 people ahead of you beware because apparently it will take two hours to make all 8 of those sandwiches. The manager/owner kept making up excuse after excuse followed by a lousy apology. When I left with all of my sandwiches, I told her I would make sure to give them a review, she said "whatever" followed by yet another lousy apology. I worked in the service industry for years and would never have been rude to a customer regardless of how they act, so her attitude was completely unacceptable.

resp.text: Thanks William for taking the time to write the review and your kind words to describe the food and the service. Hope to see you soon again.

name: Caleb Harvey
text:
Worst experience I’ve ever had at a restaurant. I wouldn’t give them another penny of my business in my lifetime nor will my family.

From the moment we arrived, the two ladies running the front were extremely rude, and acted as if they didn’t want us there at all. Once we were seated, our drinks were slammed down on our table. 15 minutes passed before we saw them again to place our orders, of which we were given major attitudes.

We ordered a mango lassie, which was very gritty and was made from some sort of powder. The yogurt tasted rotten, and we told the server about it. She snatched it off our table, and rolled her eyes.

While we were here, and the 15 minutes passed by, we saw two other tables get up and walk out without ordering because of the terrible customer service given to them by the “manager”. Please roll back your cameras and watch people walking out after encountering the most rude servers/managers in Huntsville.

The rice was so dry, we asked for a different entree. Once we got the bill, she refused to take off the drink that cost $3.99 because we took one single sip out of it to find it wasn’t good, and the yogurt was sour. She said “you took a sip so you’re paying for it”. I told her that was ridiculous, that it was rotten, and she rolled her eyes, snatched my debit card from my hand and charged it.

I asked where the manager was, and she said “I’m the manager” and laughed. I truly hope the owners read this review because I have been a very loyal customer to this location, and the chef despite the Ruchi drama. Now I’ve decided to never come back here. If the owners are reading this, please take this seriously and do something about these two because they are running off loyal customers.

resp.text: Hi Caleb I appreciate the review and your experience at the restaurant. We spoke to the staff about their behavior and their attitude towards our customers. We gave them a verbal warning regarding their service towards you and your family. Just give us one more chance so that next time you come to the restaurant you can have a good and better experience. Hope to see you soon.

name: RalphFLA
text:
I have never eaten in a real Indian restaurant before--just a couple of small take-out stands in large cities.

The person with whom I was dining has had experience dining in Indian restaurants so I followed his lead and my own instincts based on what type of food I generally like.

One of my favorite foods, and one that I do not often get to eat, is lamb. With that in mind, I decided to try the Lamb Tikka Masala. It was served in a metal bowl. There were a great deal of lamb in the mixture (see the photo). There was also a lot of it. I ate about half of the dish and got a take-out box for the remainder to enjoy it later.

It was a tomato cream sauce with spices harboring a different flavor than I am used to experiencing. It looked like a thick tomato bisque soup and had some tomato flavor but with different spices.

I also had a Naan bread to accompany the dish. It was very much like the pita bread often served in Greek restaurants and had a similar flavor. There were four large slices of bread.

Overall, the meal was very filling.

My dining companion ordered the Tandoori chicken. It is pieces of chicken with yogurt and spices and cooked in a clay oven. I had one of the chicken pieces and liked it very much. Again, a different spice than I am used to having but it tasted good.

The chicken was served on a plate that was sizzling when it came out. Obviously, it was very hot and an impressive presentation with the chicken sizzling rapidly.

For a drink, I ordered Masala Tea. Again, I had never had this tea and ordered it on a whim. It was very good. Strong black tea with milk and spices, probably cinammon and some other spices. It was robust and filling and served hot.

This restaurant is in the back of a shopping center and can be easy to miss. Until we got close, I did not see the sign although we were looking for it.

The meal was tasty and the prices were very reasonable. The servings were generous and many adults will have food left over to take home for another meal.

For those who have not tried Indian cuisine, this would be a good place to start.

resp.text: Thanks Ralph for you good review. We were happy that you had a wonderful experience at this restaurant. Thanks once again for recommending this place to other people. We need loyal customers like you so we can improve on the quality and quantity of food. Hoping to see you again.

name: San
text: Newly opened Indian Kitchen have delicious food, right now they are only doing takeout but owner who is also chef said they will be open for dine in soon.

resp.text: Thanks Santosh for your feedback. We will try to open the dine in soon. Just waiting as a precautionary measure to open the dine in because of the Covid. Till then you can do takeout and enjoy the food.

name: Will Sanders
text: From the moment we walked in, we were treated poorly. It took 15 minutes to even get someone to our table. Several patrons walked out the restaurant due to the lack of service. This should’ve been my first indication. We received our food, the food was ok, but we asked for a few things to be taken off. When the bill came the “manager” said since you “tired the food and drink we can’t take it off”. This makes no sense to me… I swiped my card then she turned the screen and I’m not sure if she tipped her self, or changed the amount. She also forged my signature to be able authorize the purchase. This is not right, and I recommend never eating at this restaurant.

resp.text: Thanks Will for your feedback. We spoke to the staff and gave them verbal warnings about their behavior towards our loyal customers. Don't worry they did'nt overcharge you or took off any tips. Please try to come back again and have a good experience at this restaurant. Hope to see you again.

name: Rebecca Booth
text: All I can say is WOW! I have been to India several times and I can honestly say this is THE MOST Authentic Indian food i have had stateside.  Their fresh ingredients and great prices will definitely have you coming back for more.  Do yourself a favor,  stop and experience the BEST Indian food around. You won't be disappointed!!

resp.text: Thank you Rebecca for your kind words and your good review. Hope it guides other people to our restaurant who are craving for good authentic Indian food

name: grey ish
text:
This is one of the best restaurants in the city. Not one of the best Indian cuisine restaurants, of which there are too few. One of the very best, any cuisine, any style.

We have enjoyed a few very nice Indian restaurants in the area over the years, but they closed down or were sold. We have been craving a place like this and when we saw it was open, we took a chance. Long story short, we we back two days later.

Tried a few different entrees, naan, samosas, and a few cauliflower dishes. The Gobi Manchurian is a real treat. And the samosas with the mint chutney/sauce.... I put the leftover sauce on a sandwich.

This is a bit of a hidden spot but I really hope everyone goes there. They are making amazing food.

resp.text: Thank you for the good review and the 5 stars you gave for the restaurant. Hope your review helps us to get more customers so we can serve them good and authentic food.  Hope to see you soon again.

text: Very rude, I would not recommend. We left without ordering. I will never come here again.

text: Worst restaurant ever. I ordered food for the family and everyone got major upset stomach. I called just now to complain and the girl who answered the phone told me that there are lot of diseases out there and it wasn’t them instead of admitting her mistake. Just to know I wasn’t looking for either a compensation or my money back. Just wanted them to acknowledge.  Please order from here if you definitely want diarrhea

We investigated the case and found out there were so many orders on that day when you ordered but you were the only one whom we learnt had a problem with the food. Maybe it was just a coincidence that you ordered food on that day and we got the blame for it. Anyways give us one more chance and you might give us a good rating next time you visit.

text: I have been waiting for some good Indian restaurants to come to Huntsville. The other options don’t meet my expectations by a long shot. Indian kitchen is your best option in Huntsville by far. Much better flavors, slightly larger portions, and better heat levels. The lamb was hit or miss. Some pieces were tender and moist, but most were dry and chewy. Really wish this restaurant would sell papadums. It’s a very common item to find in Indian restaurants so I’m not sure why they don’t have them. Overall a big step up from the other Indian restaurants. Looking forward to trying many other dishes

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback. Try our other dishes too from the menu. Hope to see you soon.

The butter chicken is exceptional and pairs perfectly with the garlic naan.

name: Lisa GV
text: This is the absolute best Indian food!! We recently moved to North Alabama from Colorado, and I didn't expect to find the most delicious chicken tikka masala, Peshwari naan, and gulab jamun I've ever had right here in Huntsville. The flavor and quality is amazing! This place is well worth the drive for us, and I can't wait to try more items from their large menu. Also, they were open for dinner dine in service tonight (June 26, 2021). I hope more people discover and support this delicious restaurant, as I'd love to see them one day expand and build additional locations in the Madison or Athens areas! :)

resp.text: Thank you Lisa for the best review. Its our pleasure serving your family. Hope to see you again soon in the future.

name: Watching You
text: Wow what can I say . The cook NO he is not a cook he’s maker of art in Preparing Indian food with class Namaste to the chef  found a new home to eat

resp.text: Thanks for your review. Glad you liked our food and made our place your home to eat. You will be always welcome. Hope to see you soon.

name: Katie Duncan
text: The best Indian restaurant in Huntsville. Their butter chicken is amazing!

resp.text: Thank you Katie for the good review. Hope you try other dishes from the menu. All are amazing made from fresh ingredients and locally shopped.

name: Sarah Mayers
text: Best Indian food in huntsville. Get the chicken tikki masala and you won’t regret it 🤌🏼

resp.text: Thanks Sarah for your feedback. Hope you try other dishes from our menu. See you soon.

name: Dylan Lawson
text: Some of the best spicy food I have ever had, excited about this again and again!

resp.text: Thank you Dylan for the good review and we are glad to have you as a regular customer. Hope we keep our good relationship

name: Tanu Singhal
text: Tried this place and it’s awesome. The owner is very friendly.  The food quality is super good and the quantity is just the perfect amount.  They definitely have my business.  I am very picky when it comes to food and this place meets my expectations! Thx  AJ

resp.text: Thanks Tanu for your feedback. And we are glad that we meet your expectations in regards to the food. We try our best to use the local grown fresh ingredients so our customers can get a good taste of the food. Hope to see you soon.

name: James
text:
Easily the best indian restaurant in huntsville.

Portions for the price is exactly what you would expect.

Quality is consistent. Food is rich in flavor as you would expect from indian food.

The chief is clearly passionate and it really does come out in his food. Hope this restaurant keeps its consistency and wish them the best. Give this place a try you won't regret it.

resp.text: Thanks for your feedback. We will try our best to keep up the consistency of the food. Thanks once again James.

name: Matthew B.
text: Rude staff, charged for drink we asked to be sent back, PHYSICALLY snatched my card from me so they could charge it without any sense of hospitality. Terrible service. Hope this place burns.

resp.text: Hi Matthew sorry for the terrible experience you had from our staff. We have taken the necessary action against the staff and we promise you wont be disappointed the next time you come in.

name: Yasmin Baria
text: We ordered takeout twice and the food was delicious, great quality & quantity and authentic. A must try.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to leave your feedback. We hope to see you again.

name: Jeremy Lawson
text: Unfreakinbelievable!!! THIS is the place to go for Indian. Loved when Ruchi was there but since they moved, their food hasn't been as good. Not sure what happened but what they lost, Indian Kitchen found. Hoping Ruchi figures it out but until then, Indian Kitchen is the place for us!

resp.text: Thanks Jeremy for your feedback. We would like to keep up the good work and make sure customers keep coming back. Hope to see you soon.

name: Vanessa Coutinho
text: The best Indian food ever. I would recommend this restaurant as it has quality food with reasonable price also the stuff is super friendly. I had chicken tikka masala, garlic naan, vegetable samosas.

resp.text: Thank you for leaving us a rating of your experience at our business.We hope to see you again.

name: Sam Sungg
text: Impudent staff members. Won’t be back.

name: Sean Kruer (Normal Human Person)
text: Very tasty! Great portions, great flavor!

resp.text: Thank you Sean for the 5 stars and the good review.

name: Nick Rainosek
text: Great food, great service!!

resp.text: Thanks Nick for your good review. Hope to see you soon again.

name: Annika Rettstadt
text:
Indian Kitchen is where it's at!! My boyfriend and I were visiting from out of town and love Indian food, so we decided to order from Indian Kitchen on a whim. We were not disappointed! This is a mom and pop store hidden away in an outlet mall. Please support small and local businesses!

We ordered two vegetarian entrees: Palak Paneer and Paneer Tikka Masala. We also ordered the Mixed Vegetable Pakora appetizer, and a side of Garlic Naan. I will say that this is a LOT of food for two people since the portions were huge (we have days worth of leftovers) and we were served rice to compliment our meals. All of the food was absolutely delicious, and I look forward to returning to Indian Kitchen very soon.

resp.text: Thanks Annika for your feedback. We are glad you and your boyfriend liked the food. Hope to see you soon.

name: Taylor Satula
text:
Really impressed with the food me and my significant other ordered. We got a spread just to try it out and everything we ordered was delicious.

We got palak paneer, panner tikka masala, naan, (a boatload of) rice, mixed vegetable pakora, and it came with mint sauce and tamari sauce.

The paneer was firm with a great mild flavor. You could tell it was made fresh by the firm bouncy texture.

The spinach and the tikka masala sauces were nice and thick. Just the right amount of good spices talking to each other in the sauce.

Naan had great crispy tips and was also clearly homemade

Pakora was KILLER dipped in the mint sauce

I will absolutely be going back to Indian kitchen. It was a little bit hard to find because they don’t have an illuminated sign yet. It has a red curtain draped out front. Staff was very nice and I have nothing but good to say about it,,,,, it was just a really good spot. Glad they’re near my house.

resp.text: Thanks Taylor for the feedback. Now with your comparison we know where we stand. We will try our best to give our best in terms of food. See your soon.

name: Amy Ragan
text:
I was loyal to Ruchi when they were at this location. Tonight my husband and I did a taste taste between the newly-relocated-Ruchi and the newly-opened-Indian Kitchen. We got a medium chicken tikka masala and a garlic naan takeout from both restaurants at the same time.

Indian Kitchen’s curry was thicker and more flavorful, and their chicken looked like it had been nicely charred. Ruchi’s gravy was thin and much more bland, and the chicken was dry and kinda sad looking.

The rice and naan were pretty comparable for both, but Indian Kitchen’s naan was totally loaded up with garlic so it had more yummy garlic flavor.

We did not expect this outcome! We just thought it would be fun to compare. But it looks like we will be returning to Indian Kitchen!

resp.text: Thanks Amy for your feedback and  for the hardwork you and your husband did to compare the food. We will try to keep up the good work and keep the consistency in terms of the food. Hope to see you soon.

name: Lauren Badia
text: Amazing food! We are in love with this place!

resp.text: Thanks Lauren for your feedback. We will try our best to meet your expectations and make sure you keep loving this place. Hope to see you soon.

resp.text: Hi Oscar can you please elaborate the bad experience you had dining here. So we can take the necessary action against whoever did it to you or your family. Hope to see you again soon.

text: I tried there lasagna today and it was amazing! Definite go to place for catering or even family dinners you can pick up and bring home! Excited to try the other casseroles and choices in the future!

text: This place is insanely good.  I'm normally not one for "lunch cafes" but I truly enjoy coming here.  Try anything off of the Clark's Kitchen menu and you will be glad you did!  The food is delicious, the restaurant is clean, service is fabulous, internet is free- what more can I say?  Love it here.  I'll be back tomorrow...again!

name: Doris Lepoma
text: I had Seafood Gumbo, It was just perfect,,,Almost like the Gumbo my husband and my mother-in law makes. It was a welcome treat foe  both me and my son. Also  perfect day to have our lunch outside/sidewalk. The pansies are beautiful.

name: Tommy Evans
text: Walked in to a decent atmosphere, pleasant enough staff, but we waited for 40 minutes for two small orders. I got half of what was ordered, my girlfriend didn't even get hers. And we wound up getting a refund and leaving. Short staffed or no they could have warned us, we wasted an entire afternoon and got nothing for it. Don't eat here. It was just bad.

name: ImUrUncleDaddy
text: Good food, ok prices, fast service, great deserts, and even have take home meals. Take home meals are great being a college student because it's enough to feed me all week. Stop by at least once a week now.

name: Destiny L
text:
I am a long time customer of Camile's, not because of the food, but because it is right next door to campus. I sometimes like to sit and grab a bite between classes. The food is bit bland, but I have never had any problems with my order. One day I did and was treated horribly for the complaint. I ordered the Camile club with no mayo. When I received my sandwich, it had mayo. So, I calmly went back up and explained that I didn't want mayo. I was told it could be fixed.

While waiting on my sandwich, I noticed the staff watching me and speaking quietly, but I ignored it. 5 minutes later I was called back and when I went to check my sandwich again, I noticed the residue from mayo. It looked as if someone had wiped the mayo off and changed the bread. Again, calmly, I went back up (once again noticing the staff snickering) and asked to speak to the manager for a refund. Said-manager whose name I couldn't get, claimed she was there the whole time they "remade" my sandwich and it was fresh. I told her that couldn't be the case because it was now cold, it took her less time to make it than originally and I showed her a piece of lettuce that had mayo in it.

She then rudely asked me if I still had my receipt, which I did. I was given a refund, but I don't appreciate the way I was treated. If I'm paying for a meal, I expect it to made the way I requested it. I didn't ask them to make me a sandwich befitting God. I just didn't want mayo.  I am never stepping foot into that cafe again.

name: donrico browne
text: Love it friendly staff and the food was delicious  prices very affordable  definitely  would dine in again!!! Worth sharing

It looked great, had normal sized shrimp for a restaurant that is not specifically seafood. Will be back. Prices a bit high, but again it's quality food, not fast food.

name: Tara Dixon
text:
Placed an order for anniversary and it was suppose to be delivered today April 16, 2021. When I called the store, worker said it was in transit. Arrangement never arrived.

I expect a full refund first thing in the morning. If they couldn’t provide the service why take my money and then lie like it’s in transit.

Adding insult to injury, Cory Lewis, if that’s even his name called the recipient to say that the delivery address was outside of their delivery zone. However, no one called this morning to say that was the case, and even when I called at 4:49 pm, the woman who answered did not state this, she said the delivery was in transit.

Then to put icing on the cake, Cory Lewis called me to say they tried to deliver the order but the man didn’t expect the order, there was no man at the address all day and someone was literally sitting home waiting on the order all day. Then he tried to add yet another lie to that.

Professionalism and truthfulness is not a big ask when doing business, this placed missed big. I expect a refund and a call from management.

name: Monica Bray-Grant
text: Placed an order on Wednesday for an arrangement to be delivered on Friday for my Mother In Law's birthday. Called Thursday afternoon to see about adding some additional instructions to her delivery. The rep informed me that they are not doing deliveries to Tuskegee that weekend but will deliver to that area next weekend? What kind of business are they running here? No one had even called me to let me know that it was not going to be delivered. Shabby business!

name: Beverly Butler
text: Fabulous and quick service! Order online even if you need delivery for a birthday the next day. I was able to order and have this wonderful gift delivered even though I couldn't be there to celebrate the event. I hope your experience goes as well as mine!

name: Shay G
text: I am 32 weeks pregnant an had a craving for their chocolate covered strawberries. The cashier was extremely rude as I was ordering my 6 strawberries. It had just turned 2pm an she said it would take 20-30 minutes and as I’m looking at the smoothies she tells me we close at 3pm and i don’t have any fruit chopped for smoothies (rolls her eyes and gasps for air). I honestly didn’t appreciate her whole attitude and decided not to even purchase here.

name: Takeya Wilkins
text: I called in to place an order over the phone. My call was answered quickly and professionally. I was not sure what exactly I wanted but the representative gave me multiple options based on the information I provided of who I was sending it to. The call took less than 10 minutes to get me taken care of. I appreciated the expedient service! My mom LOVED her arrangement. The fruit was fresh and actually looked like the photo! I will be ordering again from this store!

name: Michelle
text: Thank you NIKKI for your amazing customer service!! Very well spoken and catered to my edible arrangement needs!!

text: I have used this company multiple times and have found them to be courteous and very professional. All of the deliveries arrived on time and my guests devoured the fruit trays (especially chocolate covered strawberries) before any of the other items!! They create amazing arrangements that I have even used as centerpieces.

text: I love the Opelika location great arrangements and nice staff

name: Sarah Davis
text: If I could give this place less than one star I would. Courtney (the owner) is a consistent liar. He makes promise after promise when confronted and never delivers. If this place stays open for the next 6 months I will be SHOCKED with poor management like that.

name: Tamara Williams
text: Excellent customer service.  Beautiful arrangement. I will definitely order from this store again.

name: Kent Whitaker
text:
Horrible experience. My wife and I are not in Auburn so we chose this company to deliver an arrangement for Valentines Day for my mother-in-law in Opelika. We ordered a higher dollar item other than the lower priced special. Specifically for the reason of having more fruit and less chocolate as we were hoping for something a bit healthier because of health issues. They charged our credit card for the higher priced item we ordered but delivered the lower price special with added chocolate and it was a smaller item. In addition to the wrong item - they did not deliver it on Valentines Day. We called several times and they acted nice at first and promised to deliver the item the next day. Late in the day mom called and said it was never delivered. We called back and it was being delivered late in the day - a day late - and it was the wrong item, not the higher priced one we paid for.

We called again and one of the employees admitted they went to the wrong house on Valentines day so somebody got the higher priced item. My wife called again to at least get a refund for the overcharged amount or to have the right item delivered. We were promised the right item would be delivered. The next day, no delivery.

At this point, several days after Valentines Day my wife gave up so I started calling, was promised a refund or a deliver of the right item. There was no refund or proper delivery. I was then promised at least a call back from the owner, then another promise, another promised call back. I never heard back.

My mother in law never received the correct item and and we never got the refund. We finally tried to cancel payment with credit card and to get a refund but they disputed it - said that the item was delivered. Did not mention that it was the wrong item, and that it was late, missing Valentines Day. I'm sorry that they delivered the item, possibly twice, to the wrong house, and then the wrong item to the right address. That's three deliveries, three trips, three items. However, those mistakes are not our fault. All I know is that my mother in law never received what was ordered.

I would not recommend this company to another person.

I would probably have written a different review if the owner would have called me back as promised by the several employees.

name: C. K.
text: Fresh and on time delivery. Good customer service. I highly recommend this business.

name: Kate Dorsey
text: Placed an order well in advance enough to have delivered on mother in laws birthday, followed the ‘track your order’ the entire day of said scheduled delivery, and it finally changed to “arranging your order now” around lunchtime, and never changed again after that. I called several times, contacted via the live chat and email on website, had an automated reply sent with my “case number” saying I’d be contacted by the store. Never was. 3 days later on Monday I finally got someone on the phone and all she said was “yeah i don’t even what happened with that order haha. Do you want me to send it today?” (Never even got an apology or any type of discount offer or even an explanation) 4 days after her birthday? ummm yeah, no thanks. Never again. WAY too overpriced for quality of product and customer service

text: This was a hidden gem. The food changes daily and they only use fresh, local ingredients. It's southern meat n 3 with a modern flair. At Relish Cafe, the food is so well seasoned and flavorful. I wish it was a meat n 6 because it was hard to pick just 3 of the amazing looking sides. Their fried green tomatoes were the best I've ever tasted.

text: Southern skillet provided catering services for my daughter's wedding reception. I couldn’t be happier. Very professional, superb service and great food. resp.text:
Larry,
Thank you so much! It was our pleasure and it was a beautiful wedding for a beautiful girl!

name: Lauren Watkins
text: Southern Skillet catered my wedding in April and all I can say is WOW! Her food is to die for! I have never had super high expectations for catering services just because I have never had any that was anything more than average, but that is not the case with Southern Skillet! Everything was fabulous! We had pulled pork, smoked chicken, loaded mashed potatoes, gourmet Mac and cheese, and skillet corn - it was all delicious! I had guests coming up to me at my ceremony telling me how GOOD the food was and still do even now! I would definitely use Southern Skillet in the future and 10/10 recommend!

resp.text: Lauren!!! Thank you so much!!!

name: Eric L
text: We had Southern Skillet do our catering for our company Thanksgiving gathering, and the food was great. There was plenty of food to go around and more than enough leftovers. And what we received for the price, you couldn't beat it. They delivered all the food and drinks, and had it there at the time we requested. Thank you so very much, and we look forward to having you cater us again.

name: Kay Clark

name: Becky King
text: April recently catered my son's reversal dinner.  I could not have been more pleased.  I encourage individuals who hire her to listen to her recommendations about food and table arrangements.  April is spot on and knows what she is doing.  Her chicken, beef loin, loaded garlic potatoes, fruit tea and cheesecakes were the best I've had.  I would not hesitate to hire this spunky bundle of energy that is April Davis the next time I need a caterer.

name: B B
text: I have ordered from them several times and they have never disappointed me in their quantity of food in their order and in their quality of food.  I would highly recommend ordering from them!  How much better can it get to take home already cooked good food after a long day at work and enjoy it with your family!!  Definitely give them a try!

name: Teneshia Grayer
text: Thank you so much!!!

name: Cyndi Johnson
text: Southern Skillet has some of the most delicious, tasting food I have ever eaten. It is so nice to be able to drive by, pay, and then have someone place your food in your car! Then we go straight home and eat because it is piping hot and ready to eat! I can’t wait until the new menu comes out each week!

name: Teresa Martin
text:
Was at a wedding on Saturday that was catered by Southern Skillet.
Absolutely. Delicious. I highly recommend.
Y U M M Y

resp.text: Thank you so much Teresa!!!!

Some were saying that it was as good as Harry Potter world's. I later heard they you were given lots of conflicting instuctions from multiple people. They handled it all very well and I did not know during the reception that thing were so chaotic for them until told later by someone helping run everything. Would recomend these guys 1,000 times over.

(I wish he had a name tag so I didn't have to catagorize him by his appearance :) anyway,  Someone should film him building a sub and post it on youtube. I'm sure he would get many hits. It's clear this man is proud of his work and it is reflected in the food quality and cleanliness of the facilty......not to mention this Subway is located in one of the busiest, filthiest, Walmarts in the southern US........Keep up the astounding work!

text: This is such a cool spot.  Great Food.  Wonderful service. If we are ever back over this way... We will definitely be back.  Home style buffet cooking that is the best I tasted in years!

name: Gregorio Castañeda
text: Excellent place to have a good meal for a very reasonable price. They offer a southern style buffet and have a few a la carte options as well. The staff is extremely friendly, making you want to return.

name: Jim Tom Stimpson
text: We went yesterday December 6th. The food was amazing and affordable, great atmosphere! We were served quickly. The chicken and dressing was quality. You could tell it was homemade! The music playing is inspirational. The only complaint I have is the young lady serving us never brought sugar for our coffee. She was a little overwhelmed with many tables. However, I think she couldn't distinguish between sugar and artificial sweetener. She was very apologetic , I'm sure it was a one time thing. We will definitely be back.

name: D Dowell
text: The staff was very polite and sweet.  The place is nice and down home. The food is great if u want something to remind u of going to grannies or the family function.

They may have been running short on servers that day, so that's forgivable. The food wasn't bad, but overpriced. The interior is decorated well. Nice and clean atmosphere.

text: May 11th 4:10pm, young indian woman working the counter, well I say working but she was just sitting in the back eating a sub not paying attention. After ordering a sandwich and chips I asked for a water and even though they have plenty of cups and water in their fountain drink dispenser they refused to let me have water without paying for a drink. I feel like that is the scummiest thing a business can do it shows they only care about profits and don't care about their customers at all. I would never recommend anyone support a business with these kind of ethics and take your business elsewhere. Also even if I did buy a drink refills are .99¢ if I'm not sitting in the 20' - 20' seating area

name: Jasmyne “FatGirlish” bay
text:
I’m so excited this place is open. I’ve seen it on SM with great feedback. I came for lunch and the drive thru was packed. Looks to only one ordering system.
I walked in , entrance is right in front of the cashier and restrooms. I was greeted with someone handing me a take out menu. I began my order by letting them know I had a free sandwich from the app. Yikes things got a little crazy. No one knew how to probably add my coupon code. The coupon code is timed after you hit redeem so it actually disappeared. But no worries the time got me set with my cayenne ranch chicken sandwich meal. Jared was very nice taking my order and my food came out quick! The sandwich was amazing. Very light spice. The Buffalo wings are really goodThe fries was seasoned pretty while too! I really enjoyed this place great new option on skyland.

Delicious food.

But still 5 start

name: M S
text:
I had been waiting for this location to open for a while as this is one of my favorite fast food chicken places to eat and it didn’t disappoint.

Since this was opening day, hiccups were expected, but overall the restaurant was running smoothly.  The staff are very friendly and the old came out quickly.  The food was delicious and staff members came by multiple times to check on us.  Highly recommend slim chickens for their great chicken as well as an abundance of sauces and sides. Will be back soon.

text: Best wings ever!  Love the potato salad too!  Would definitely recommend the garlic Parmesan and the cayenne ranch sauces!

Update Edit: Next time in the service was fine. If I initially had this experience I’d have given 4 stars. As it is I’m upping my rating from 1 to 3

resp.text: Weston, thank you for the feedback, and I regret that this was your experience. This is not our Dickey's standard. Please reach out to me at socialmedia@dickeys.com so that we may learn more of your visit and can address these issues. Thank you, Ann, Social Team.

text: I can't believe the bad comments I read. This place food is great. Some say it's pricey. They have good deals each day and anywhere in town BBQ is expensive. It's very reasonable here and the customer service is great.

text: A little pricey, but the food is a solid 9 out of 10. Perfect pulled pork, excellent sauces, jalapeno beans are kinda thick & really tasty. Good comfort food!

name: Sharon Sparks
text: I visited in your place of business on 02/16/2019 @ 6pm and ordered a small bbq sandwich, the individual that waited on me was very rude, didn't greet with any friendliness, just complained they had been busy all day. As he began preparing my sandwich, I noticed the bun was really small, I questioned that and it was told they were store bought and that the normal buns were frozen, so I said why charge the same amount for a smaller sandwich, and he stated to me after I ask for my money back, that he would give me two, okay then he stopped making my sandwich and didn't even explain that he would be back in a minute and when I looked around the corner he was standing there on his cell phone, and used only one glove to continue, I said shouldn't you have on two gloves, he stated I didn't feel like putting the other on. So I ask him did they not put onions on the sandwiches anymore,  and he stated yes, so he grabbed a knife that had been hanging on the wall, so I thought he was going to clean it, it was already dirty, I said are you going to clean that, he stated to me, very nasty, its what I have used all day, I said, I don't care, don't use it on my food, he then he got mad and stated to the other employee who was standing there, finish this order and then I really wanted my money back, He stated he didn't want to fool with the register, so I ask for corporate number, and he stated I am corporate, I stated okay, but I am going to take this further than you, I took those sandwiches and fed them to my dog. Its awful nasty in the 69S Tuscaloosa, Al Dickeys, the cashier was nice, and very apologetic, and I thanked him and he was a younger male,

resp.text: mattie, thank you for the feedback, and I regret that this was your experience. This is not our Dickey's standard. Please reach out to me at socialmedia@dickeys.com so that we may learn more of your visit and can address these issues. Thank you, Marin, Social Team.

This place typically runs out of everything, so go early if you go at all. And dont be suprised if something is left out of your togo bag- has happened twice before- which is why I checked on the roll this time!

They need to work on training and consistent quality.

First time here, and I love this place. Awesome service, food, and the atmosphere is amazing. On top of that, they have bands outside on Fridays all summer long and have beer and a bar!

name: Dale Krebs
text:
Wow, this place has really made the difference in facilities since last business at this location. Inside and out is very nice. Bathrooms were clean. The dinning area was retro-arcade style. New everything. The cashier was friendly.
Food was ok...I think the pizza tested like grocery store freezer isle lower shelf pizzas (like Tony's). Thin crust. Very few pepperonis. They do have garlic butter dipping sauce.
Prices are high compared to pizza hut or dominoes. But they do have a wide selection of menu items: soups, sandwiches, pizzas and more.

resp.text: I'm sorry you didn't like your pizza!  Please drop by anytime and have another on me but you definitely should try it with our white sauce - that is my favorite with meat pizzas  ;-) We recently removed the day manager because I wasn't quite happy with the small portions on the sandwiches and pizzas.  Hope you will try us again! K

name: Chelsea Madren (OC Food Diva)
text:
Bruschetta made with a balsamic reduction, tomatoes, basil, and garlic atop crostini. Fresh, juicy tomatoes burst with sweetness along with pungent garlic. The sweetness and acidity of the balsamic add another layer of flavor and fresh basil turns it up with herbaceous flair. Rating: 4.5/5

Brie and Marmalade Bites starts with a phyllo cup filled with orange marmalade, brie, and herbs. It is a light bite and would be great as a passed hors d’oeuvre for a wedding or corporate event. The creamy brie combined with the sweetness and citrus flavor of the marmalade pair perfectly together. Rating: 5/5

Caesar Salad is made with fresh romaine lettuce tossed with house-made Caesar dressing with anchovy. I love Caesar salad but it is very hard to find a place that makes it correctly. If you do not like anchovies, do not order a Caesar salad. It is just not a Caesar salad without it. Chef David makes a great Caesar salad dressing, not too thin and not too thick. The perfect viscosity to cling to the lettuce. I love that Chef David makes a crostini seasoned with butter, salt, and pepper instead of chunky, clunky croutons. It’s easier to eat and elevates the salad as well. Chef David, you need to bottle and sell that dressing! Rating: 5/5

Chicken Marsala is made with mushrooms, shallots, garlic, and parsley served over angel hair pasta. The chicken gently bathes in the sauce and really infuses the flavors into the chicken. It is tender and unlike any chicken marsala I’ve ever had. But that sauce is like liquid gold. It clings to the angel hair pasta like silk sheets. You can’t help but lick the plate afterwards. I could see this on a fine dining establishment’s menu. It is so refined and delicious! Rating: 5/5

Chocolate Fondant (Americans refer to this as a chocolate lava cake or molten chocolate cake) is basically a bi-product of a flourless chocolate cake and a soufflé. Chef David served his with macerated strawberries and strawberry coulis. If you go to my Instagram, I have a video of the chocolate “lava” flowing from the cake. I have tried many of these in my lifetime, but I think this was the best. I don’t know if it was because I had right out of the oven but it was just amazing! The perfect ending to a perfect meal! Rating: 5/5

name: George Weber
text: We had a personal chef evening with David and Tillie. The experience could not have been better, and the four course meal was awesome. They were prompt, professional and exceptionally patient with our slightly rowdy crowd. We can't wait to hire them again next year.

resp.text: It was nice to see you both yesterday.  Thank you for everything and Happy Thanksgiving to you all!

name: TingTing S
text:
This company cancelled the catering for our event on the day prior to the event, without so much as a courtesy phone call.

We tried to use this service to book a private dining experience. We booked the date and spoke about the menu on the phone on 10-18 and received an invoice for the cost on 10-19. The due date on the invoice was 10-21, the date of the event. I tried to pay it on 10-20, but the invoice was already deleted and our event cancelled.

As per their policy, events must be paid in full 10 days prior to the event unless agreed upon in writing. Being that I received an electronic invoice with a due date of 10-21, I had believed this to be the "in writing" agreement that the policy referenced.

I had no reason to doubt the date listed on the invoice and the owner didn't mention anything else about invoice due dates during our previous phone call. Upon inquiry, they stated that the reason for cancelling our event was because we hadn't paid the invoice, despite it not being yet due. On top of this, they didn't have the courtesy of giving me a phone call to tell me that they cancelled, despite the invoice not being yet due!

This is incredibly inconvenient as it leaves me no time to find an alternative caterer.

Do not rely on this team for your events unless you are willing to tolerate a last minute cancellation due to their poor management and communication.

resp.text: We at OBC provided our guidelines and policies to the client multiple times, contacted the client via email and also via text to try and resolve.  We have also made a recommendation for an additional group to complete and provide services requested.  This is a very unfortunate situation.  We have not heard back from the inquiry and can only hope that she has received the services she has requested from our recommendation.

I looked over at subway and seen they had their own drink dispenser marked subway customers only, I was at the point where I would pay their price for Ice just so I would not have to drink black mold. I pushed my cup against it to fill with ice and wow disgusting the same thing, black chunks in the Ice. I threw my cups away and decided to leave. Would give negative stars if I could. Very nasty place. Will never be back. If the Ice looks that way I could only imagine how the food is stored at this location. name: Shawn Bowman (Shasas)
text: Stopped by to ge a sandwich on my lunch break and was met by an older lady who was busy helping another customer, ok fine. She looks over and says " push that button as soon as your ready" to which I replied "sure thank you". Well I was having a difficult time deciding on my sandwich as I eat here alot and have had almost every combination you could think of. Well there was no one behind me and in fact hardly anyone in the store but while I was debating with myself the lady reaches up and pushes the button herself and another older lady comes from the back I immediately inform her I was not ready and did not push the button and the first lady says " well you was just standing there". I declined to patronize this establishment after this as I do not like to be rushed by the employees of someplace that's supposed to be serving ME not the other way around. Now things like this have happened here before these ladies are always working together and one is nice and the other is not. The one that is not often times has smart things to say or is very rude and short with customers and today I just wasnt having it. I understand your elderly but if you cant handle customer service you should perhaps find another job. It's because of this unprofessional attitude that this lady has on everyone of my visits that I will NOT be returning as a customer , possibly all subways but most definitely this one.

name: Caleb Hawn
text: I absolutely LOVE Subway. This specific Subway location is definately no exception. It's located inside of the Wavaho gas station, so you can buy more then what they sell at Subway, so you can get a candy bar or anything else to go with your meal instead of only chips. Don't get me wrong, though; I do enjoy their chips. I also love the avacado/guacamole season, which happens every summer. I LOVE their avacado and guacamole sandwhich toppings. You can choose any toppings you want, or just order something on the menu. I almost never order from the menu. I just choose exactly what I want my sub to be, which is what Subway's all about. I love this location because it's like right near my house, so it is really convenient for mybfamily and I to order take out. If you want to eat IN the place, they do have a single two-peeson table you can eat at. If you are passing by this nice building, you can stop by and get some Subway, as well as anything else they sell at a gas station/car oil place. Thank you for reading my review of this unique Subway location, and I hope that I could help you choose weather or not to visit it. Thanks!

Asked her to manually enter the price and was told that couldn't be done.  Asked for her to ring up a similarly priced item instead.  Was told very rudely "No".

name: John Doe
text: If you are using coupons at this location don’t even bother. We had a 100% valid coupon for Buy 1 Get 1 Free Footlong and were told no Subway locations are accepting the coupons that they are advertising. We were told every Subway in the area will also not accept the coupon because it’s too good of a deal. It’s almost as if Subway is advertising the coupon and telling their employees not to honor the coupon after the sandwiches are made so the customer winds up paying full price because they are already there. We said absolutely not and they threw away both sandwiches in front of us. Instead of making money off the Buy 1 Get 1 coupon, they just threw away 2 perfectly good sandwiches and made no money. Absolutely ridiculous waste of food and time.

name: Jessica Brown
text: Wow the two girls at the meat, bread and cheese end were so rude. First of all they didn’t look up or speak to me until they were good and ready. Once the one who took my order did, she acted like it was not only a bother and irritation, but if we didn’t have a bar in between us, that she would actually pounce on me. They were preparing a platter upon arrival and I guess they were so out of sorts about it they thought we will take it out on our customers & only kind employee that was there. The poor girl at other end that put toppings on and checked you out was extremely nice and did her job well. The other two scolded her and treated her like she was incompetent. I’m surprised she wasn’t in tears clearly they were frustrated with her as well, however I’d much rather have someone like her mess my order up than either of these girls touch my food again. The girl was counting my change out slowly so I left the tip on counter and walked over to drink station. One of the other girls came down and jumped on the girl asking in a bullying tone “what’s this?” I spoke up & answered and told the sweet girl to keep her head up and a smile on her face. Other two girls snickered, said something and laughed not in a happy laugh but condescending. I wish the poor sweet girl didn’t have to split the tip with the two mean girls. Whoever owns this location should be ashamed of themselves if they keep these other two girls on staff. I’m sure they will team up in defense together but I urge the owner to think hard before believing a word out their mouths.

We were getting 6 subs and cookies...so we walked out and went to Subway on Perdido Blvd. instead. They were super nice and very helpful. We are local and will never go back there again!

I saw the time on the door said they didn’t close until nine so I asked why they were closed and he said because we want to. Won’t ever be back here again.

name: Amanda Lord
text: First of all, both employees  Were supposed to be wearing masks. They were, but they were both wearing them below their noses. Good job guys. Not! Both employees were rude, one kept running the cash register with the same gloves she would handle food with. I asked for a chopped salad- my meat was NOT chopped up. She was going to give me cold bacon I had to ask for it to be heated up. I asked about dressing and the one employee rudely ignored me and  gave me my total for my salad. I paid and she was putting gloves on again getting ready to serve the next customer and I again asked about salad dressing. She sighed and said ‘well there should be some in there (there wasn’t) but what kind do you want?’ I told her and she threw the packet in there and slung my bag at me. Get back to eat my salad at work and the meat isn’t even chopped up. Not only were their attitudes poor (no ‘hi how are you, what can i get for you today’ or ‘thanks have a good day’ just rudeness. The freezer door was also open the entire time I was there. Im sure there are more than several health code violations mixed in all that. I worked at subway in high school and I know the masks aren’t fun but I work in healthcare so I have to wear them all day every day too. And if I would have acted the way those two ladies did today I would’ve been fired. No matter what job you have do it to the best of your ability. Shame on whoever the manager is for letting this go on. I WILL NOT be back. And I will also tell everyone I know not to use this store either.

name: James R
text: Well, I've tried to post a review 3 times now but it keeps getting taken down. I guess Subway doesn't want people to know about the lazy employees, (line of 5 people while one girl makes sandwiches and runs register. wow.) letting their kids, not only come to work with them (no big deal), but let them in the back while they go through touching EVERYTHING. Then, I swear, almost systematically touching, wiping hands on face and moutch and nose, and touching ALL the food in the back that was to be brought up front. What's really concerning is the fact that they keep taking this down, why don't you handle the situation at work instead of trying to cover it up? Disgusting.

When I looked at the receipt I was right, each sandwich had an Extra 25 cents tacked on, no not alot, I know but, that is the same as stealing...check your receipt if you go there, I wont be back. If someone lies about one thing they will lie about another and can't be trusted.

name: Don Orlando
text:
I purchased a plastic box of cheese straws from Gigi's Fabulous Foods at the Eastchase Farmers' Market today, 02 July. I was a little put off by the high price ($15.00 for about 40 straws==that's about 37 cents a piece!). I can make my own for about $6 and, while I don't have to account for my time and profit, that price is very steep. Still, I thought, they should be great tasting.

They weren't. They were dry, as if they had been baked perhaps two weeks ago. And, at first, they didn't taste like anything. But there was noticeable metal, toxic, aftertaste.

I want Gigi's to succeed. So please let me make these suggestions. Put out a small sample. Let people taste. Of course, you'll have tasted them yourselves first to be sure they are more than good. They have to be very good.

And post the price right up front! No matter how good they are, you'll get a sense for what the customers want.

If customers face an unexpected price after they've agreed to buy, you have embarrassed them. They won't be back. But they will let their friends know.

If you just can't make a profit at $15 a box, drop the line.

The damage this product is doing to your brand is just too high a price to pay.

Then I get back to work and find that my food was undercooked (still bleeding) when I asked for well done. The gentleman that was the manager condoned her remarks as she is just young. Well sir my young children come in there to eat and I am utterly applaud that you stand behind her remarks. I will never spend my money at this restaurant simply because of the manager and the way he handled this situation. So I missed my lunch and had to do without. THANK YOU! Word of mouth is the best compliment, to bad you left me with only negativity.

text: At the start the service was questionable. We're getting seated and the first table she wanted to seat us at was directly in front on entry way of kitchen. Second spot  was directly next to a couple. Mind you the place was very unpacked maybe 10 guest at best 5 of 10 were at the bar when we got there. The table  had not been wiped clean. The whole area had not been clean since whoever left. It was so slow that the associates were  just standing around talking . The bathroom  looked like a club bathroom on a Saturday night at 2am. Floors were very sticky for some reason. Like when you go to a club and its really hot  and people have wasted alcohol and it's been trampled on. NOW the food was good but the chicken strips and 2 sides was very over price at $13! Three strips fries  and a small  dish  salad. Strips and fries were good tho. I got the Nashville Hot Chicken with two sides.  That was a whole chicken breast and wing for $10 and change. It was very good. Now our waitress was a different story. She was unenthusiastic and very dry. We had completely  ate our food but she had the nerve to ask if we wanted to-go boxes. Um... for the crumbles of curly fries ??? She also didn't check on us till after  we were 80% done eating.

name: Derek Jones
text: Cool venue with plenty of 📺 for whichever sport you prefer. The new Nashville got spice chicken menu is delicious!

name: Maryah Payton
text: I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!!! Been going here since I was younger and my favorite are the gooey fries and honey bbq wings! Fast service, good food, nice environment!

name: Michael
text: Meh....I walked in right to place a to-go order for a Nashville hot chicken platter as they were opening for the day. I was told that they didn't have any chicken halves so I had to get the tenders. I took a seat at the end of the bar to wait on my food. The bartender (a very petite brunette) never acknowledged my presence. I would have had a cold beer while I waited to no avail, she was too preoccupied with her cellphone which she had hooked up charging next to the register. (Who shows up for work at 11am and has to charge their phone?) I suppose I may return one day due to the chicken being pretty good but that bartender should understand her personal phone takes a back seat to anyone who sits at the bar. I'm sure she saw me it would have been impossible to miss me. Everyone else was fairly pleasent. Took off 2 stars for not having what I wanted and the unattentive bar keep on duty that day.

name: Sasha Thatcher
text: The service was good and the staff was friendly.  We didn't have to wait long for our food.

name: It's A Lonely Walk
text: Excellent fish sandwich and don't leave without trying the fried banana pudding it's delicious!

name: Matthew Rhodes
text: Great fresh food. Better in quality than Baumhower's. Unfortunately they lost the rights to Baumhower's recipes though

name: Gudrun Raudharr
text: Andy is awesomesauce and the food is good too. Ocktoberfest Sam Adams for the win. Our new regular spot for Friday nights.

name: Shayne Lovitte
text: Been going here forever. Love the daytime servers. Food is always good and if something goes wrong, they fix it.

text: We come every Sunday.  Everything we ordered in the past is not on menu any longer.   On 1/3/2015 had to wait 10 minutes for a booth when there were plenty available.  Had to wait 30 minutes for two salads.  Needless to say will not come again.

text: The steak was fantastic!! Definitely going back when I'm in the area on business.

name: BILL J
text: Absolutely the worst service I have ever seen, we had a party of 15, there was not many people there it took 15 mins. to get a beer, and it was hot, mgr said oh they have only been in the cooler for 30 mins, so brought out draft beer, I was charged $ 4.45 a glass and nothing was done to ajust that ,, my wife s drink came out with bugs in it, and the food sucked as well, the owners need to fired the entire staff starting at the top on down, I hope the board of health comes by there very soon...

Also, we went on a Sunday and my son was able to eat free and he was pleased with his food as well. Whenever I'm in Tuscaloosa I am definitely going there again!
