text: 2 stars because the strawberries were good. What wasn’t were the flowers received. They were more dead than alive when picked up. Picked up from the store. They are already over  priced and then to look like this, never again. I will not be back for strawberries or flowers after this. Pictures will be added.

name: Tariq
text: My order couldn't be completed in the manner I ordered it, and it also couldn't be delivered either. All that considered, these guys are outstanding at heart. I got some seriously bad news while standing in the store, and the employee went out of his way to make sure that I received no more negativity while in that establishment. The order was emaculent.

name: TDB
text: Sad and pitiful. I'm embarrassed that these were delivered to a friend from me. Nothing like the pictures online. I visited the store to complain and she saw nothing wrong with them; however,  I did receive a refund.

name: Diana SSuarez
text: Terrible customer service. There was a delivery that should have been made on February 14, 2021. The delivery was never made. No one has called about the delay. I have tried to call multiple times and no one answers. When I check online for the status of the order it says that they are "preparing it". I am really baffled by the lack of communication and professionalism from this store.

name: Henry McElreath
text: I use the website to order.  It is easy and quick. There is a huge selection of fruits and candies.  They deliver when they say they will and my friends are always happy with their baskets.

name: Andrew Phelps
text: Do not rely on their delivery. I ordered for my wife's birthday to be delivered to her workplace. It finally just made it... as they've packed up for the day. Silly me, i thought ordering a week in advance would be enough time for them to figure out how to deliver to a business

resp.text: Andrew, we apologize. Our mission is to always deliver the best possible customer service experience and we’re so sorry we fell short. We want to make this right. Please send us your order information at orderteam@edible.com.

name: Ruth Dailey
text: Placed an order to be delivered on Thursday and 3 days later had not arrived. Nobody answer the phone!

name: Allison
text: They were not even PLANNING to deliver my "SAME DAY DELIVERY" order until TWO DAYS LATER and did not even reach out to let me know. No phone call, no email, nothing. I even paid extra to have same day delivery. What the heck?? I had to call them to find out what was going on. Worst. Customer. Service. EVER. Will never order from here again. WOW.

name: S D
text: Horrible customer service, specifically on 23 Feb 21.  I’m on military orders in DC.  Ordered VDay gifts for my mom and daughter.  They failed to deliver my order for VDay, understandably due to weather.  Spoke to them twice patiently thru the week.  Was told they could deliver it on 21 Feb.  never happened.  Called today and was told “we’re working on orders and calls from yesterday, we can work yours tomorrow.”  I ordered before yesterday...I called before yesterday.  Finally just requested a refund and the girl said done and hung up on me.  She failed to refund both my orders so I had to call back.  Outstanding customer service.

name: Chelsea E
text: Horrible customer service at the huntsville area!! My parents never received their arrangement after i placed the order well over two weeks ago! I was told by a staff member that it was on the way at 3pm and now (7pm) I've been on hold for the last twenty minutes trying to figure out where it is! after reading all of these reviews, im convinced there's a truck driver somewhere eating lots of delicious fruit and chocolate... Can I please just have a refund?

name: Ann West
text: Half of my daughters Birthday delivery (from her Military Sister )came apparently the chocolate dipped bananas weren’t ready and were supposed to be delivered before 4pm. They never delivered them and will not answer the phone ! I DO NOT APPRECIATE MY ARMY DAUGHTER THAT IS DEPLOYED AT THE MOMENT AND SENT HER SISTER A GIFT BEING CHARGED FOR ITEMS THAT WERE NOT DELIVERED! That’s theft !

name: David Carr
text: Ordered on 2 occasions, both orders incorrect. The cookies they sent this time looked like they had already been picked over by rats, and their phone is ALWAYS BUSY. same as last year. Never again.

name: Rose Marie
text: Excellent surprise and beautifully displayed!

name: M. Alexa
text:
My order was not delivered after the staff told me it would be. They ruined a surprise I planned for my son and his family. I called the store for a second time and they had closed. I am beyond disappointed and have left multiple messages asking for a refund.
Update: Eventually delivered the following day.

name: Jet Jones
text: The owner of this location is magnificent! He made sure my  Mother's Day order was correct, even with the high volume of orders,  wonderful customer service. Very polite, store very clean. 100% satisfied. Would definitely recommend this location.

name: Haley
text: I just ordered an early Mother’s Day edible arrangement two days ago. They called me when it was ready in case I wanted to pick it up early. When I got there, it looked great! They were extremely nice and gave me some ideas to keep the chocolate covered strawberries in good shape for my 15 min drive home in a hot car. I hadn’t even thought about that, so it was very nice for them to mention. I will be ordering from them again in the future.

name: Linda Bellamy
text: I usually call for special occasions for my husband. The arrangements are nicely done and it’s eaten within 3 days. Delivery is not always dependable, but the workers are courteous.

name: Collin Walker
text: Terrible customer service and my order was never delivered, they barely answer the phone and never reached out to me about my undelivered order.

name: B. Christine
text:
Update:  Feb 2, 2018

So after a year of not ordering an Edible Arrangement I decided to give them another try! This time I was blown away by the EXCELLENT service I received!!! The manager MARK is the epitome of a great manager with EXCELLENT customer service.  I had an arrangement scheduled to be delivered this morning 2/2/2018 to a business for an individual, but the individual decided not to go to work that day to my dismay. However, Mark said "No worries, we will send it out on Monday, don't let that upset you!"  He is such a great example of what managers should be!! I will support his store from here forward!

August 2016
I placed an order online fairly early in the day and the delivery was not made until very close to the time the recipient was getting off for the day. I was told it would be delivered between 1-3pm and I get a call a 330p stating it was just out for delivery! I don't understand why there is only 1 driver. The next time I'll just go pick it up myself to avoid such a terribly long delay in delivery!

name: Dana Edwards
text: Fruit was good but we did not receive all that we ordered. I paid over 100 dollars for a bouquet AND a box of chocolate dipped strawberries. Only the bouquet arrived. And they have not been answering their phone all day. Very disappointed.

name: Andrea “Dre” Mason
text: Terrible customer service when I called in to place an order on Valentine's day. The employee who answered was very unprofessional

name: Brian Moore (Armyballer)
text: Not a bad place, prices were a bit more than expected but I had no idea going in.  Fruit was amazing.

name: Austin Pifher
text: First arrangement was done ahead of schedule so I could pick up earlier in the day, fruit was fresh and delicious. Also I had a free voucher that had expired by a few days but the manager still honored it and had this arrangement done within the hour. Both positive experiences, definitely recommend this location!

name: Wabi Sabi
text:
The service and arrangement were great. I explained to the guy over the phone what i needed and he had the perfect "Get Well Soon" gift ready to go by the time i got there to pick it up.
[Full disclosure: I didn't give this location 5 stars because i was on hold for a bit longer than i cared to be.]

name: Elizabeth Vance
text: My daughter place an order for me of cover chocolate strawberries for Valentine’s Day pick up was 12:00 on the 14 got there at 12:30 the place was crazy and the people working didn’t know what was going on the order was not ready and said to come back because they were still working on orders for pick up at 9:30 really is 12:30 anyways came back at 4:00 pm waited another 30 minutes while there there was people in the back at least 10 doing nothing but talking one rude person in the front who had no customer service at all finally got my strawberries they were saggy and tasted old will not order go there or have anyone order there again

name: Susan Redwine
text: I received an arrangement of dark chocolate fruit on Sept 26, 2014. Everything was fresh and delicious!  And the balloon that came with the gift is still flying proud on Oct 15, 2014. I will use them every time I have to send a gift.  Fabulous!!!!

name: Linda Ridgeway
text: I HAD THE CHOCOLATE COVERED STRAWBERRIES TODAY AND THEY WERE THE BEST I EVER HAD! THANKS TO THE ENTIRE STAFF!

name: Jennifer Hodges
text: Highly pleased!  Walked in store wanting a quick edible arrangement made & a few other pieces for teacher appreciation gifts!  Service was made a with a smile in no time at all!!

name: Randolph Russell Jr.
text: Great customer service, product and location.  I'd recommend to everyone!

name: Jonathan Andrus
text:
Can I give zero stars? Poor delivery time, quality was poor, and to top it off items were missing from the arrangement. DO NOT ORDER FROM THIS LOCATION. $100 for a deflated balloon, sour strawberries, and missing items from the arrangement. A very disappointing Valentines.

Update: They refunded my money which was a pleasant surprise. I'm still not convinced I'd order from here again though.

name: William Brinkley (Ben)
text: They have very tasty and beautiful looking Arrangements. Pretty neat concept.

name: marquetta tatum
text: Mark, you are AWESOME! Thank you for your wonderful Customer Service! God bless you! :)

name: John Gray
text:
First, hand salute!!! The service was amazing, ordered same day delivery, took a look at fine print, and it clearly stated "delivery date and time not guaranteed, call store," so i called the store and was very impressed with service.

Second, the test...i ordered one from the university and whitesburg (neither knew), both same day, both same order, going to same address. Well, i am proud to say, make sure you order from whitesburg store. University did not have the same quality in fruit, even my 4 year old could tell, and some strawberries they shouldnt have used at all.

Thanks again Whitesburg store really enjoyed the arrangement and service.

name: Waldemar Ramirez
text: Bad experience. Made an order online to have it delivered on ST. Valentines day, did not happened. I called the store to ask about what happened, since I asked my wife about it and my wife said she did not received anything. So of course I am disappointed, I made the order , and hoping that while I was out of town, this would be delivered to her. No other details were offered to me, other than just " delivery was unsuccessful "... I know it was unsuccessful, duuhh!  So I asked for a complimentary delivery , the lady completely ignored my request and processed a refund. Which is ok, but you lost a client and possibly more than just me... I would not do no more business with edible arrangements , or at least with this store. Would not recommend you do any business with them.

name: Jessica White
text:
After ordering an arrangement for my mother and learning that she never received it on the intended date of delivery (Friday, Feb. 12), I called the store multiple times and was unable to reach them. After finally calling corporate I was told that the order would absolutely be ordered, likely by 9 PM (unacceptable in itself).
After it still went unreceived and I filed a formal complaint on Saturday, I was informed that they would likely be open that day due to the holiday weekend and my order would *probably* be delivered that day. Again, my delivery went unreceived.
Sunday, I called the store all day, always reaching a busy tone, but felt confident that the company would at the very LEAST deliver my order first thing that morning, despite it already being two days late. No such luck.
FINALLY today, three days after my intended delivery date, I was able to get ahold at someone at the store and let them know that I was displeased to say the least, and would like my order to still be delivered but would like the delivery fee refunded, as it did not arrive the day it should have. The person on the phone then said he cancelled my order completely (although I have yet to receive a refund), rang up another order, and charged my card AGAIN for the amount of the basket. By now, there has been $200+ worth of charges put on my card. But hey, they offered to give my mom a free box with 6 chocolate strawberries to make up for it.
After speaking with my mother, we decided to cancel the entire order and, YET AGAIN after not being able to get ahold of anyone at the store for several hours, I called corporate and asked to cancel my order and was informed not only did they have absolutely no record whatsoever of my 2nd purchase (even thought they were more than happy to charge my card earlier today), MY ORIGINAL ORDER HAD BEEN CANCELLED BY SOMEONE ON THE DAY IT WAS SUPPOSED TO BE DELIVERED. I was informed that I should try to get in contact with someone at the store (as if it's so easy) and my complaints would be passed on to the manager. This experience was absolutely DEPLORABLE as far as customer service goes and I am extremely disappointed with the lack of effort to correct the situation.

name: Keith Richards
text: Super friendly and the driver was fantastic with delivering my wife's basket to work I was very pleased will be back for other occasions!!!! THUMBS UP

name: Vernon T. Mccants
text: Very very nice staff and made my 1st visit awesome. Make me want to buy everybody chocolate dipped strawberries.

name: Dawn Todd
text: Ordered on line to deliver on Dec 23..they never deliver the 90.00 arrangement when I called on Saturday they were closed...the customer service rep.. said iam sorry but there really nothing they can do other then refund the money...ok so they send us tons of offers via email and text ...but can not guarantee your order to be delivered...to me this is one of the worst stores there is they can not do the orders right ...will never order from them again ....as a retail manager...you want a happy customer they come back ...all I am reading on here is how poor service is this stores name...ordered Sherri berry's instead I know she will get it on time...

name: Sedohra Spears
text: This store is amazing and honor customer's birthdays.

name: Robert Smalley
text: Blown away with the delivery excuses.  Two days after the delivery date we get strawberries that are inedible

name: Southern Flavor 2 Seven Selma,Al

name: Bannhen's Southern Que BBQ
text: Horrible. Will never even Consider them again not even for 99.9% discount. Ruined my Anniversary/Valentine's Day 2017.

name: Anthony P.
text: Visited these guys today. Had the Willis Burger and Truffle fries, wow, delicious. Highly recommend this place. Best tasting lunch from a truck you will ever have.

name: Stu F
text: I enjoy everything shindigs has to offer. The people are always friendly and helpful. The entire menu is delicious, from the truffle fries to the catfish bou rolls. Thanks for all the great food.

name: Kay Roney
text: Attended a party catered by Shindigs.  Over the top.  The most creative and delicious appetizers and cocktails and a superbly prepared meal!

name: Courtney Harkness
text: Tried asking for a quote to cater a small party (150-200 people) and just told us they weren't interested in helping...

name: Carrie Rollwagen
text:
Shindigs is incredible. I normally get a burger and truffle fries because they're so delicious, but I've also had other things on the menu, including salad, and everything I had showed a really good balance of flavors and was really unique. This is the kind of food that is where cravings come from -- I've been known to leave my desk during an incredibly busy day at work just because I saw Shindigs tweet their menu.

Shindigs is a food truck, but they do provide everything you'll need to enjoy your meal: napkins, flatware, drinks, and a picnic table. (You may want to scout out more seating if the table is full, of course.)

They also do a fantastic job at catering -- I've been known to sneak more than a couple mini grilled cheese sandwiches off of caterer trays when they weren't looking just to have one more bite. I'm not proud of this, but it's just that good.

name: Alex
text: While I didn't enjoy the meal I got from their food truck (I belive their cook just got a bit heavy handed with the salt), I did enjoy the quick and efficient customer service I got once I wrote a review to them. The company apologized and returned my money. I would definitely try it again. I believe the nachos would have been delicious had it not been for the extra saltiness.

resp.text:
Thank you, again, for your constructive criticism!!! We would LOVE to see you again soon!!!
-The Shindigs Crew

name: Glen White
text: Great menu choices

name: Matt Johnson
text: Ran into this gem at Railroad Park.

name: Priscilla Thompson
text: I need the accual person in charge to contact me about an employee

name: jacqueline isbell
text: Whitney (the manager) was extremely rude for no reason. Very bad service, will avoid going here. ☺️🖤

name: Belyrus
text: The people is so kind! And they has good price and good food

name: Leslie Simmons
text: The staff is rude and does not complete the orders correctly. This is the only Subway in the area that several people I know and my self have had continuous problems with. It is honestly one of the worst Subways I have went to and that's including the other states I have lived in.

text: Fast and Efficient Sub's are Great!!!! Just Wish They would Carry Capicola Ham for the Spicy Italian Sub. Great Prices Also!!!

text: Chef Demonica was very professional and helpful in assisting me with my catering order. She delivered earlier than the sheduled time. The food was delicious!!! We are be using Potz & Panz for our next catering event! Thanks Chef Demonica and staff!!

resp.text: Thanks for your business and support...

name: Terrience Pugh
text:
One of the best restaurants in the world.
Hands down.

resp.text: Thanks for everything and your support...

name: Jacob Bowman
text: The wife and I had upset stomachs afterwards but the food was good and the service was great.

resp.text: I’m sorry that you had a upset stomach I wonder were it came from. Thanks for the feedback

name: sandra herrington
text: This is some deeeeeelicious Southern soul food prepared by two of the nicest women in town.  Portions are large but prices are not.  If you've not tried them, I urge you to do so.  If you can't get to the restaurant,  look for their food truck in downtown Montgomery.

resp.text: Thanks love we truly appreciate you...

name: J Jenkins
text: Never go wrong with great food and friendly people.  Haven't seen pancake biscuit since younger days in Mississippi. True home cooking

resp.text: Thanks

name: Tiffany W
text: Breakfast was amazing. The grits were almost as good as my momma's and they aren't stingy with the serving size. Those pancakes were bomb as well. Definitely go check them out.

name: Spencer Lee
text: The best black eyed peas I have ever had. Hamburger Steak was also good.  The owner was very friendly and they have a discount for folks such as state workers and military.   Not a great part of town but if that doesn't bother you then this works.

resp.text: Thanks

name: Vivian Simmons
text: Haven't been yet

text: This is now Bootsie's. Yummy food and awesome service. Support small business.

text: Nice little small town Cafe. The food was very good and the restaurant was clean and cosey.

name: Russ Moore
text: Excellent food and even better are their homemade desserts. Friendly folks to do business with. They have a chicken salad sandwich that is to die for. Open Thursday through Saturday for lunch and they cater. Looking for a unique place to eat, try it. You won't be disappointed.

text: Freindly staff. Excellent strawberry cake.

name: Danny Powell
text: Good food excellent service

name: Duane Ball
text: Great place

name: Brandon Barnes
text: Nice, clean environment. The staff were very friendly. I didn't have a long wait and the food was great. I will be back.

name: cindy walker
text: great food huge portions

name: Danny Hancock
text: Great food

name: Bri Griffin
text: This place is not in business anymore!!

name: Julie Bartlett
text: Waited in line with 3 people in front of me, I understand only one person was working but by the time it was my turn to order a Walmart employee came up started talking about cookies and then said all she wanted was a cookie but to go ahead and wait on me, instead the worker says no thats ok, she would get her cookies first. At that point I walked out and got lunch somewhere else.

name: Jason Mack
text: This has to be the worst experience for any subway I've been in! We had been on the road for a couple of hours, kids hungry. Decided to stop at this subway, HUGH mistake and a waste of time! Came in, both girls did not want to be there. 1st order, meatball sub. Answer, we don't have meatballs! WHAT? Out of meatballs. Ok I'll ask kids to pick something else. 2nd order, spicy Italian. Answer, we are out of pepperoni and...... I never let her finish. Walked out! How can you own a sandwich shop and be out of meats to make sandwiches? Why open for the day? What a joke! STAY AWAY from this subway, unless you want to buy bread!

name: Tyler Toner
text: Great service and tasty sandwiches from the very friendly Sonia!

name: Dennis Byrnes
text: Really tasty subs. Some of the food preparer's really don't want to be there. So they have an attitude when making your sub. Kinda skimp on the toppings.

name: Elaine Coleman
text: Good food. Nice people

name: M A Bumgar
text:
I have never been treated so rudely.  After multiple incidents, I finally walked away without my order.  She had one person's order she was making when we arrived.  She asked us what we wanted and I told her we wanted 4 sandwiches so we'd wait for her to finish and check out the woman already there.  She complained that she was all alone and she didn't want to avoid taking off her gloves to save time.  So then when we tried to tell her our order, she kept asking what we wanted, and I kept repeating it every time she kept saying it wrong.   Then after several go arounds she said she'd fix the sandwiches but we needed to tell her what we want. I said I had and asked if she could hear me, and she said she couldn't because there was too much noise.  That was about the time another customer came in.  So I spoke louder and began repeating the order once again, and she interrupted me and told me to hold that thought.  And then proceeded to finish and wrap the sandwiches for the woman ahead of us very very very slowly.  At around this point in time, I looked and it was 4:06 pm.  We had pulled into the parking lot at about 3:51, and upon entering the store I briefly looked at produce then went into the restaurant.   She made several remarks through the course of this time she had started with our order at  about 416. She said she had problems just like me and that the customer wasnt always right and that she wasnt disrespecting me.  Yeah right.  I was in an amigo so these things she bent down and said then through the glass. Then asked me if I understood her.  I told her I didn't.   I heard her but I had no understanding of what she was trying to communicate.  Her response to that was "see, now you know what I mean". The woman behind me told the little girl with her not to say a word to this employee because she was frustrated because she was working alone.

She mixed up the sandwiches, and instead of 2 BMTs, there was 1 and 2 hams instead 1.  This is when I realized she had put pickles and mayo on the wrong sub.  My husband said he didnt want it with the mayo on it.  So i tried to tell her he wasnt going to pay for it and she told me she would  throw them out and had another customer, so I needed to decide what I wanted.

I have never been treated so rudely and it wasn't just what she said , it was how she said it.  It was 4:23 when I finally gave up.  I walked over to a Walmart customer service person to see if I could talk to the subway manager but she and 2 others didnt seem to know anything about it.

So... at 4:26, we exited the store, and drove a few miles away to the Subway in town across from Dollar General.   There were 3 employees there, all of whom were very pleasant and the subs were bagged before I paid for them.  The time on the receipt was 4:45. This is the sub shop to do business with.

So if you want good and prompt service stay away from the Walmart Subway.   The employee who was rude had a name tag on.  I would never post it, but I
Will check before I ever order there again to make sure I never have to deal with her foul personality again.

name: Brianna Melvin
text: I have never met a store, or worked in one for that matter, that didn't try to upsell. I am a manager at a pizza hut now and that's the point. To give customers the best bang for their buck. I sent my stepdad to subway for sandwiches for my husband and I. I knew the sub i wanted was a $5 sub and my husband's would cost a little more. I gave him the money I had and told him to get us foot long sandwiches. He says the lady didnt specify, which i understand, but i paid $4  for a 6" sub when the woman could have informed him for $1 MORE HE COULD HAVE GOTTEN A FOOTLONG! needless to say, i ate my sub and my husband ate his. Plus the food my mother and stepfather got tasted bad and he wanted to bring it back. My point, you should at least INFORM YOUR CUSTOMERS SO THEY CAN MAKE THE BEST DECISION BASED ON THEIR MONEY. For 1 dollar more I could have had twice the sandwich. If i could give 0 stars i would. This is my first review on this subway and i never try to give bad reviews working in the food industry myself. But i will not EVER use this subway again. I will go out of my way to bypass this one.

text: Always a good choice when eating never had a bad meal or experience

name: Kaylan Hand
text: HORRIBLE. I went at 9 AM this morning to get a sandwich on white bread. They open at 7 AM. The lady whose name I do not recall, told me the bread would not be ready for another 30 minutes. They have been open for two hours. Yes, I could understand being open for 30 minutes and not having the bread done, but two hours is absolutely ridiculous. So, I travelled to another subway up the road to see if the situation was the same. The man in this store was very friendly as he already had his bread done. I called the manager of this subway of which I experienced the bread not being done and she informed me that it was not a priority nor the first thing they do. If you do not have your bread done by time you open, simply change your hours. It is SO RUDE for customers to be under the impression that they can "eat fresh" when they can't even eat at all. While on the phone with this manager, I asked if all the subways did this. She replied with "no.. wait I mean yes." I explained to her I went to another subway directly 10 minutes after I was told there was no white bread done but he seemed to have all of his stuff together. She informed me that it could have been left over bread from yesterday, but it was not. Guess he is just more concerned with keeping his job and keeping the customers happy than having them complain about stupid bread situations. This subway does not even deserve one star.

name: Alexandra Goerke
text:
I do not cook! I repeat. I do not cook! Everything that comes out of my oven is tasteless and gross. I can roast a vegetable and that's about it. I grew up with a mother who was an awful cook (sorry mom) and never learned myself. But I will NEVER have to learn now. My seven year old and I just gobbled down the Crawfish Etouffee and I don't know what to do with myself. It was the most delicious meal I have had since moving to Birmingham in November! It was flavorful, and filling, and.... honestly if it was a man I would marry it.
Dish'n It Out knows exactly what they're doing at this little business! I walked in and had no idea what I was looking for, but a community voucher coupon drew me in. The nicest most attentive staff member (don't hate me, but I'm horrible with names and I believe it was, Matty)  greeted me and explained every single selection down to their salads. Helped me make a selection from the range of sizes, I went with the small for the two of us and have PLENTY left for a third meal.
All in all, I can see Dish'n It Out becoming a large part of our weekly routine.

I was freezing the entire time. Granted, they cannot control the weather. We sat near the back door & the bar was on the back porch, but the heat could have been turned up a notch.
The food was really good & there was plenty of it. That was a huge bonus compared to the other restaurants where parties have been hosted.
I would return to this establishment & I would also recommend it. Next time, I will just be sure & bring a jacket & definitely choose our seating more strategically.

text: My husband went to get me a chicken salad sandwich and I kept calling and no one would pick up so he just went. The owner told him he has only doing catering because he was not hurting for money. Seriously. Extremely rude. He couldn't even give him a simple sandwich with pasta salad he already had made and they are very rude people I wish I could give them a 0 for terrible customer service

resp.text: Good Afternoon, unfortunately we had to close due to the threat of dangerous road conditions. This was explained to your husband. We already had a catering booked that had to get out that could not have been done in the morning. He continued to insist that we make the sandwich and pasta, that by the way we did not have the product already made. We make our Chicken Salad by scratch and do not have cans of chicken lying around. So no we are not hurting for money as to where we needed to stress ourselves and staff out to make your 1 Chicken Salad Sandwich (that we don’t even have the croissants for either) and Pasta Salad that the Pasta would’ve needed to have been cooked. We were closed, that does not reflect on the amazing customer service that we provide. Unfortunately we do not have the menu items for the restaurant prepared for today’s service since we were closed due to the threat of dangerous weather conditions. Also If we were open then we would’ve answered the phone. We always post on our Facebook page, as most businesses do, to communicate with our customers and we had already done that. Have a blessed day! Thanks!

name: Craig Ceravolo
text:
Bright Star restaurant has been a Birmingham tradition for many many years. My parents are loyal customers and have passed their love of the Bright Star down to me. My dad loves their bread pudding. Being a New Orleans native, his pallet is discerning on this dessert and won’t touch it unless it comes from his mother’s Louisiana kitchen circa 1965 or the Bright Star. So I wanted to surprise him for Christmas with a pan of this fantastically rich dessert complete with whiskey sauce. I called the catering number the day before Christmas Eve and the most delightful, professional voice answered on the other end and talked to me like we were best friends for ages. Her name is Jennifer and she took my order, told me how to pick it up and let me at the door on Christmas Eve with instructions. All with a smile, and a ease that made me feel like if nothing else happened during the hectic holiday, Bright Star catering made me feel like the Christmas spirit was alive and well.

Planning events are stressful, whether it be a family gathering, a wedding or what have you. Do yourself a favor. Call Jennifer at Bright Star catering and let her ease your mind. Your guests will be well fed and you will be taken care of. I will recommend them whenever anyone needs a catering service. Thank you Jennifer and thank you Bright Star Catering for making my Family’s Christmas a little bit Brighter

name: Lindsay Davis
text: We have used Bright Star catering for several events for our company and I would give them 10 stars if I could.  The food is always amazing and the service is just the same.  Whether it is for a party of 100 or 10, they can handle it.  They are a must!!

They were accompanied by a half dozen chocolate covered strawberries 🍓hence the 2 stars given. Customer service is EVERYTHING especially in these days.  I would do edible arrangements again but definitely at another location.

text: Worst customer service ever. I live out of state and for my sisters 16th birthday we wanted to do something special for her so we decided to have an edible arrangement with balloons delivered to her high school. 72$ later they didn't deliver the balloons and when I called to get a refund for the balloons a man named Bryant answered the phone. I really just would have been fine if they were apologetic towards the situation and cared but instead in a monotone voice the response I was given was "well sometimes we miss things, do you have the card so I can refund the money". Outstanding response sir. Needless to say I told them my fiancé would call them with the card information. When he called the owner answered and again was not very sympathetic to the situation. He decided a refund wouldn't matter since the surprise for her birthday was ruined anyways. She had the balloons delivered the next day that we paid for already and a box of 6 complementary strawberries sent with it. At the end of the day if someone in this business would have ACTED like they cared that their business took away from what should have been a special sweet 16th birthday delivery I wouldn't have such a bad taste in my mouth for this company.

name: Michele Coco
text: The customer service at this franchise is HORRIBLE. the manager, Rebecca, had a horrible attitude, as did the delivery driver,  and made what was supposed to be an awesome gift a pain to receive.  I almost called back to tell them to cancel the delivery entirely and to credit the person who sent me the gift.  I was not home for the initial delivery at noon on Wednesday. I was left a message on my cell phone by the delivery man to call the store to reschedule. I called, was placed on hold and then REbecca picked up giving me some stupid line of, "They are a very busy company and cannot schedule a delivery in  set period of time." I then proceeded to ask her if I was supposed to wait here all day to receive my bouquet. She said no, I could come pick it up. They would try to make sure the bouquet was at the store when I arrived. So, wait?  You can't get it to me in a 2 ot 4 hour time period and then you will try to have it there, all the way across town, should I happen to show up?  WHAT?  How is it that FedEx, UPS and even the USPS can deliver things nationwide but this little mom/pop business that serves the Birmingham metro (population 1.5million) cannot get it together to deliver a bouquet in a 2 to 4 hour time slot?  PATHETIC.

My husband reminded her that this is all the more reason to wear the mask as she had served a large number of people without a mask. We were then told that we dont have to eat there and we could leave. So we left and went to Burger King where everyone was wearing masks and gloves and they were friendly. I hope the coughing employee isnt infected w covid but I will report this to the Alabama Health Department and Subway corporate offices just in case there is an outbreak in the area.

Maybe don't be in customer service then? Oh and don't even bother going around lunchtime. There is only one employee working during the lunch rush. What kind of Mananger puts ONE employee on the job for the biggest rush!? Nothing against that poor employee (I think her name was Melissa or melinda) She was trying as hard as she could. And apologizing like crazy.
I'm never going back here ever! Albertville is so much better! Trust me it's worth the extra drive time.

text: There's not much you probably don't already know about a sub sandwich shop, but this Lenny's location certainly has a great staff and great food.  I've always loved the clean taste of their Italian and Classic subs.  This location also does a great job of keeping the place clean.

name: connie garcia
text: This Lenny's is ALWAYS dirty! My husband goes but I will not eat there. The tables are dirty, the floors, and the machine they use to slice the meat with is dirty. Compared to other Lenny's this one is not up to standard. The employees are standing around or on their phone. One person doing the work while others do nothing.  I hope the owner or manage changes this because I love Lenny's subs but I don't want to get sick eating in a dirty restaurant.

name: Wes McKay
text: Just well-made, tasty, flavorful sandwiches.  I love the pepper relish on top of a sandwich made Lenny's way.  The rewards program is another major plus.

name: Heather Hill
text: I hate to say this because I believe in having a light hearted atmosphere in your work environment but they do it a little too much where they screw up orders. The first time I was there I had order for take out and they were busy and 5 people before me ended up getting the order wrong they even got one table's order wrong twice. Then I get my order and I checked it just to make sure and sure enough they had gotten my order wrong and it's because the whole time the workers are constantly joking around with each other that they aren't paying attention to what they are doing. Then the second time I order a sandwhich and salad and I was an idiot not to check my bag because they didn't even put it in the bag and it was the main thing I wanted out of the whole order because it was for my paralyzed grandfather who I take care of full time. I get him Lenny's as a treat and don't get much time to get away from the house for this and the manager really didn't act like it was a big deal. We pay good money for your sandwhiches I shouldn't have to waste gas to correct your screw ups just because you think it's better to not be focused on job. I will never return to them. I have even had other people tell me they stopped going to Lenny's because they always screw up their order because of the joking around. Get it together.

name: connie waddell
text: Great we haven't eat there is a while we ate there today it was great. The bread is far better then any other sub shop.

text: Finally tried this place and glad I did. Fries were crispy & tangy, pork was rich & generous, mac & cheese was creamy (made with gouda, which more restaurants should do). All for a reasonable price, considering how expensive BBQ usually is. The owners were also incredibly friendly, and not in a phony way you often get with restaurants. Hope I get the opportunity to cater something soon so we can hire Blue Line!

resp.text: Thank you, Eric! It was great meeting you yesterday, and we’re so happy you enjoyed your food!

This is by far one of the best food, friendliest and clean restaurants that we have found on google and stop to eat!!!
Such an honor support American heroes!!
They should consider bottling and selling their Bar B Que Sauce. It’s really great!!!

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words, Stephanie! We’re so happy you enjoyed your food, and it was great getting to meet you today!

name: Leon Nunez
text:
Drove twenty five minutes to try this restaurant for lunch. Based on WEBSITE, OPEN and closing at 7pm.  Upon arrival, restaurant hours posted on door CATERING ONLY on Saturdays.  Why in the world do yo even have a website if such pertinent info such as YOUR HOURS OF OPERATION ARE INCORRECT!!!!!
REally upsetting!  Will not return

resp.text: I’m sorry you found the need to leave a one star review based on our hours of operation. Our normal to go hours are posted on the door.  Due to the staffing issues in area, we can not man to go and provide for committed catering jobs. Last weekend we were open Saturday, as we had no catering or events. My apologies that it did not get changed back on the website.

name: Brandy Kane
text: Enjoyed great food and great company tonight at a retirement party. Check them out you won't be disappointed!!

resp.text: Thank you, Brandy! It was wonderful to have you all, so glad you enjoyed your night!

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words, Heather! We appreciate it!

resp.text: Thank you so much! Glad you enjoyed the food :)

name: Virginia Swift
text: We ordered food for rehearsal dinner and everything was delicious. Food arrived on time, the pork and chicken were moist. The potato salad and baked beans were the best I have had from any catering service that I have ever used. Thanks for making the wedding rehearsal dinner a success.

resp.text: Thank you! We appreciate the business and the very kind words!

name: Donna Chandler
text: Mike was wonderful helping me line up our food for my son’s wedding rehearsal. He responded back to me very quickly when I had questions. The food was awesome and plenty of it. Highly recommend!!

resp.text: Thank you so much for the kind words. It was a pleasure serving you and providing the meal for your rehearsal!

text: Thank you Mike and family for a great birthday meal . ALL the food was delicious!! Hands down best steak I’ve ever had . My birthday cake was so yummy . I’m so thankful for your generosity to my family and I. If anyone is looking for a great place to go , this one is it . I promise you will never be disappointed . THANK YOU SO MUCH !

resp.text: Thank you! It was a pleasure serving you and your family, and we appreciate you choosing to spend your birthday meal with us!!

text: Absolutely amazing experience! We rented a beach house with 20 other people and we were responsible for dinner one night of the week. I talked to Mike and told him what we were looking for. Everything was delivered to the house on time and the food was amazing. Total crowd pleaser! Would fully recommend this hidden gem!

resp.text: Chad, thanks for the kind words! Let us know in the future if we can be  of service. Stay safe.

text: We had a large group vacation last month, and we all pitched in for catering. Turned out to be the best bbq we had ever eaten, and it fed our group of 30 for two days. They made everything so simple and all for a great price. Feeding that group for that many meals would have cost 5x what we paid. Highly recommended!

resp.text: Tyler, thank you so much for the review!

resp.text: Thank you!

name: chuck chavis
text:
This company is a hidden gem. I really wish I could do more than just a 5 star rating. If you are looking for high quality taste and food, this is it. ...I could not recommend another company any higher. The owners have top of the line customers service. You cannot ask for more when the customer service and the food is 5 star.

I myself read reviews when in search of something. Please give this company a try. I promise your reviews will probably be just as strong as this one.

Thanks Mike for real quality food and the highest customer service!!

The shrimp taco bites were amazing. Even the seafood haters ate them,lol!

You will always be our first to go to for food and service!

I have used Alabama Blue Line BBQ numerous times for private and company events and the food is always AMAZING! My favorite is the pulled pork, but the ribs are awesome, oh and the homemade sauce - it's all so very YUMMY!
Trust me you won't be disappointed!

name: Melissa Woodard
text: I have never before seen or heard of a chick fill a until I visited sylacauga Alabama. I want to say a special thank you to Micah the franchise owner of this store. Your suggestion of what your employees are like was a blessing in disguise. Not only were they hospitable but they made sure that I got my correct order in a timely fashion. I always like to try something new and I would recommend this place for anyone who is in the area. The food is awesome they got my order correct and the service is the most outstanding I've ever seen. Thank you very much for enlightening my taste buds to something new.

name: lisa perdue
text: The operation of two lines went very smoothly. I could not see the menu when ordering and probably might not ordered the parfait with oreo topping and fruit because it was 3.75 by itself with the combo 6.00. Good though with their famous lemonade I always bought in brookwood mall homewood Alabama as an employee of both end chain stores when I was in retail employment. Things are vastly different these days. I took my minimum wages way more seriously than majority and as a result the easiest to be the odd ball Not defying the odds that hard work pays. It leaves you struggling in poverty. But Im sure that's bitterness rubbing off on me. Got a good photo as my other favorite thing to do getting odd shots most get paid big bucks in print media. My phone controls the best of me but I got this from my destination mall and purpose on a gorgeous stressfilled easter weekend. In auburn Alabama where I worked in undergraduate school there at now gone jcpennys and got my earring piercing on top of my ear that took a year to heal because I kept hitting it with the phone receiver back in 1989 rather than continue commuting on weekends back to my hometown birmingham mall as manager of lingerie and top sales in accessories. When stockings used with garter belts came 3 to a box and my thighs slightly smaller but not much. Its control top reinforced toe now for sharp talon nails on eagle soarers. My joke of the city. And the river a few miles before this chick-fil-a restaurant. If you ordered a ice cream cake from now replaced Badkung Robbins in toomers corner I made it as the cake maker/ decorator for a quarter. Loved that job slicing tubs of ice cream and layering with cake then icing with melted cream inside the cooler before piping your favorite slogan on it. Lastly, was now gone a different cooler in environmental management for water samples which storied life experienced escaped discussion in the water sludge cleaning treatment process I endured to get mosquitos in my puddled location. I will have better to discuss another day when my dining room and laundry socket plugs work again reminding me of my molester's house dynamics that's my Unavoidable problem.

name: Alyson Gulledge
text: After having so many mistakes with my orders throughout the past few months at the Chick-Fil-A in Sylacauga, today really topped it off. After my order being messed up and one of my coworkers not getting lunch, I called and let them know the order was not included. This was around 11:30ish. The girl told me her general manager wasn’t there and she would have to get approval from him to fix my order. And she tried telling me I would have to somehow prove that the order wasn’t included, asked me to bring it all back up there when I had already distributed over 5 orders to my coworkers! Not even 20 minutes later Kayleen Turner called them and she says the general manager is there he is just busy, so they lied and she called them out on it and the girl had nothing to say but she offered to bring us the order. She didn’t even want it anymore so she said no just to refund her money. I get a call HOURS later saying I would have to go in the store and get cash because they can’t process it otherwise. Okay, cool. It was very inconvenient but sure. Shortly after they called me, they called Kayleen and she wasn’t able to answer because she was in the middle of selling a car. So after, she called back and said “Hey I missed a call from y’all, it was probably about the order for Alyson” and the girl HUNG UP ON HER! So I went in and not once did the manager apologize, not once did she seem to care about the inconvenience, I even brought up the fact that her coworker lied to me on the phone and she said “the gm didn’t get here until 11.” I told her it was well after 11 that I called and she had nothing to say, did not apologize, just said “have a good night.” and quickly went on to help another customer. Y’all after working in the food industry for so long, it baffles me how some fast food employees AND managers can be so unprofessional, especially when they work at the number one fast food restaurant in the country and are known for treating customers with kindness. I promise I never want to be THAT person, but there’s only so far you can push me. I have never been one to try to lie and haggle to get free food out of any restaurant, and it pisses me off that THEY messed up my order, lied to me, treated me unprofessionally, but I am looked at by them as one of those customers that was there to cuss someone out over them leaving a chicken nugget out of my nugget meal. It is literally not hard at all to treat a customer the right way and I just can’t comprehend how that is so hard for some people to understand. 😑

resp.text:
Hi, Alyson. I’m sorry you had such a poor experience at my restaurant. As the local owner of only one restaurant, I’m dedicated to training and continuously improving our team of over 80 local employees.

We messed up, and I’m sorry it happened to you.

I’m always replying to guest concerns via phone if given the opportunity so that I can receive feedback, get better, and make situations right.

If you would be willing to speak with me directly, you may leave a message with a manager at my restaurant’s number: 256-245-0096.

I’m a local Franchisee and I care about this community and my team’s job security, so thank you for your feedback.

-Micah Harris, Chick-fil-A at Sylacauga

text: Had a terrific time here! The service was good! However, I MUST give the reason for coming here 5 stars as well! My daughter came down from Gadsden. Met her and my absolutely adorable grandson there! We enjoyed quality time all having lunch together then my sweeter than sugar grandbaby which is 2 years old played in the play room that has a nice little slide and Little tunnels he could climb through! We ALL had a great time! It provides all of our needs and our baby was in a nice cool environment bc August isn't the time of the year in Alabama to be outside playing in the heat! Thanks Chick-fil-A for coming to Sylacauga!! We needed you guys!!!

name: Andrea Yantis
text: I absolutely love Chick-fil-A and am really glad to have it in my hometown.  However this one, just like everything else in my hometown, is below Chick-fil-A standards.  I use the curbside pickup regularly to obtain points on the app.  They have left stuff out of my order on numerous occasions.  I normally let it go, but the one time I go back and say something the lady does not even apologize for leaving it out of my order.  So I call back to talk to the manager, she apologizes but does not offer to do anything about it or anything.  So when I ask are you going to do anything, she said it was just honey mustard.  That isn't the point, the point is you left it out of my bag when I requested it in there.  If I did not love Chick-fil-A so much and used to work there so I love supporting them I would not go back to this restaurant.  Note this has been the only Chickfila I have ever been too that I have had issues with.

resp.text:
Hi, Andrea! I called you around 4:30 PM and couldn’t leave a voicemail, but please call me back if you’re available. 🙂
-Local Franchisee, Micah Harris

Just knowing that a Chick-fil-A like this exists in this very state, country, continent, world, solar system, galaxy, and universe makes me happy beyond compare! name: Vova Voronkin
text: Grabbed quick lunch in between meetings as I was staying in nearby hotel for business. The food was great, quick service.

name: Dylan Daughety
text: The line is terrible

name: 7 Streams
text: A family favorite! On our way to LA from NC, stopping here was on the must-do list. KYLA offered us water while we waited for our perfected pitas. Thanks a bunch for that added touch of hospitality! We'll return soon, hopefully on our way back to NC! 💙💛💙💛💙💛#GeauxJAGS

name: Brian Dominick
text: THE STAFF MADE IT GREAT!!!! LAUREN KNOCKED IT OUT OF THE PARK!!! Great happy moods menu and product knowledge on the money. As a restauranteur I wish I had them...The food was fresh and hot and tasty.

name: Autumn Garrett
text: People inside are always very nice

name: Shane Senn
text: This place is nasty the soda fountain is nasty!!! The floor and tables so dirty!!

name: marty bains
text: Staff is always super cool!

name: Bryan Aspinwall
text: This place was excellent until this new management took over. First of all, they took the best thing (Dagwood) off the menu. Secondly, they completely changed up the way they do things. Now they just decide what toppings you get without asking for your input and when you request other toppings they get incredibly rude and say things like “oh man you really haven’t been here in a while, have you?” No I haven’t. Last time I was here, I had a pleasant experience. I will never go to this location ever again.

name: Jeremy Schill
text: I love pita pit the service is excellent and the food is extraordinary

name: jinesh n
text: Not very regular with this place. Whenever I have been here it's been nice. Nice food, quantity of food for the price is amazing. Service is good.

name: Jocelyn Gordon Walker
text: Omg!!! Forgot to take a picture of my good BUT was so excited that they had Beyond Meat!! Made this vegan happy! Will definitely be back when I return to Auburn for more games.

name: THEW00TEN10
text: I always have a good experience here. The staff is really friendly and usually quick. Chicken ceasar pita is my go to. They also stay open late which is convenient after a night in downtown Auburn. Will definitely be back!

name: Senna Simmons Barnett
text: Thai Chicken is the best!!

name: Len Montgomery
text: It's pretty much a different take on burritos. I got the Southwestern wrap. The meat was kind of sweet but it complimented the jalapenos really nicely. The pita bread was super soft and had that nice chew to it. It kind of reminded me of a Philly cheese steak but all in all it was really delicious. They also have vegetarian options like falafel and such which is a major plus. I would definitely recommend this place.

name: Gianna Anjanette
text: Wow... How have I not known about them til now?. Absolutely delicious. Better than Subway even!

name: Allen Adams
text: Open late, healthy, within easy walk of campus downtown.  Love Pita Pit!

name: Honey Folk
text: Love this place for the fresh tasty ingredients,  generous portion and the great friendly service! Its also spectacular that they have such late nights!

name: Mayra Paez
text: Great costumer service. It's healthy food for an good price, they also offer many discounts. Totally recommended.

name: Ishan Anjikar
text: I really liked the service. My server was really friendly and prepared awesome and hot  pita as i needed.

name: S K
text: A bit pricey, but good food, and they make it quick.

name: Rebecca L
text: I love Pita Pit. We usually stop in once a week. The gyro "Fork style" is my favorite. The toppings are fresh and everything is tastes great. If you order delivery, it typically takes about 45 minutes, so don't wait until you're STARVING to place your order. We've never been let down by Pita Pit. It's definitely a favorite in downtown Auburn.

name: Matt M
text: Pita Pit is outstanding. Great people with great quality chicken salads! Highly recommend! Also, they are open late which is nice as a college student!

name: Chefboy Tyree
text: The black bean pita is literally off the chains yall! If you dont eat meat this is a great option.

name: Bob Jemian
text: It was a delicious pita but WAY overstuffed and quickly became too messy to eat. They are a bit overpriced I think.

name: Caitlin Davis
text: I ordered a catered delivery for 12 people days in advance. They showed up half an hour late, and forgot some side sauces. Not an ideal situation when you're dealing with hungry athletes and staff members. Quality of the food was decent.

name: Lynda Cole
text: The staff at this establishment are amazing. The three young ladies and the guy that was there around 1am really make you feel like you are at home, and you belong at pita pit. They dont make you feel like you are a inconvience to them, and i love that because most places that are as busy as they were in Auburn make you feel like you shouldnt have walked in, in the first place.. Love love love them!!!!!! Also, the food was aboustely delicious. Tonight they had a pinini press and it made my pita 100% better. Im so glad they added this!! I had the baja chicken bacon rance its soo good. Overall i would definitely recommend this place to any and everyone....me and my friend will be back tomorrow 😂  #pitapitislife #pininipita

name: Paul EF
text: The food is always great.  However, I would suggest if you use a credit card and plan to tip, you write the exact amount you intend to pay for the whole meal.  I rounded up to the nearest $5 increment and drew a horizontal line for the change.  When the bill processed through, someone at the Pit had carried the change amount into the tip so they would get an even $5 tip, upping the total amount I paid.  A few cents is so little value, but taking money from a customer w/out permission is inexcusable.

name: Neal Fondren
text:
These people are great! They were SO attentive to my 86-yr-old mother, even when they really didn't have to be. Would go back there over and over again. The food was excellent too.

If you want hot and spicy, let them know. The can make it happen.

But the it's the classiness of the peeps there that make the difference.

name: Jas M
text: This place is amazing. The food is great it's fast and my food is never wrong. The staff is great. I highly recommend it.

name: Jason Oliver
text: Okay here's the thing I'm going to review two places because they're similar Pita Pit has an amazing tzatziki for their gyro put their pita bread leaves a bit to be desired and the meat is not off of skewer the other gyro place is Taziki's are gyros are amazing but there tzatziki sauce was really bad. This is going to sound really weird but go to Pita Pit order a gyro get extra tzatziki sauce then go to Taziki's and get a gyro off of the skewer put them together and you'll have one bomb gyro

name: victoria Mechete
text: Fast, delicious, and open until 3am

name: Neal Fondren
text:
These people are great! They were SO attentive to my 86-yr-old mother, even when they really didn't have to be. Would go back there over and over again. The food was excellent too.

If you want hot and spicy, let them know. The can make it happen.

But the it's the classiness of the peeps there that make the difference.

name: Dani M
text: The pitas are amazing! The serving size isn't very big, especially if you eat a lot, but the food quality makes it worth it

name: Sara Carwile
text: Great food, and staff is phenomenal!

name: Kayla Danmusa
text: I recently visited Pita Pit in Auburn, AL and the experience was awful. The food was non-satisfactory and I reached out to the staff in order to return the food and receive a refund and they were unconcerned about our complaints. I  also reached out to the regional manager of the establishment and he was extremely rude and apathetic to our customer experience. I feel devalued as a customer, especially after choosing to spend my hard earned money in order to benefit a business. I will not be returning to this establishment and I would not recommend it to anyone.

name: Jesica Milles
text: Was here late at night with two of my friends several weeks ago. The food was great, I ate the Pita Gyro. The staff was pleasant and most importantly fast. There is wide variety of add-ons to chose from and the salads where fresh. I liked this place, great place to eat a healthy sandwich or a pita gyro.

name: Justin Sanders
text: Love the stuffed pitas and the salads.  Pick your toppings as its made like a lot of deli style locations. Great place to eat.

name: h.w. EkoalaT
text: Like Subway with flair. Fresh, healthy, yummy options like falafel. Quick. Eat in @ their tiny booths, carryout, or order ahead for your group.

name: Wes Wilkerson
text:
TLDR: Great food but service is hit or miss.  Order online with ASAP pickup time and then show up within 10 mins.

Long Version:
Preordered with a pushed out pickup time but was unexpectedly able to arrive ~13 mins early (completely expected to have to wait for my order prep) and my order was already bagged ready to go.  Had I arrived on time my steak pita would have been cold and less desirable than normal.

Another time when I went to the place to order, the service was incredibly slow due to short staffing.  The lone employee was hustling and did a great job with my food but it took ~25 mins for me to get my order and I was first in line ahead of the rush.  Totally a staffing issue; the employee did the best they could.

My best result has been to order online with ASAP pickup time and then show up within 10 mins, despite the 15 or 20 min buffer the app gives.  That seems to be the sweet spot; everything is still hot but is ready to go and I'm in and out in no time.

name: Jagadish Torlapati
text: Only good Mediterranean food place here. The quality of service you get is ordinary. It's always one of those college kids who will not know how to fold your pita bread. I wouldn't go here unless I had a craving for Falafel.

name: danial pate
text: Excellent food and service!

name: B Wilson
text: Horrible customer service. I can't order online because it says they don't deliver to me, but they do. They've delivered my order incorrect TWICE in the last two weeks. When I called this time to complain, a RUDE employee told me I could buy another pita if I didn't like it. Do not recommend and will not order from them again. Never had this problem with Pita Pit elsewhere. Guess they don't need business.

name: Margie Warren
text: One of my favorite places

name: Motki Didi
text: Good customer service after long time.

name: Sully
text: The guy working the closing shift on 8/24/19 ~2am deserves a raise.

name: Quinton Foster
text: First time there and the freshness of the food was in every bite!

name: Macy Palmer
text:
Love this place!
Favorite spot to stop and eat when we go to Auburn!

name: Abdelkhalak El Maghribi
text: My favorite spot every Saturday night when I come to aubran,  fresh food , nice employees

name: Jarrett Moore
text: Great food. Wish parking were easier, but that's not their fault.

name: Julia Campisano
text: Ordered a $9 pita just to get home and not at all be the one I ordered. if you say my number, it should be the one I order.

name: Carl Morgan
text: Great local spot, and there open late.

name: james s
text: pretty good. cheap enough with good vegetarian options

name: Katrina Nakhjavan
text: Good food. The Alaska locations are even better, I'm sure.

name: Meme B
text: I waited almost an hour for my food, just to pull hair out of my pita! 😡 so yes i absolutely hated it.. Never will i order from them again

name: David England
text: Gryo was good I loved being able to customize it with veggies.  Staff was AUsome!  They were very patient with us being newcomers and super friendly!

name: Matt Huffman
text: Underrated food spot in downtown Auburn

name: Garrett Blackmon
text: Delicious food. If you aren't a fan of black olives have them thrown on the grill to calm them down a tad.

name: Shashank Rao
text: Good every time

name: Ken Williams
text: Good Food, Fresh and Healthy. Only wish smaller less expensive portions were available.

name: Alexandria Hicks
text: Extremely extremely rude staff tonight. I've neve had a problem before today but this will probably be my last time coming

name: Rory Young
text: Chicken souvlaki is good.

name: Claire Foster
text: The people working there are very nice and helpful

name: Amod Parkhi
text: Has a falafel pita..it was awesome..

name: Chris Hanson
text: My friend ask for the persons info above the manager and they called the police on him with false allegations of strong arming. Any contact info would help. Thanks.

name: Bo Borden
text: Always open and always good

name: Joseph Molnar
text: Diverse healthy offerings made you way

name: Justin Beck Holmes
text: Good. Healthy. Fresh.

name: Josh Gossett
text: Great late night spot, and really enjoyed the staff!

name: Alexander
text: Good spot for a quick bite! When you ask for double meat it doesn't feel like so.

name: Bojan S
text: Fresh, healthy and delicious coming from a fan of the Pita Pit who regularly eats here!

name: Jed Grant
text: I always love stopping in for some Pita Pit!

name: yunus emre özdemir
text: Long waiting

name: Tori Dillard
text: Pita Pit is God's gift to earth

name: Chulki Kim
text: Good food

name: Laroy Lockheart
text: They've stolen me from sub way friendlier service open late night and the food is cooked to order

name: ThePhotogirly
text: This place is soooo good!

name: BS
text: good!

name: Vyom Parmar
text: One of the few places open after midnight and have healthy options, however they've increased their prices recently.

name: Eng. Faisal Alqasem
text: Delicious pitas but bad staff

name: Reztierk Sukram
text: This is akin to eating "pita" version of Subway. Food is bland and the staff do not offer any interesting or creative input in your selection. Open late.

name: Brittany Brighenti
text: IF you haven't tried it, do yourself the favor!

name: Jonathan
text: Very healthy pitas. Service maybe a little slow because they usually only have 1 person making pitas.

name: Zack Taylor
text: Good food

name: Becca H
text: This is a great Subway, we’ve been here twice this week and both times it has been great. The sandwiches have been good with the right amount of toppings and condiments. We live in Helena within 2 min of the Subway and will continue to drive the extra 8 miles for this one. Great job.

name: Katherine Hill
text: Every single time I show up at this location after work, and well before 8pm, it’s closed. This has happened three times in the last month. Today I called at 7:40 to place an order for pick up and no answer.... so I called again... and again... no answer. I finally arrived and the lights were on and the girls had ignored my calls and had already shut everything down and were just sitting there. If your business is open until 8, then it needs to stay open until 8!

name: George Barnett
text: We do enjoy stopping here. Well managed, clean, and fast service. However check your receipt for correct purchase amount. The manager will happily make it right if incorrect.

name: Jonathan Miles
text: I mean, it's fine. It's Subway. There's not a whole lot else to say about it. One guy at this location knows how to roll a wrap correctly, and the other one is clueless. But, always good service, and... It's fine, it's Subway.

name: Luzmarina Barrero
text: Terrible service . They don’t take any coupons

name: Russell Allen
text: Not the best subway. Be careful if you ask for condiments on your sandwich...they will drown it.

name: Greg Smith
text: Fresh food and good service. I live 2 miles from the subway in Helena but I drive 7 miles to this subway for better quality.

name: ASHWINI PATKI
text: Won't honor accepted online order: I ordered a deal via Subway website to be picked up from this location. The order and  payment was accepted by the store (the deal was reflected on my receipt). When I went to pick up the order they told me we are not participating in the offer. They had my cell phone on order but didn't have the courtesy to call and at least tell that this order cannot be processed when they saw the order. They did give me money back by Cash. When I called Customer Service to talk about this issue, they confirmed this store HAS CHOSEN to participate in the offer but denied.

name: Erin Belk
text: The employees at this particular location are wonderful. They were very patient and friendly with my kids while they tried to decide what they wanted to eat. The restaurant is clean, and the food is good and inexpensive.

name: Jolene Bernhardt
text: No wait. Order prepared quickly and precisely. Delicious as always. So good to have a quick meal that is fairly healthy.

name: Brenda Hamilton
text: Three guys behind the counter, as I walk in they give me this glaring look. No one bothers to acknolwdge that I'd come into the store!! Didn't feel welcome and left! !!!

name: Martina Landrum
text: The little girl with the long pink nails was so rude! She should not be working in any establishment that’s customer facing. I visited just a few moments ago. She had an attitude for no reason as I ordered. When she checked me out, she didn’t say a word, didn’t hand me my receipt nor put it in the bag. Put it in the counter, walked away and got on her phone. The worst service ever!!!!

name: Dee Weeks
text: Very good

name: Braydon Bates
text: The new cheesy garlic bread is less cheesey than advertised. But still good. That night the subway was low on the produce though

name: Matt Pritchett
text: I've never had a bad experience here. Good staff.

name: Jordan Beveridge
text: Doesn’t serve the veggie patty :/

name: Michael Kearns
text: Nothing against this location in particular Subway has just fallen way behind other sub chains in quality.

name: Ana Hines
text: I sent my co-worker here to get me a sub, I wrote down everything I wanted, but this location didn't have nothing in stock such as, no guacamole, pepper jack cheese, buffalo sauce. Unsatisfied with this location.

name: Deb Guffey
text: Consistent. Nice & clean.

name: William Whitsett
text: Good

name: Corey Godwin
text: I'm here like three days a week

name: Bhaskar Yellamraju
text: Good

name: Krish 8810
text: Healthy sandwiches!!

name: ً ً
text: Great staff

name: Noetic Concordance
text: I love this food! My favorite thing to get is the modern Mediterranean snack box. The snack boxes make this place. I imagine if you are student walking around looking for something convenient to eat you might stop by Publix, DON'T keep walking and go to the stadium and pick up one of these snack boxes. Unfortunately that is where my expertise ends. It is the only thing I eat from here. Although I would not doubt the rest of their food is just as delicious. I guess it is hard to find. To be honest I have never eaten in the store I always use Crimson2Go. But imagine this would be just the thing to fuel a wary traveler downtown.

name: Jann Simpson
text: Zoe's has amazing fresh healthy food that is delicious! I would eat there everyday if I could :-). Plus the employees are very nice and courteous. I give them 5 stars!

name: venson nunnaley
text: Tried to order carry out, ended up having to order from Northport location because no one would answer the phone after 4 attempts during regular business hours.  Very frustrating when I have my mind set on a convenient meal from a good chain.  Must have very poor staff.

name: David Goist
text: Good food at good price.  Unique location.

name: Bethany Cox
text: Delicious fresh food.  Stopped by on the way through on a road trip.  It was a refreshing change of pace to the fried, greasy food at other restaurants.

name: Easir Papon
text: Excellent food....kabob is a must try

name: Lee Ann Wagner
