name: Jeff Chism
text: OK

name: Barrel racing W&H&M
text: Nice food

name: Michael Clark
text: Great food.

name: Adela Germano
text: Delicious healthy food

name: Mandy Nall
text: I've been a loyal patron of Country's BBQ since they opened their door for business on Zelda Road. It's truly the BEST BBQ locally.  Everything on the menu is homemade.  They offer everything from the best variety picks of vegetables (sweet potato is the bomb and HUGE, fried okra, corn on the cob, great fried green tomatoes are so yummy, field peas, mashed potatoes, cabbage… all recommended). The Q stew, i.e.:Brunswick stew is a winner. ALL PORK AND BEEF platters, inside or outside chopped, served with 1 or 2 sides,  French bread or cornbread will fill you up with a to-go box for sure. The ribs fall off the bone,  and I truly recommend the chef salad.  All dressings are homemade. Price per person is about $10-14 for a full meal. Homemade lemonade and sweet tea are outstanding. Don't forget dessert.  The pecan pie and lemon pie are the best around. If you've got the time to wait, their steaks are excellent too. Chopped steak is my favorite, the fried chicken fingers are so crisp and tender. My kids love them. They cater too, and do a very good job. Try a nearby Country's,  you won't be disappointed,  I promise.

name: Jeremy English
text: Had the special, pulled pork plate. It was honestly great, sauce was pleasing and not too sweet. The sweet tea was outstanding, service was good, it wasn't crowded at all when I went. A little pricey at $13+, though.

name: Linda H
text: I am very impressed with the owner of this establishment. If for some reason you have any problem, he will immediately take care of it for you. I suppose any of us can have a less than favorable experience, anywhere, at any time. I know first hand that Mr. Powell appears to care that his customers have a favorable experience!

resp.text: Dear Linda H, I greatly apologize for your experience this weekend with Country's Barbecue. That is not how I want our customers to be dining on a holiday! Please call me at the corporate office so I can make it up to you. Sincerely, Mark Powell 271-2017

name: Cynthia P
text: Can't wrong with Country's BBQ.  I've never ordered anything I didn't enjoy.  They have a great club Sammy, a great (big) salad, great chopped pork, delicious sides and so much more!!  If you don't give them a try, you will be missing out on a great meal.

name: UnicornPoo OnU
text: This is the second time me and my girlfriend have eaten here. The first time it was ok but nothing to write home about and tonight made the first time seem like a great experience. She got the pulled pork sandwich and fries. The pork was tough and cold and the fries were cold and covered in grease. I got the Larry's Special which is supposed to be tenderloin marinated in special sauce, and fries. The meat came out just slightly warm and the fries were cold and covered in grease. When they refer to their special sauce, what the menu should say is that the meat has been swimming in Dale's Sauce for about a week and is almost too salty to eat. The waiter asked how the food was, which was obviously a formality because when I told him he acted as if I'd said the food was great and walked away. That's the last $30 this place will ever get out of me.

resp.text: Hi Jonathan, I am sorry you were less than happy with your recent experience at our Zelda Rd. location. Everyone can have a bad day and maybe you caught us on one of ours. Please call me at the corporate office (271-2017) so I can make it up to you. I hope you'll give us another try. Sincerely, Mark Powell - Owner

name: Brian Wilson
text: Loved our experience at Country's BBQ on Zelda Road in Montgomery!  Highly recommend to anyone for some of the best BBQ in the River Region.  Wife and I thoroughly enjoyed the food and the sauces were to DIE FOR!

name: K&A GrassBusters
text: Ordered to go at Zelda Rd. I give a 2 star only because the stew and the tea was good.  My fiance order was messed up she ordered Okra and got fries cold fries at that also we didn't get the bread with our order. We changed from the Atlanta Hwy location to Zelda Rd because ATL Hwy messed our order up big time with my whole family it took us months to eat at Country's again probably will just cook my own from now on seeing the one place that had it together when I was growing surely doesn't have it any more

name: Jessie Godfrey
text: The food was fantastic and the service was spot on! Had the chef salad with homemade ranch with pulled pork with bacon! Yes, it was as amazing as it sounds!

name: Kaleigh Flatt
text: Great place for lunch.  I always get the vegetable plate or the brunswick stew.  And of course a giant sweet tea!

name: Tech Man
text: 2 or 3 times a year I drive from Atlanta to Mobile and back, this is my halfway point. I do not miss stopping in for lunch in both directions! Always great food and smiles!

name: Jacob Sterrett
text: Absolutely delicious, we had the barbeque platters with two of the sides from the infinite selection. Meat was great, they had wonderful sauces as well. Would reccomend 5/5!

name: Pamala Howell-Paoli
text: We were travelling through and looked on our phone to see what BBQ places were here. To my enthusiasm n surprise, Country's BBQ. I grew up in Columbus, Ga and go back from time to time. And EVERY TIME I do go back 1st place I stop is Country's. I LOVE Columbus Country BBQ and longed for it. About 3pm when we first walked in, the Mgr told us "to walk over there, grab a menu and seat where ever we wanted". There was 2 other couples in dining area. The waitress was outstanding!! I don't remember her name, but she was super bubblely. But we were so disappointed with the food. I ordered my usual; pulled pork platter. Husband ordered his usual; 1/2 chicken. Well the pork was drowned in chutney n coleslaw juices, which totally ruined the taste mainly b/c I don't like chutney. I used a numerous amount of napkins to dry up the juice. Husband's chicken looked liked it was cooked the day before or real early that morning. The BBQ sauce was dried and skin was wrinkled up and some spots were burnt. It was very dry. Husband informed waitress and she was very helpful and offered another one, fresher or something else. He ordered another chicken. The 2nd chicken was a more moist but didn't compare to the taste of Country's in Columbus. If Jim is affiliated with this establishment, he would be ashamed. Also, the Mgr had fixed a plate for herself and sat and ate. Not once did she come over to ask about why we sent it back.  How convenient it would've been since we travel through Montgomery often and it's closer than Columbus for us. Needless to say, we won't be coming back or if by some chance we do, we will hope to remember and not order the same thing.......

resp.text:
Dear Pamala,

I am so sorry to hear about your recent experience at our Zelda Road location. I am glad your waitress was wonderful, but I am disappointed to hear about your food experience. Thank you for bringing these issues to my attention so I can address them immediately. I would like to make it up to you! Please give me a call at the corporate office... 334-271-2017

Sincerely,
Mark Powell, Owner

name: Jim Davis
text: My wife and I have been stopping at Country's for over 25 years when traveling between Atlanta and Pensacola FL. The BBQ is excellent, sweet potatoes are hugh, the backfire slaw is tangy, and the fried green tomatoes are outstanding. We love this restaurant.

name: MARJORIE BAKER
text: Excellent, excellent barbecue, great brunswick stew, top notch chef salad and good southern sweet tea.  Would just ask them to work on appearance of restaurant, particularly the drive thru area.  Needs a bit of cleaning at the window, outside and inside.

name: Robert Smith
text: This was the first time we have eaten at (take out) Country's BBQ (night of 23 Feb 2015).  I am not sure if the staff was just busy at time of order or what.  While calling in the order the person taking the order seemed inpatient. We picked up the order 10 minutes later and noticed there was only one person dining in Country's BBQ, 4 staff in the kitchen and one or two staff in the dining area. About 4 orders were picked up while we waited 10 more minutes (added item to order) for our order. After getting home I realized my 1/2 and 1/2 order of fried pickles and onions was far from being fried.  In fact it was very clear they had gone straight from the container to my take out container. Not cooked what-so-ever. I was soo disappointed. Was really looking forward to trying the side dishes. Now I travel a lot and have been to great BBQ places across the US and outside the US and this is definetly not one of them. Anyone who says Country's BBQ is great has not had good BBQ. Aside from the poorly prepared side dishes the BBQ (chicken and beef) was just okay, definetly not worth mentioning. Being that the food was just okay at best there was no reason to call and complain as we would have only gotten more phone attitude.  Would not recommend this place.

resp.text:
Dear Robert,
Please allow us to apologize. We get a lot of good comments about our marinated barbecue onions. We have garnished our plates with these for 33 years. We only started frying these a short while ago. I have found the ticket for that evening and it is obvious that we filled the order with or regular marinated onions not fried… The order the chef got reflected barbecue onions and pickles, not fried or half-n-half. A simple miscommunication.  Please feel free to call the corporate office anytime you are not satisfied. 334-271-2017. I would be glad to forward you a replacement coupon or a refund. Thank you for taking the time to advise us.  Your business is sincerely appreciated.
Sincerely,
Mark Powell, Owner

text: Nice seafood house with fantastic oysters, friendly staff, fast , fresh food & cold beer.

text: Love this place!  Always get the oyster sampler (pictured) and a side salad with the spicy ranch (best salad dressing ever).  They make their own croutons.  Good happy hour deals too!

name: Lisa Evitts
text: Me and my husband stopped by for dinner as we were passing through as we are not from the area, and some locals recommended Wintzell's. We were greeted the minute we walked in, and seated right away. The waitress was very nice, kept drinks refilled and always asked if we needed anything when she passed. The food was hot, fresh and great. Maybe the decor could use some updating, tables and floors could use a good scrubbing  they seemed a little sticky.

name: Kimberly Christmas
text: Celebrated my birthday there with friends. The staff was very accommodating and friendly. Food was good; I had the Shrimp and Grits. I've had better at Connors. Could use some decor updates.

name: Grumpy Kitty
text: Service is terrible!  I've gotten food from here twice and had to wait 30 min both times.  The food here is incredible but get it together people!  The prices are kinda high but they are unique and worth it to me.  Every time I go to Mobile I go to the one there.  I am working in Huntsville, and so happy to see Wintzell's!  We need one in Birmingham.

name: Jacob Chancery
text: I got a dozen raw oysters and a creamy crab soup.  The oysters were only $10.99, so it's worth it to ask what the "market price" is for that day.  I wouldn't pay $21 for a dozen like Blaine did.  The oysters were good, no grit in them.  And the crab soup had plenty of chunks of real crab meat.  I could tell because there were one or two pieces of that thin shell membrane that's almost impossible to dig the meat out of.

name: Sarah Mosley-Webb
text: The best seafood that I have ever eaten. Portions are wonderful and so is the staff. The staff are very knowledgeable.  The restaurant is quant place which I will come back to over and over again.

name: Schyler West
text: Whimsical atmosphere was nice. Food was so so. I had shrimp and grits, which were edible but nothing to write home about. A dozen oysters came to about $15. They were on the small side, so we got a couple more than a dozen.

name: Chuck Miller
text: Just rolled in from the Bay Area, and I wanted a couple beers and a place to watch playoff hockey.  I was staying at the Hampton, and checked Google Maps...low and behold I find this place just behind my motel!  Wintzell's was just what I was looking for;  a nice Sports Bar, and very good service.  I agree with Lee's post on the food, especially those jerky nachos.  I'll be back for more tomorrow!

name: Michael Edwards
text: In town for biz. Against a local's recommendation, went to Wintzell's. First, no local or craft beer. Second, ordered 1/2 doz of grilled oysters. Worst oysters I've every put in my mouth.  Waitress was very nice and insisted I not pay. Left her an appropriate tip for what the oysters cost.

name: Justin Malone
text: Always good food.  The J.O. Platters are a safe bet for first timers, as well as the fried green tomatoes.

name: PJ McPhearson
text: Ate near the one in B'ham. It was great start to,finish. Love the crab claws. Awesome. Nicolette was a great waitress..

name: Michael Tomsik
text: Great fish and chicken basket. Mild on the tartar sauce and cole slaw. Great service.

name: Lee Wood
text: Great lunch menu. Friendly staff. Great food. Carolyn was my server and she rocked.

name: Sara Harris
text:
I'm not one to usually leave a negative review and it takes A LOT to piss me off about anything. However,  mine and my boyfriends experience tonight was worth the bad review. Took 15 minutes just for anyone to take our drink orders, took even longer to get them and the food was a joke.  The cups of gumbo were not the same temperature,  mine was good but my boyfriends was almost cold when he got it. We ordered the broccoli and cheese,  when they brought it to us, it literally had a slice of craft cheese on top (not melted), it looked like something a child tried to put together.  The baked potato was not even on a plate,  just wrapped in aluminum foil and flopped on the table.  The oysters were overcooked and a bit rubbery.
Very disappointed because we don't have many places to eat seafood in Huntsville. Was hoping this place would be the new go to.

name: Barry Allen
text: The food was okay but the three giant cockroaches that joined us at our table were not, I also could have done without the kitchen staff screaming obscenities. The server was great but clearly over-worked and abused by the management. Honestly I'm surprised that place is even still open.

name: Michael Robison
text: Food was great, but the service was horrible. It took 10 minutes to get a beverage, 40 minutes to get an appetizer, and over an hour to get raw oysters and a soup. I had to go to the bar to get a second drink after waiting 30 minutes. I asked to speak to a manager and after waiting 10 more minutes no one came by our table. Needless to say I will not be back.

name: Bob Stell
text: Good seafood. Lots of sports TVs. Prices a little high. Updated. ....restaurant is now closed! !

name: Jeff Estes
text: Good food and service. Casual. A little pricey.

name: Larry Cain
text: Marylin the serve was wonderful and the food exceptional some of the best fish tacos I've had and the oysters were really good as well.   Will eat here next time I'm in Huntsville!

name: Daniel Rivera
text: I was hoping for better. The waiter worked with me to find something healthy, which was a challenge. Spicy streamed oysters should be called death-by-salt oysters. Chilli and mahi where ok.

name: Blaine Simpson
text:
Maybe their fried fare is better, but for people looking for the real deal, they suck.

$21 for 12 whole oysters at lunch time!  That is with no drink, vege,  bread, or anything, and before tax and tip.  Seriously.

6 raw on the half-shell.  Tasted fine, but there were considerable scales of shell mixed in with the oyster in 4 of the 6!  Couldn't have a less competent oyster shucker back in their kitchen.

The 6 "grilled" oysters were over-dressed so that you could taste nothing but the cheese and salt.  Why pay neary $2 per oyster when you can barely taste them?

If raw oysters are important to you, at New China Buffet, about 5 minutes away, you can get a complete meal including all the oysters-on-the-halfshell you want, for about $12 (probably less at lunch time).

Like Tom Petty's runaway train, I'm never going back.

name: Anne Crandall
text:
When on vacation to the gulf, oysters are in order. This place was right near our condo, so we decided to give it a try Sunday, 6/2/13 around 2:30pm. We sat outside on the patio and were waited on by Chris.

Have to be honest, I'm not sure if it's a Southern hospitality thing, but the waitstaff we encountered in Alabama in general was just of very high caliber. Chris was the best of them all.

Before we even sat down, we noticed turtles swimming in the pond and stepped to an empty area of the patio to check them out. He appeared with crackers and asked if we wanted to feed them, and then told us all about them. Super cool way to start a meal.

We ordered 1/2 dz raw oysters and 1/2 dz Bienville, plus a cup of gumbo and some pineapple upside down cake.

Everything was amazing. The raw oysters were rather large, but then again I live in Colorado so large might be the norm. I remarked that they were the largest I've seen, and Chris went on to tell us about the giant ones they get there and seemed very engaged in his job.

The gumbo was fantastic and the pineapple upside down cake was 'extra caramelly' according to our waiter, which was great.

The manager even came over to check on us at one point and we had a really nice conversation about the Bienville vs chargrilled.

Top notch, one of our best meals in Orange Beach to be sure. I would highly recommend, and would certainly go back.

Me and my wife have enjoyed this place many times before but tonight was like a whole different restaraunt .  horrific cooking prime rib ice cold sent back, than its brought back with a ton of sauce over it covering up the fact that  the steak is way over cooked and chewy...the manager omg she was a joke where did yall get her from krystals i mean she literaly snatched my receipt out of my hand after attempting to charge me for the steak get rid of that kind of service or sink like lonestar ...

text: Worst experience ever. My boyfriend ordered through the mobile app and when I got there the lady said they had not received an order. I had a screenshot of the order and showed her after she rudely said he must have put the order in at another location. She snatched my phone and called her manager and was discussing then asked for a screenshot of the payment status when it was on the first picture but anyways after showing the payment status, she slides my phone across the counter and does not say anything to me if she or isn't going to make it. The gas station clerk asked me if they were going to get me straight and I said well I hope so. Then the subway lady doesn't acknowledge me and says to the gas station lady, so the order was lost and she (me) is going to have get refunded so it's like she (me) is getting the sandwiches for free. I didn't care for a refund, after 15 minutes I just wanted my food. When she finished making the sandwiches, she put them in the bag and slid the bag across the counter and I was trying to be nice because maybe she had a bad day or her manager wasn't so nice on the phone and said hope that wasn't an hassle. She walks off and says it happens. I did not appreciate the service she gave. Next time, I'll go to jersey mike's.

Everything was completely shut down which led  me to believe that it was closed even earlier than  the 20 minutes and the employee gave us such a dirty look as she talked with the employee of the station side of the store. It was definitely one of those "Just Wow" moments.

We have a total new staff, including management, and are working hard to improve our store and rebuild our business. I would like to invite our community to revisit our Subway for delicious sandwiches and salads served with great service and smiling faces! We are also now proudly accepting EBT at our location.

text: I just let myself in. No, my whole family and I just let ourselves in. The room was unlocked. No one was around. No one was on site to be reached about reserving the space. Perhaps it was just bad timing.

text: Service was good, food was not. It was like Dollar Tree Subway. It would have been fine as a subway knockoff but the prices didn't reflect that at all. Tea was very old, sandwiches were bland.

resp.text:
We want our guests to feel that the quality of the food they receive matches the price they paid, and it is disappointing to hear that you do not feel that way. We will ensure your comments are passed along for the private owner and our marketing department to review. We are tremendously grateful for your feedback, Xanthey, and hope you give us another chance to make you a fan!

Anna / Guest Services

name: Marla Brewer
text: A wonderful addition to the selection of places to eat in our town. Firehouse Subs offers hot and fresh sandwiches as well as salads, soups and mac and cheese. Fresh made tea is a real pleasure, although no senior drink discount was a disappointment. The staff is very friendly and efficient. Our food came in a very reasonable amount of time, they do need to work on identifying different sandwiches in large orders. Overall I was impressed with my first visit to a Firehouse and will return. Be sure to sign up for the rewards program.

resp.text:
Marla, thank you for the awesome feedback! We can't wait to see you on future visits, your loyalty is greatly appreciated.
Hannah/ Guest Services

name: Kenya Baldwin
text: Firehouse Subs coming to Andalusia soon! The one star review below is not accurate! At this location there is and will soon be open a firehouse sub! I will come back once open and leave a new review for them below!

name: William Cassa
text: Left wallet with money in it on Monday on the way to the beach.   They had it there on Friday on the way home.   Will make it a regular stop.   Great food too!

resp.text:
Wow, that's some high praise, William! We hope to see you soon!

Trista/Guest Services

name: Fred Flintstone
text: The managers and most of the staff are very friendly and happy. This energy rubs off on us every time we visit. The food could be mediocre and we’d still come for the friendly atmosphere. The fact that the food is awesome makes it a five star experience!

resp.text:
Fred, thank you for sharing your experience! It's great to hear the staff was able to deliver heartfelt subs and service. We hope you visit again sometime soon.

Anna / Guest Services

name: Albert Robertson
text: The food is good and I like the way they greet everyone when they come in.

resp.text:
Great food and heartfelt service are what we believe our guests deserve and what we strive for each day! We hope you visit again soon, Albert.

Anna / Guest Services

name: Dana Smith
text: My husband and I decided to try it out since we normally love Firehouse! I realize they’re new and not all locations will do what other locations do. I ordered an Italian, normally they’ll allow me to get turkey instead of ham, but not here. I also asked for no tomatoes, no onions, and no mustard... all three were on my sandwich. I’m not sure what the point of asking how I’d like my sandwich if you’re not going to do it right. Normally I would take it back and have them remake it but I didn’t this time bc we just wanted to eat and head on to my in-laws house. Hopefully it’s just because their new and this isn’t the norm. We will probably give them another shot.

resp.text:
We appreciate your patronage and your feedback. Hearing that your order was not made correctly is very upsetting, Dana. We strive to provide quality food, made accurately, for each and everyone one of our guests. We are very sorry and will ensure your comments are passed along for the private owner to review and address internally. Thanks again, Dana, for providing us with this invaluable feedback!
Sabrina/Guest Services

name: EVA Ellis
text: Great food, staff is a little slow, and They forgot my pickles, but food was delicious.

resp.text:
Eva, thank you for taking the time to share your concerns with us. Please know that we take them seriously and your comments have been passed along for the proper leadership to review. We appreciate you bringing this to our attention. We hope you have a great day!
Hannah/ Guest Services

name: Jay Patel
text: New, clean, great service and crew, no doubt!

resp.text:
Our goal is to deliver excellent subs and service, and we're glad to have hit that mark with you! Please come see us again soon!
Hannah/ Guest Services

name: Josh Penton
text: This Firehouse is by far equipped with the cleanest environment and caring staff. They are consistent when making their subs, as I have never had a mistake and have always received a hot/tasty sub!

resp.text:
Josh, thank you so much for the fantastic review. The Andalusia team will be happy to hear that their hard work and dedication has not gone unnoticed.  We hope this means we can count you in as a fan and we look forward to seeing you, your family and friends soon.
Sabrina/Guest Services

name: Jessica Byrd
text: Great service and good food.

resp.text:
Your review means a lot to us, Jessica, and we can't wait for you to visit again soon!

Anna / Guest Services

name: Jimmy Green
text: The food was great but the atmosphere and staff was horrible. Was here 2 days ago during the day and it's was 5 stars hands down.

resp.text:
Jimmy, the behavior and actions you describe are absolutely not what we like to hear. Our mission is to provide sincere, inviting, and heartfelt service to all of our guests. Your comments will be passed along to the private owner for review. We are very grateful for your feedback and hope to see you soon.

Anna / Guest Services

name: christopher parkin
text: I love the sub sandwiches and the staff are friendly and fast

resp.text:
Thank you so much, Christopher, for visiting with us and sharing your awesome feedback. Hearing that the food and service you received was highly impressive warms our hearts. We hope this means we can count you in as a fan! Thanks again, Christopher.

Trista/Guest Services

name: JP Stuart
text:
Club on a Sub was delicious, as well as the Mac N Cheese! The wait wasn't bad for a new store, but I was there when they opened.

As Arnold said, I will be back!

resp.text:
JP, thank you for the awesome feedback! We can't wait to see you on future visits, your loyalty is greatly appreciated.

Anna / Guest Services

name: Sheila Wilson
text: Very good! Service was excellent!

resp.text:
Sheila, thank you for the 5-star review! We appreciate you being a fan.

Trista/Guest Services

name: Kirk
text: Great. Nice staff. One of the employees recommended a sauce to me while cleaning the store, and grabbed it for me.

resp.text:
Thank you for visiting, Kirk! We're delighted to have you as a fan, and hope you enjoyed the sauce! Your feedback is greatly appreciated and we hope to see you again sometime soon.
Kaley/Guest Services

name: Amy Baker
text: Always a great place to eat food always on point

resp.text:
Amy, thank you for the awesome feedback! We can't wait to see you on future visits, your loyalty is greatly appreciated.
Hannah/ Guest Services

name: Laura Garrett
text: Great sandwiches! Highly recommend!

resp.text:
Our goal is to deliver excellent subs and service, and we're glad to have hit that mark with you! Please come see us again soon!
Hannah/ Guest Services

name: J Lo
text:
Normally great hot STEAMED subs... not today!!
Sub was served not split as ordered, cold not steamed as it is supposed to be, in one box and falling apart!!! Very disappointing.
Jlo

resp.text:
We are very appreciative of your patronage and feedback. We'd like to extend our deepest apologies and let you know that your concerns regarding the poor quality and inaccuracies of your order will be passed along for the private owner to review. Guests like you, who are willing to share your experience with us, help us ensure we keep improving our craft. We hope you give us another chance soon.

Anna / Guest Services

name: Haley Harper
text: Awesome service and such friendly staff. I have always been a fan, and this one did not disappoint. Thank you Andalusia Firehouse!

resp.text:
Wow, what a great review to read, Haley. Your amazing feedback means the world to us as does your patronage. We can't thank you enough. We hope you come back to see us again, soon!
Sabrina/Guest Services

name: James Jackson
text: It’s was great. Good customer service and the food was delicious!

resp.text:
Thank you for visiting, James! We're delighted to have you as a fan. Your feedback is greatly appreciated and we hope to see you again sometime soon.
Sabrina/Guest Services

name: Allison Jones
text: Sadly, being a Cali girl here visiting family.  I believe this experience was worse than spending time with my family lol 😆

resp.text:
Allison, thank you for taking the time to share your concerns with us. Please know that we take them seriously and your comments have been passed along for the proper leadership to review. We appreciate you bringing this to our attention. We hope you have a great day!

Trista/Guest Services

name: Ken Shepherd
text: Love It! Always quality sandwiches!

resp.text:
Thanks for the love, Ken! We're thrilled to hear that you love our subs as much as we do. See you soon!
Hannah/ Guest Services

name: Ron “Yogi” Terry
text: This place was remarkable!

resp.text:
Ron, it's wonderful to hear that the Firehouse Subs crew provided you with a 5-star experience. The fact that you took the time to provide us with your feedback is greatly appreciated and we can't wait to see you again soon. We hope you will invite all of your family and friends to give us a try sometime.

Trista/Guest Services

name: Wade Lambert
text: Great Food ... Great Service!!!

resp.text:
We wouldn't want you to receive anything less. Your review is greatly appreciated, Wade.
Hannah/ Guest Services

name: Mark Sands
text: New restaurant. Still working some of the bugs out, but the service and food were OK.  Not yet up to normal Firehouse standards but I think they will get there soon.

resp.text:
Mark, thank you for your invaluable feedback. We hope this means we can see you again soon to earn that 5th star.

Anna / Guest Services

name: Gorden Litchfield
text: okay u guys are new i understand that but stop think dont be in a hurry my sub wasnt toast no warm a cold sub well subway toast and makes it warm fire house subs in enterprise does too...so please dont be another new fast food that doesnt try in customer satisfaction because u will not survive...

name: Josh Dutton
text: Hands down the best sandwiches in Covington County!

resp.text:
Josh, thank you for the 5-star review! We appreciate you being a fan.

Trista/Guest Services

name: diane harris
text: Awesome food and service

resp.text:
Thank you for sharing your love with us, Diane! We truly enjoy providing our guests with delicious food and all around satisfying experiences, so we hope that you will pay us another visit soon.
Hannah/ Guest Services

name: Brienna Ambrose
text: Ate there with my friend Allison, as we are from Cali.  I hope this chain never makes it out west.  I'll stick with IN-N-OUT!

resp.text:
Brienna, thank you for taking the time to share your concerns with us. Please know that we take them seriously and your comments have been passed along for the proper leadership to review. We appreciate you bringing this to our attention. We hope you have a great day!

name: Jacky Cannon
text: Was hungry and got a bite for supper

resp.text:
Jacky, thank you for the awesome feedback! We can't wait to see you on future visits, your loyalty is greatly appreciated.
Hannah/ Guest Services

name: Paula Payne
text: Been 3 times in 2 weeks.   I have ordered for the family, a total of 17 sandwiches...all large, with only 1 being a small.  Every single sandwich has been made wrong, with the exception of one; however, my mother, whom is the widow of a Disabled Wartime Military Veteran wouldn't really know if its made right. The manager is a rude brute, and Corporate Firehouse Subs doesn't care how their salary payers are treated.

resp.text:
Paula, the behavior, actions, and the inaccuracy of the order,  you describe are absolutely not what we like to hear. Our mission is to provide sincere, inviting, and heartfelt service to all of our guests. Your comments will be passed along to the private owner for review. We are very grateful for your feedback and hope to see you soon.

Trista/Guest Services

name: Judith Bozeman
text: Great sandwiches and service!!!

Thank you for visiting, Judith! We're delighted to have you as a fan. Your feedback is greatly appreciated and we hope to see you again sometime soon.

text: Excellent Sandwich

Migdalia, thank you for the 5-star review! We appreciate you being a fan.

Desirae/Guest Services

name: Justin Griffin
text: Great food awesome,customer service

name: Bridget Harper
text: Great food, great service!!

resp.text:
Thanks for the compliment, Bridget, your kind words mean a lot to us! We look forward to seeing you again soon.
Sabrina/Guest Services

name: Kim Barber
text: Delicious!

resp.text:
Thank you for stopping in, Kim. We hope you'll be back soon so we can impress you with more of our awesome selection!
Hannah/ Guest Services

name: Nelson Quesada
text: Slow service

name: Charles Mohon

resp.text:
Charles, thank you for the great feedback! We can't wait to see you on future visits, your loyalty is greatly appreciated.

text: Terribly expensive
