text: Excellent! Everything was fresh and tasted great! Pork sandwich was moist and very tasty. Steak fries and baked beans were hot and fresh.

name: Robert Parker
text:
Today was a disappointing dining experience beginning with the young lady taking our order.  During the order she’d taken our order incorrectly twice that we understood and then after lunch delivered to our table realized actually three times.  My wife had ordered Caesar salad with grilled chicken tenders.  The young lady taking our order even asked what kind of dipping sauce would you like?  The salad was delivered to our table without chicken tenders. The gentleman who’d delivered to our table said he’d be back in a few minutes with the tenders.  Twenty three minutes later we left without the chicken.
Perhaps extenuating circumstances lead to this extremely poor service such as masks muffling our voices, plastic partition, loud background music and maybe the young lady just didn’t care.  Idk.  But I do know we won’t be back. As in Dothan Alabama there are plenty of good alternatives to have a good meal with reasonably good service.

resp.text: Hello, thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to contact our marketing coordinator at erin@fullmoonbbq.com to discuss your experience further. We want to hear from you!

name: Southern Family Matters
text: The food here is out of this world. We have had a few drive through issues but nothing major. For the most part its quick great food and everyone is happy to see you there. They have a spicy white sauce that they serve that is the best! The fried green tomatoes alone are worth the trip there. This is my favorite BBQ place to eat.

text: Food was great.

This used to be our go to for bbq. This visit we had chicken plates. The chicken was so over cooked we couldn’t eat it

text: Took a BBQ tour from North Florida to Memphis and stopped at many places along the way. Full Moon had THE BEST pulled pork sandwich. The "regular" was huge. It didn't n Ed a thing either, mark of good BBQ. But I did pick up a couple bottles of the white BBQ sauce and that went quick after the trip. The deviled eggs were also worth getting. We also tried the BBQ nachos, I am ready for that trend to fad it always ends up not what it could have been. Now if they did a shredded chicken nachos with that white sauce, we could talk about it. Sausage and cheese plate was exactly that, more tradition than anything, sausage was a little spicy. Also took carrot cake home, it hits it out of the park for sure!

name: Christopher DiNatale
text:
After looking through the reviews it seems the majority of the 1 star reviews have come recently. It's a shame because we were told this was the best BBQ in Alabama. I unfortunately am going to disagree with that claim.

We ordered take out for a party we were having. Several pounds of pulled pork and pulled chicken. The BBQ was ok, nothing spectacular. We did however have quite a few bones in both the chicken and pork which was alarming since we have young children who were also eating the food. I will say that the sauce itself was pretty good. So there was at least one positive.

The real disappointment with this establishment came to the bill. Total for our order was $150 which was split with another party. Rather than charging myself $75 and the other party $75, they charged me $150, then charged me again $75, then charged me again another $75. The other part was double charged as well. Upon complaining to Full Moon, I was told that I was not charged multiple times and that it was an issues with both my bank, and the other parties bank. It's now the next week and they are still in fact trying to charge my bank the additional charges, that is per my bank.

Would you like to pay over $400 for only $150 of sub-par BBQ? Probably not. I'd make this restaurant a hard pass if I'm ever again in the Dothan area.

resp.text: Hi Christopher, thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to reach out to our marketing coordinator at kylie@fullmoonbbq.com with your preferred method of contact to discuss your experience. We want to hear from you!

text: I've been to this restaurant many times and had a great experience each time but tonight was very different. The cashier that took our order was so preoccupied with complaining about another customer who complained about getting their order wrong that she didn't even ask us if she could take our order. After some uncomfortable wait for her to acknowledge us I finally gave up and just blurted out my order which she took while she steamed. We then seat ourselves at a filthy dining room table that we had to wipe off ourselves. So then we get our chicken sandwiches we ordered and discovered the buns were soggy because the person that prepared them was too lazy to toast the bun like usual. Didn't dare complain after witnessing how the other customer was treated . Besides I was worried they might do something bad to my food.  Doubt I'll be back even though my wife and I eat here at least 3 times a month. Would love to hear from somebody in management. I have my receipt and can tell you who waited on me.

resp.text: Hi Den, thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to contact our marketing director at erin@fullmoonbbq.com to discuss your experience. We'd love to hear from you.

name: Tom Miller
text: When I was in Dothan traveling home I wound up staying at the Marriott so I asked the front manager where was a good BBQ place to checkout as I wanted to sample some Alabama BBQ and they told me Full Moon BBQ it's just around the corner so I went there based on their suggestion. I'm kinda open to new places and exploring as long as the food is great and the place is clean. Didn't take me too long to find it overall the place was nice and clean but it had a tourist trap vibe sadly most of the places in this area trying to compete for your almighty dollars. I'm more into comfort food cafeteria style food and awesome BBQ but none to be found that I knew about in this area so I decided for this place. Wish I could sample the food at places to decide what tasted awesome? I got a Brisket chicken platter. The food was not bad good portions self serve on drinks and BBQ sauces to me a little pricey but overall not bad but to me it kinda lacked a smoked flavor? I've eaten a lot of BBQ over the years and I know good BBQ. Overall, the place had a bunch of celebrity pictures on the wall with TV's in the corner kinda felt more like a sports bar than a BBQ place? The place was clean and probably not a bad place to take a friend or meet up with someone as it was convenient but depends what you are looking for and how picky you are in great BBQ. So the quest for better BBQ goes on next time I'm in the area for a better place.

name: Larry Clark
text: When my family came to visit from Kentucky they had a craving for barbeque. I knew just where to take them. Upon arrival you'll notice the smoke coming from the chimney, exhaust from the in house smoker, and a slight aroma of a outdoor style BBQ. When you enter the building you'll immediately smell the BBQ, the smell alone makes your mouth water. They have a large menu board and paper menus available to select from. The pricing is a little high, but the portions are large. Everything on the menu is delicious. You order and pay at the counter and are handed a number to place on your table. Then the food is brought to the table. Needless to say my family was very impressed and all agreed they would have to return to Full Moon next time they visited. Oh, and try the white BBQ sauce.

resp.text: This makes us very happy to hear we have new fans in Kentucky! Thank you for choosing our BBQ to share! See you all again soon!

name: Floyd Buchanan
text: Friendly staff and great food!

name: Latia Williams
text: When this place first opened it was awesome the ribs were to die for, I haven't been in awhile but I visited today ordered a rib plate with okra and baked beans. It was OK that they put fries instead of okra they fixed they and my ribs were hard not fall off the bone at all then they had the nerve to give me extra 2 ribs for the mess up that was more hard then the ones they gave me SMH

resp.text: Hi Latia, thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to contact our marketing coordinator at kylie@fullmoonbbq.com to discuss your experience. We want to hear from you!

name: Isabel Silvey
text: There loaded backed potatoes are so good

name: Norwood Andrews
text: Food was great service could have been better

name: Chuck Linderman
text:
Greatest Brisket served outside of Texas -Oklahoma. Ribs are Huge and meaty. Coleslaw is vinegar based and so good you'll scoop up every morsel
Wife had the loaded baked potato and at first glance I thought it was a football !
Little pricey but worth a shot if you truly love BBQ.

resp.text: Thanks for the kind words, Chuck! We're so glad you and your wife enjoyed Full Moon BBQ! Come back and see us soon!

name: Melanie Ferguson
text: Home town with Alabama Great food. Good prices. Friendly service & fun, very clean atmosphere.

name: Tina Briar
text: One of the best BBQ places I've ever been to!

name: Joshua Hutchison
text: They got some big ole baked potates

name: Wanda Barber
text: Awesome service and Awesome 👍 Food .

text: Better check your food before you leave , missing a sandwich

resp.text: Hi Ralph, thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to contact our marketing coordinator at emory@fullmoonbbq.com to discuss your experience. We want to hear from you!

name: Emily Robbs
text: I was a little wary of eating here because I've heard awful things about another location nearby. Thankfully this one is doing a good job. Service was quick and friendly. Food was a little expensive BUT you get plenty of it for the money. Taste was alright--definitely better than I expected from a chain, but certainly not as good as some mom n' pop places. I wouldn't go every time I needed a BBQ fix, but I would recommend it to anyone on that side of town.

name: evi brown
text:
Best Barbecue ever.
Also one of the clearest Restaurants I have been to.
We come here every other week to eat all the way from panama city.

name: Brook Smith
text: Love the bbq sandwich and white sauce. Mac and cheese or baked beans side I choose over fried foods here.

name: Jennifer Hall
text: Pretty good with dine-in and drive thru.

resp.text: Hi Jennifer, thank you for taking the time to review us!

name: Jessica smith
text: Every time I come to Alabama this place is a MUST to stop at.  The Big Baker is incredible and big enough for leftovers!  Whether it's War Eagle or Roll Tide you will love this place!

resp.text: Hi Jessica, thank you for your feedback! Be sure and try our burgers, ribs, and award-winning desserts at your next visit!

name: Blou Haze
text: This was our first visit we have been disappointed.  The food took quite a while to get to us, we usually get it in 5 minutes or so, it was closer to 20 minutes. The food was cold, not cool, but cold. It was edible, but very disappointing.  The staff didnt really seem to be concerned about anything,  other than talking to one another. We normally love this place.

name: Charlie Collins
text: Very quick service and extremely friendly staff. Food is excellent and portions are large. Great atmosphere and just a good place to eat

name: Taneya Daniels
text: Love, love the food at this place, only downside is they consistently get my order wrong.

name: Peg Gawne-Mark
text: Great fried green tomatoes and catfish but the mac and cheese wad cold!

name: Sally Smith
text: Pretty pricey for a simple meal and it was disappointing to be served our food on a peice of paper on the plastic red tray. For $25 for two sandwiches, fries and teas it would have been great to have had at least a plate. The food is good..but probably my last visit.

name: Lori Bighems
text: The staff is so friendly and the barbecue is delicious!! The prices are also very reasonable.

name: Nichole Taylor
text: We love this BBQ place. Pulled pork sandwhiches are good. Jumbo baked potato is tasty. Bring a sweatshirt if you're eating in because every time we go it's freezing cold inside.

name: John Guisinger
text: The food was excellent! Was my first time there and I'll definitely go back again.

name: Aaron Bastian
text: The Ribs and Brisket were some of the best I've ever had. The sides can use a bit of work. Nice clean place with fast service. Great place to try.

name: Anthony Richardson
text: First, i would like to start of by saying, this is one of my favorite places to eat in Dothan. With that said, I had an experience there that has me rethinking my BBQ choices. My family and I went to Full Moom last weekend to celebrate my son's birthday. We ordered the smokey wings like we always do, as well as ribs, greens, mac and cheese, and fried okra. The sides were tasty as always, the okra cooked a little too hard, but edible. The wings however were smoked, but very raw inside. I am not sure why because it took them an hour to bring out the wings in the first place. When we brought this to the attention of the staff, they apologized and said they are not smoking anymore wings so we would have to choose something else. We specifically came for the smoked wings, but we had already been there over an hour at this point and just wanted to consume a meal. They were suppose to replace two 10 piece orders, buy brought two six pieces. Once this what brought to their attention the server got upset and said you need to go up to the register with your concern and they will work out a refund. So not only did they have cook my food, short me my food. I waited in a 20 min line to get reimbursed for services not rendered. This was my first bad experience at full moon, but sometimes that is enough. I sent a message to the survey on the back of the receipt and not one person's follow-up up.

resp.text: Hi Anthony, thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to contact our marketing coordinator at kylie@fullmoonbbq.com to discuss your experience. We want to hear from you!

name: Shane Angle
text: Always have good food at this place. But today the water tasted like dish sink water, nasty.

resp.text: Hi Shane, thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to contact our marketing coordinator at kylie@fullmoonbbq.com to discuss your experience. We want to hear from you!

name: JJ M
text: The pork was great, however the bbq sauce was terrible. If you eat here have then leave off the sauce.  Buy you some Sonny's BBQ sauce that will do the trick! Sonny's needs to come to Dothan Alabama.

name: Kory Roberts
text: Clean restaurant, clean restrooms, great customer service. These guys have great food, and decent prices. Of the BBQ places in Dothan, they are one of the best. The stuffed baked potato can feed two people easily. The portions served here are huge.

name: FoulOwl
text:
Usually quite good. But the last two times was very sub par. The stuffed baker's are huge but l recommend the pork or chicken over the turkey, as the turkey tends to be quite dry. And c'mon guys, they're $10. Another fork-full o meat wouldnt break the bank.The Burger w pimento cheese is usually very good. But as mentioned earlier last two times l went, it was sub par. Overcooked and dry. And they ain't cheap, so again, it wouldn't kill ya to throw in some fries. If I'm gone have to pay extra for em they darn sure better be cooked to order with the burg, HOT and CRISP. Which they rarely are. Next time l will not be so polite about it. Rest assured.
My mother ordered the fried catfish last time on a whim. I realize it's not your signature item, but if you can't do any better than that, TAKE IT OFF THE MENU! Worst we've ever had anywhere! Inedible. Shouldn't have payed for it but did. Like l say, historically, has been quite good. So l give it 3stars. But if things don't improve after my last two visits... You're gone be off my go to list.

name: John Taylor
text: Good tasty BBQ, reasonably priced.

name: cindy miller
text: Love the fast service and delicious bbq, along with the most excellent sides here!! Make sure you are a sports fan when you dine in...the TVs are EVERYWHERE!!

name: Angie Brown
text: Yum! Everything I tasted here was delicious! Even the greens and the beans were full of flavor. Their special relish is good on everything. Service was very friendly. It's sort of cafeteria style so you can be as quick and casual as you like.

name: Bradford Riley
text: The BBQ is good. They have a unique type of coleslaw that adds to a good burger. Three stars because I think the price is inflated. Equally good BBQ is available at other places for better prices.

name: Randy Windsor
text: Food was excellent. I ordered at the drive thru and food was ready quickly. I would like to see an app for ordering.

name: Julie Paulston
text: Excellent food! I was doubtful being "fast" food. However it was really good!

name: Brian Parker
text: Everything is just ok. Nothing horrible, but overpriced for what you get.

name: Patricia Simmons
text:
The BBQ sandwich I got today was dry. The meat had no flavor whatsoever. The fries were cold.
When we went to the counter all of the workers were standing around talking and did not acknowledge us until I said, "excuse me." Then the young girl had an attitude.
This is the second bad experience I've had at Full Moon in Dothan, Al. Don't know if I'll go back.

resp.text: Hi Patricia, thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to contact our marketing coordinator at kylie@fullmoonbbq.com to discuss your experience. We want to hear from you!

text: This worst customer service. I called my order in i waited in line for 30 minutes i get to window then they never started my order .  Then to tell me  if i want my order why would call if i didn't .  Food is good but service very poorly!!!!!

resp.text: Hi Silva, thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to contact our marketing coordinator at kylie@fullmoonbbq.com to discuss your experience. We want to hear from you!

resp.text: Hi Blake, thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to contact our marketing coordinator at kylie@fullmoonbbq.com to discuss your experience. We want to hear from you!

name: Ronald Lingo
text: Drove 30 minutes stood in line for 25 minutes to get spare ribs and they are OUT of ribs on the 4th of July of all days. My last trip they were out of potatoes.... No sign to warn you or anything...

name: MIkal Mongoven
text: The service in Dothan is terribly slow. I sat in the drive thru for 22 minutes and asked for a refund. Ridiculous!!! What is even more aggravating the staff wanted to inform me it takes 10 minutes to cook the burger I ordered. Didn’t make it any better when I ordered 20 minutes prior. After requesting my refund they still tried to get me to take the food and leave after I insisted on my refund. Which took another 7 minutes to even get the manager involved. Considering this was between 11-11:30am this lack of performance is inexcusable. Thanks for wasting 30 minutes of my lunch break.

name: Alexis Adams
text: The fried green tomatoes and brisket are the best. We tried the ribs and they were yummy as well. The desserts are made in house (I asked) but I was too full for dessert. I'll be back for carrot cake.

All of it was good but the one and only issue I had was the collards could have had a little less stems in them. Other than that great food a little pricey but pretty good bbq.

name: ashley whitesel

resp.text: Thanks for the kind words Ashley! Come see us again soon!

name: Kristie Hunt
text:
I was very disappointed
You here barbque and you can taste it and smell it
I found nothing inside that said barbque
They have up cattle heard rails like burger king  to maintain an orderly line the menu is very lacking in southern food or barbque food
There is no aroma of cooking food you place your old at the register then given a number and your drinks pick a table to sit at and wait my grandson food came on a plate on a tray mine and my husbands food come out just on the tray with a piece of paper under our sandwhiches the potato salad was too sweet to eat drowning in mustard now for $30 i did expect at least the food presentation to be a bit more than we got may our sandwiches in a basket would have been nice i dont know how clean the tray was the sandwiches were not wrapped just helplessly setting on a tray hoping not to catch a germ
Now i was not born and raised in the south but i did marry a qood southern man from jackson ms my mother in law is a strict southern baptist bible belt woman i learned from her how to cook southern favorites with a hint of yankee in them every southern home i have ever been to never served any of thier side dishes the way this place did if your looking for a casual southern style barbque experience this is not the place its fastfood barbque that nukes thier food just like McDonald's
There is 1 positive out of the experience thier barbque sauce now thats to die for so the next time im cooking at home and need barbecue sauce i will drive 20 miles 1 way just to have thier barbque sauce

resp.text: Hi Kristie, thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to contact our marketing coordinator at kylie@fullmoonbbq.com to discuss your experience. We want to hear from you!

name: Wes S
text: Decent barbecue, but WAY overpriced.  Why eat chain BBQ food when you could eat better local BBQ for cheaper? Ribs and pork were pretty good; brisket was dry. Sides were OK - either from a can or the freezer.

name: Adam Crooms
text: Good food, good service, good price

name: Bizzi B
text: Four and a half stars. Fast service.Decent food.Meats come medium rare unless requested well done.

resp.text: Hello Steve, thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to contact our marketing coordinator at emory@fullmoonbbq.com to discuss your experience further. We want to hear from you!

name: Tina Reeves
text: They are getting better. However, I don't want to see people with pants sagging. They make things called belts!! It is my personal opinion that they need a refresher course in proper work attire.

text: BBQ in a hurry. Got the pulled pork sandwich with fries. I got the chow chow sauce on the side because I don't care for regular slaw, and it's basically spicy cole slaw. Pork was juicy and flavorful. Good stuff. Not exactly cheap but very yummy.

text: I love the open face pulled pork sandwich. The spicy white sauce they give you is good on everything.

text: Have not received a bad meal yet! I believe it's my favorite spot to eat! My only problem I have is their regular drink is a small by any other food chain's standard. It also is grossly overpriced at $1.99 the manager told me it was a 16oz cup but I beg to differ...

name: Ron Catalano
text: Great BBQ, very pleasant atmosphere, employees efficient at their job but did not seem real happy to be there, no banter with customers, just took order and gave receipt and person delivering order did not smile, just asked who ordered what, sat it down and left.  Great sports memoralibly of all kinds, clean.

name: Jeff Dierberger
text: Good bbq, white sauce was interestingly good, portions were a tad small for what I paid. I would recommend people stop and check this place out.

name: Aaron Wyse
text: Wonderful BBQ..  But we expect nothing less from them.  There was a large piece of bone/ hard cartilage in my wife's sandwich though.  She didn't want to say anything to the management about it.

name: Gina Riley

name: Judith Jones

name: John Dawson

name: family Tatem
text: My husband and i went to this restaurant the food is very delicious greek salad,ribs and chicken,but the employees are very rude,not very nice not even greet you when you come in or even give you  a smile!they look at you like "what are you doing here" lol i think they should be more professional when it come to work if you don't like to work serving costumers then you don't deserve to be in that place,you get paid to serve people not making them feel bad.

resp.text: Hi, thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to contact our marketing coordinator at kylie@fullmoonbbq.com to discuss your experience. We want to hear from you!

text: I like this place but nothing beats Sonny's BBQ

name: Mardie Williams

text: The ribs were tender and falling off the bone. My food was fresh cooked, the bread was soft, the cookies were delicious and the service was pretty fast. I really enjoyed dinning here....👍

resp.text: Thanks for the love JoJo! Our Half Moon Cookies are a great ending to the best meal!

name: john gentry
text: Alot of food !

name: Melanie Hoffman
text: We've been here a few times now and it's been great every time. We usually something different everytime. Pulled pork sandwich is excellent with quite a bit of meat. Mac n cheese is great, so glad when restaurants don't serve kraft. Ribs were nice and tender. Each time we've gone the wait has always been minimal for food which is great when you have Littles.

name: BIGD3DMEDIA
text: Service is usually fast and staff is always friendly.  The BBQ Pork Nachos are a favorite that you can actually make a meal out of.  Pay the extra and replace the pork with the beef brisket.  You will thank me later.

name: Luke Hagan
text: Food was pretty much what you expect from a southern BBQ restaurant. Smoker was just being brought back up so no chance to try their "famous" ribs.

name: Sherry Enfinger
text: Food was too sweet and I felt uncomfortable

resp.text: Hello Sherry, thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to contact our marketing coordinator at emory@fullmoonbbq.com to discuss your experience further. We want to hear from you!

name: Cory Klein
text: This place has a HUGE menu. Almost too big. Youll be staring at it for a long time trying to narrow down what to get of ALL the things you want. The ribs here are really good. The other day i had their wings. They were

resp.text: Hi Cory, we're glad you had a great experience! Come back and see us soon!

name: Tec Tony
text: 🥔 Can't go wrong.

name: Doc Spook
text:
Worst pie crust ever
should have been 3.5-4 stars but the pie crust was the toughest and tasteless I have ever had.  could barely cut it with the plastic knife and can't break it with the fork.  the fillings were flavorful and also denser than any pie ever.

pork and brisket were very good!

fries and corn were average

too much money for this quality and amount of food

text: I usually get a potato when I visit and they have always been good. I thought I would try something different today. Bad choice. I had the large pork sandwich which was full of something inedible ( fat and gristle) and a broken bun which fell apart when picked up. Which fell apart on my piece of wax paper since it did not come on a plate. Very disappointed today.

text: Love the food. The people are great

name: John speights

text: Good barbeque. Fair pricing. We love to pick up large BBQ sandwiches. $7 each and fill a big man up.

name: Karla Jara Williams
text: Love the ribs! And the cookies!!!

name: Wayne Grayson
text: Best BBQ in Dothan by quite a large margin. Great pulled pork and pretty good brisket. Nice, albeit small, beer selection, a ton of TVs for sports and you have to get an order of the Full Moon chocolate-dipped chocolate chip cookies. Great sweet tea too!

text: A little pricey though good food.

name: Richard “Dick” Martin

name: Debbie Mullins
text: I've never had anything bad from here. It's fast and great. They have delicious desserts too.

resp.text: Thank you for the love Debbie! You should always save room for dessert!

name: Malisa Cox
text: My daughter loves their loaded baked potatoes with the chipped bbq.

name: Melissa Pate
text: The best place!!!!! My husband and I have went here for our Anniversary for the past 2 or 3 yrs and we plan on stopping by on our way to the mountains for our 10 yr Anniversary it's so worth to go out of the way can't wait!!!!

name: Trey Brownlee
text: Full Moon has decent barbeque, wings and turkey. Truthfully, it is ranked 3.5 in my book but it is not quite a 4. The big baker potato is great and their sauces are good as well. Good place for lunch and some dessert.

name: cherry blossom
text: Very tasty BBQ. I had the pulled pork sandwich with Brunswick stew. The stew was a tad bland, but if you put the bbq sauce in it, it tastes good. I tasted my husbands mac&cheese and it was fairly good. Not amazing, but not bad. The pie however was bad. They added way too much sugar and not enough keylime juice. I could barely taste the keylime flavor, but it tasted and felt like they put 2-3 cups too much sugar. Overall the taste of the food was good.

name: Ryan Ferguson
text: Clean place, great service it's just the ribs tasted boiled, you have that great open pit and you're gonna fast cook baby back ribs, kinda sad

name: Pamela Pettis
text: Food is really good, service has gone downhill. On our last visit, no one in line, we waited about 2 minutes and finally a girl sauntered up from the back, walked right past us without a word and yelled to another girl in the restaurant. That one came and stood behind the register and looked at us- no greeting. When she brought our trays, still not a word, just put them on the table - even shoved my hand with it.  We ate and left, walked past the girl- still not a word. Napkins were stuffed in the holder so tight we tore up three trying to pry them out- finally has to just pull out a bunch. I think I know why there were only 2 other people there.

name: family Tatem
text: My husband and i went to this restaurant the food is very delicious greek salad,ribs and chicken,but the employees are very rude,not very nice not even greet you when you come in or even give you  a smile!they look at you like "what are you doing here" lol i think they should be more professional when it come to work if you don't like to work serving costumers then you don't deserve to be in that place,you get paid to serve people not making them feel bad.

Also, the employees were talking VERY loudly until one of the employees notice they were talking loud. Instead of talking, someone needed to be cleaning up the tea area and the sauce crock pot. Is that even up to the health codes? To end the trip, my husband vomited when he got home.🤷🏻‍♀️

name: Jessica Farmer
text: This place is very expensive for the mediocre food, lack of customer service, and the menu is "all over the place" and what I mean by this is, there is absolutely no detailed information on any of the food they serve that is listed on the menu and you feel extremely rushed to hurry and order so your not holding up the customers behind you, in which lack of details on the menu run into tons of questions for the cashier which prolongs the process for you and everyone behind you waiting to place their order. Each item is an individual charge as in (1) cost for main course and if you want sides (which who doesnt?) Each side is an individual costs plus another additional cost for a drink(No combos offered at all). I ordered a "fine shredded" barbecue sandwich and I got "chunks" of barbecue with extra order of "chewy fat" with each bite until the 4th bite ruined it for me and I went and asked for a refund of $9.00 and some change just for this sandwich if I may add. When requesting the refund I was not asked "what the problem was?" Nor received any type of apology for inconvenience.  The manager or shift leader, simply grabbed my plate, chunked it in the trash behind the counter and ask for my debit card to proceed with the refund. I will not do business here again! For the price, the quality of food and service are poor and no extra added value.

name: taylor davis
text: Generally Full Moon doesnt disappoint but last night their management failed completely. We ordered 2 bbq chicken sandwiches, 2 fries, corn on the cob, and 2 drinks... Halfway through or meal, my boyfriend ate a nice long hair that was in his sandwich. I brought it back to make them aware, and that we wouldnt want another sandwich. The managers response was, "well I dont know whose that could be because no one has long hair back here." Seriously?... WRONG ANSWER! I managed a fine dining restaurant for 4 years and NEVER in my life would I question the customer over a hair being in their food. Please train your management better in responding to complaints. Needless to say, we werent compensated, or in the very least apologized to for eating your kitchen staffs stray hair.

resp.text: Taylor, we sincerely apologize about your poor experience. Could you please provide your contact information to fullmoonsocialmedia@gmail.com? Our manager would like to speak with you directly.

name: Donnie Gray
text: By far the worst bar-b-que establishment I have ever eaten at.  First the prices are ridiculous but I gave them the benefit of thought I'm willing to pay for some good bar b que.  I was charged 20 bucks for two ribs, some chopped up brisket( not slices) and two sides.  The ribs were tough with no season. The little brisket that I did receive was dry, okra and Mac and cheese had no flavor.  Most bar b que establishments allow you to put your own sauce on your meat if you wish but this place drowned the meat in sauce I guess trying to cover up the non season dry meat.  Would never go back here I could smoke ribs in my backyard better than this place.

name: N M
text:
It's not only this place. I cannot find good bbq in Alabama. I have been here 40 of my 60 years. Larry's BBQ is decent when it's sliced.  My local gas station has good bbq but I think they get it from Shwann's.
Why would someone chop up pork anyway? My search continues - not for the best but for ANY good bbq in Alabama. If I had a limb shredder to pre-chew it might rate one more star.
And please stop pouring that ketchup/pickle sauce over the meat. If I want sauce I will eventually learn what is in the little tubs and do it myself.
The guy that got a "huge amount" could have shared it with me and my skimpy plate.

text: Grrr. One employee. Seriously. Good food but service is spotty. I eat here about once a month and never seem to see the same workers.  Yesterday they only had one guy during lunch rush. It is most often not crowded and they do make a good sandwich but you may have to wait for it.

name: Trent Ridlehoover
text:
So whomever made my sandwiches for my family was amazing.

But the rude obnoxious coworker morven or however you spell his name was incredibly rude to his coworker and had kicked his feet up in a booth feet all sprawled out trash all over the booth while letting his coworker do everything. And when asked for help he was just astounded someone asked him to do his job. I come here multiple times a week and everyone is usually super friends or super fast, one or the other. But this dude was just a total butt to his co worker and it would’ve been embarrassing to be him in this situation.

name: C J K
text: Sandwiches are decent. The elderly woman behind the counter in a small town counted out each pickle, 4 total, each piece of bell pepper, 4 little slivers, each jalapeño, 4 total, etc....on a foot long. For an $8 sandwich, Subway, quit counting and skimping on the cheap stuff, meats I can understand using the measured amount but I feel very confident that your bulk oder veggies come with a pretty hefty discount, so why count. I go to Publix for sandwiches now anytime I can because their sandwiches are better and they have no problem loading you down with a salad on your sandwich if that's what you want, pretty much the same price too. Obviously a way better meat selection too.....I know I'm not comparing apples to apples there, just stating a fact though.q

text: How do you run out of meatballs and bread at 11:30 AM?

name: Moonstar79
text:
Everyone knows about Subway. Everyone understands what they're getting when they walk into the building. The customer service is generally sub-par, although once in a blue moon you'll get a duo that work together quite well. Again, though, this is rare, and the usual default is that one person behind the counter does all the work while the other takes perpetual breaks, as is the case in my local Subway. The food itself is actually not bad, as long as your cravings are in stock (and they often might not be). On the upside, it's usually a very relaxed environment with no rush on your order. On the downside, can you say cross-contamination? But don't like my experience affect yours. Perhaps you'll come out having rung the Perfect Bell.
Or perhaps not.

name: Gil Ellis
text: Went there for lunch waited 15 minutes before getting to order only for them to tell me that they did not have any steak terrible place to go has a bunch of kids working there i will not go back there is a better sub place go to Firehouse Subs.

text: I come to this location about 2 times a week and Yesnia is always pleasant everytime i come. She is a very hard worker i sit in and eat, and when she has no customers, she is always working nonstop to ensure the place is clean and stocked. I love Subway😍😍😍

name: Sose Knows Best
text: My husband and I got the rotisserie chicken and by time we drove not even a 2 minute drive home, both of our sandwiches were soggy and the meat was ice cold and wet! Never really cared for this place they’re always understaffed and slow. This will be our last time eating here.

name: Anna Gleason
text: Had a low to mediocre experience here. Friendly workers, but the guy who made my food forgot to put my cookie I paid for in the bag and then the food was undercooked and made me sick. I think he was new and like I said he was friendly but needs improvement.

name: Rodney Patton
text:
I was visiting family in the area today and stopped by this subway for the first time.   When I walked in, there was a semi long line.  I was about to turn around and go somewhere else until I noticed the young man behind the counter. He was the only employee in the building from what I could tell.  He is probably a manager. Maybe not but he seemed to be by the way he was carrying himself. If he is not he should at least be considered for a management position.
He was moving as fast as he could.  More importantly, (and the reason why I decided to stay and wait in line) he was having a great time talking to the customers and didn't seem to be discouraged by his circumstances.  Customers were laughing and talking and actually ENJOYING their time WAITING in line.   I've owned and sold customer service and hospitality related  companies before and you do not typically see customers that enjoy waiting. For any amount if time or for any thing   This young man, Steven or Steve, is the reason why I stayed.   I enjoyed my conversation with him and my time in line as well. As a former/semi retired franchisee, I can tell you, this employee will do great things for your company.
Everything was great on my visit. I even met some people in line who I would not have typically spoken to. All because if the atmosphere that was created by one employee.  Food was fresh and perfect.  I would recommend this subway over any others.

name: Robyn Counts
text: My husband and I went to eat here at 9:40pm tonight. My husband walked in first and the employee looked at him with a face of disgust. Like he didn't want another customer.  Then tell him they are out of bread?? Really? Every single kind of bread happens to be out. Lazy as he**. Then drive 10 minutes to the lakeshore Walmart to eat at that subway...but they closed at 10:04 instead of 10:30. I'm beginning to think all Subways have lazy employees.

It's a good sandwich if you are in a bind and want to be filled with natural cut meats and cheeses but the customer service bites the big one. I had to yell to make sure that she didn't hang up on me with her assumption as to my address, phone number or method of pay. Seriously disappointed with this location in Mobile, AL.

text: I would give zero stars but I can't you guys are 1.2 Miles from me and say you can't deliver  here but refer me to another location  that is almost ten miles away and say they do unfortunate  they don't either but had more consideration to helping me and also advised me of competitors  that do deliver to my location sorry Jimmy John's  lost my little bit of business

name: Todd Shaw
text: Clean. Fast. Tasty.

name: David Stojak
text: Loved the sandwich

name: j jones
text:
Reuben Grill Sandwich -dry, not enough sauce.
Patty Melt- dry, meat too lean for a burger patty so not enough grease to make it juicy, also absolutely no pink {overcooked}
Wait staff doesn't offer or suggest anything other than a bag of plain chips as a side. Would have liked onion rings, fried green tomatoes, cole slaw, or seasoned dries.

When I walked into the Vaughn Rd location I loved the ambiance and the staff was very friendly. The food needs work, the side order selection beefing up, and appetizers & desserts added.

name: Bryan Carter
text: My family loves Chappy's for any meal! Locally owned, great food and friendly people... and kids eat for next to nothing. My personal favorite is the club with sweet potato fries, but there is so much to choose from. My wife loves their soups. My kids love just about anything on the kids menu. My one and only complaint about Chappy's is that I'm not alone — the whole town loves Chappy's and that means that sometimes their can be a crowd. You just got to hit it at the right time.

name: Chris Mcdaniel
text: My family loves Chappy's Deli. From the servers to the food it is all amazing!!

name: drivasmary
text: The food is always good! My Husband and I were in there yesterday and the waitress lost my Husband's debit card !! She tried to say she gave it back to him and he got up and started looking for it and she left it on the counter!!

name: Tammy Churchwell
text: I placed an order for two Turkey Burgers, they repeat the order, took my name and phone #, say it will take 10-15 minutes. I drive all the way there, pull up to be told I’m sorry we were out of Turkey Burgers when you placed the order. The guy apologized but I ask why could they not have called me back to let me know, they had my #? Just very poor service in my opinion. They should have called me back in the 25 minutes that passed before I drove all the way there to pick up my order.

name: Laci Baker
text: I came today and got 4 meals for some friends while we were at the Hair Salon and this was only my second time eating at Chappys & I LOVED IT! It did not disappoint! The food was absolutely delicious and the people inside were so polite and helpful! Great Job!❤️ We will definitely be back!

name: J T
text: I wouldn't say this place is terrible or exceptional, it's just very middle of the road. We stopped on our way through on a road trip and weren't disappointed. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. They do have a gluten-free menu but didn't tell us until later you could get any sandwich on gluten-free bread so we were very limited in what we could order for our daughter even though there were almost unlimited options. Everything was good, especially the buffalo chicken wrap. Free ice cream at the end was a nice touch. It wouldn't be my first choice but it will do in a pinch.

name: John Whaley
text: Great place for any meal. We went for dinner with a party of 6 and our greeter, Kenzie was so friendly and helpful. The chicken and dumplings were delicious. I definitely recommend Chappys.

name: Cheryl Bryan
text: Good choices, Keto available, small children eat free -- and they gobbled it up! Good, friendly servers.

name: Connie White
text: Great club sandwich. Service was excellent during rush time.

name: Chris Q
text: Great people who are always looking to make.sire you leave happy and full. Courteous staff and hometown feel place. True Southern cooking. Breakfast is great.

name: Fusion? :/
text: It was great, even though they were very crowded our food came very fast and was good.

name: Jessica Hasson
text: We love chappys!! My son eats for free and you get ice cream after your meal for no charge! And to top if off, their food is delicious!

name: Barbara Straw
text: Our favorites are the Buffalo Chicken Wrap with a side of ranch and the Tuna salad with lettuce/tomato on 3 seed bread.

name: Steve Schroeder
text: Super nice and efficient staff and the food is consistently delicious.

name: Diane Fussell
text: Love Chappy's! Very family friendly and quick service.

name: Jeremy
text: We sure could have done without witnessing the loud bickering between the servers and the kitchen staff. It was very unprofessional and was handled poorly by what appeared to be absent management.

name: Cindy McNamara (CindyMac)
text: Passing thru town and stopped for breakfast. Clean place! Very welcoming staff and managers. Food was good and served piping hot. Earmarked for future road trips.

name: Tina Martin
text: Very good. Fast car side order and delivery. Very good food. Will go again.

name: Ryan Beesley
text: Great service.  Great precautions in place for safe dining experience.  Food as always was hot and delicious.

name: Kami Scarborough
text: Good food and added bonus that kids eat free with the purchase on adult entree. Extensive menu with a great variety.

name: Stella Dallas
text: If uou are black and order food be prepared  to wait until everybody else get their food b4 you get yours

name: Bradley Hall
text: This location is excellent! Amazing staff and food!!

name: Hannah Lacy
text: Great family friendly place for some good, simple eats! Reasonable prices and friendly staff! Definitely recommend waitress Morgan!

name: Patsy Heaton
text: Never had bad experience with Chappys!  Great food and love the cookies!

name: Terry Wright
text: Our server was nice and attentive and made sure we were okay.

name: Pamela Pruett
text: We had 18 people in our party, which we will do every Tuesday evening. And after you when you ordered it took so long to get our food.

name: William Kilpatrick
text: Very spacesous and clean booths, service and meal delivery was quick! Breakfast is always good!

name: David Hagemann
text: Food was great and service qas fantastic!

name: corey walp
text: Waited 27 minutes before we had anyone ask what kind of drinks we wanted. Workers just walking around not asking if we needed anything. Will not come back to this location again.

name: Heidi Cantrell
text: Wonderful service this morning (Libby, you were great), and nice atmosphere.  A little pricey, but very good breakfast food.

name: Nikil George
text: Great customer service. However, food is quite bland.

name: Shirley Carroll
text: Ordered 1 doz & 1/2 cookies but only 1 doz were in the bag. Other than that,  the trio platter was excellent.  Nice and fresh.

name: Candie Turner
text: Worst customer service I have ever received from a chappys first the carhop Laura  comes out cant find the order I get out to go in and rude eric says you cant park there and I ask are you serious ? he says yeah! I am dead serious but there is several other spots available this was so rude and out of place I encourage you if you want to enjoy chappys don't visit the Vaughn road location. Even better idea don't spend any money with chappys at all! Eric needs to be retrained in customer service and maybe even fired! I guess if I had been white maybe they would have treated me better SMH

name: Pamela Pruett
text: We had 18 people in our party, which we will do every Tuesday evening. And after you when you ordered it took so long to get our food.

name: Mary Wood
text: Food was wonderful.  Our waitress had a great personality.  We will be going there again.

name: Jumpy Lioness
text: Great food as always and friendly service

name: rsm ala
text: Great food... Great service

name: Debbie Dunaway
text: Great local deli. Really good sandwiches. Hummingbird cake and Red Velvet are great.

name: gwendolyn johnson
text: Good service, good food.

name: Shan Monday
text: The sandwiches are really fresh and the service was excellent. I pulled it and had to call In because they were only doing Curbside service but the Food still came out in a very timely manner.

name: Jonathan Loretz
text: This time, we ordered a couple of French dips for carryout over the phone and it was a pleasant experience for sure. Not terribly expensive for very tasty, freshly made food. Polite interactions with the staff every single time we are in there. Will always recommend this location to friends when the opportunity comes up.

name: Robyn Collins
text: Great food and great service 👍

name: james blackwell
text: GREAT  PLACE TO EAT

name: Erika Castillo
text: Best place for breakfast, I looooooove their pancakes/flapjacks

name: Bigdaddy 17
text: Best service, very clean place, awesome food. 1st time here, love it

name: Rob White
text: These folks are great!  Super friendly staff.  Great food.  Covid conscientious.  Eat here if get the chance.

name: Jim Headrick
text: Good good, better service. I would go again.

name: Cyndal Whiten
text: I ordered from there using the carhop service and was given the wrong sandwich by mistake. I called and spoke with the manager and he was very professional and resolved the manner very quickly. He offered for the correct order to be delivered. Great Customer Service & Professionalism!!

name: Alison Hartley
text: Love this place. Always great food and friendly staff.

name: Kim Smith
text: The staff is always very nice and friendly. The food was delicious.

name: Yolanda Taylor
text: The food was great

name: nell word
text: Good Service and friendly staff

name: Jakiya Covington
text: very upset with my steak and cheese omelette. It was so thin to where you could see straight through it. Not edible, no fluff.....

name: Dale Turner
text: Good food and service.

name: Heath Hatcher
text: Just came on it while on a road trip. Food was awesome. Car hop feature was much appreciated. Try the Rubin.

name: Emily Gayle
text: Really enjoyed the atmosphere of the diner. The food is delicious and the service is excellent. They also will give the little ones some ice cream at the end of your meal if you so desire. Overall a extremely pleasant time and we shall be back.

name: Carrie Lynne Cook
text: Very good deli offerings, and always child friendly. The other (Perry Hill) location is consistently better though in terms of the food tasting better and the service being faster. We love Chappy's and eat here weekly. We just prefer the other location.  Favorite items here - mushroom bisque soup, the salads, the chicken tenders, sandwiches, key lime pie, etc!

name: Danny Hidalgo
text: Good food.

name: Emily Gayle
text: Really enjoyed the atmosphere of the diner. The food is delicious and the service is excellent. They also will give the little ones some ice cream at the end of your meal if you so desire. Overall a extremely pleasant time and we shall be back.

name: Mo Du
text: Not a terrible experience but the food was a disappointment. Worst French Toast ever.

name: Jim Sanders
text: Good food.

name: Jim Eiland
text: Good food.

name: Judy Kirkland
text: Good food and good prices. Friendly staff.

name: Nancy Baldwin
text: I ordered 2 salads that comes with avacado.  The avacado pieces were hard as a rock!  One salad was actually leaking water which made no sense at all!  The tomatoes were mushy & the bacon pieces were chewy instead of crispy.  Ive been going to this location since 2008 & have never had a problem before.  I took my salad back at 7pm to let them know what went on & the male I’m assuming Mgr of some sort could have cared less.  He then said so what is it that you want me to do...I said if you have to ask clearly you don’t care.  His response was ok & turned away.  Terrible  customer service.

name: Sherilyn Morgan
text: Awesome food. Great Service.

name: Mick Owen
text: Almost walked out because no one came to take order. After server came everything  was good.  Server did a good job. Good  food.  Enjoyable experience.

name: The Paper Maid
text: They are the best.. food staff..and atmosphere.

name: Monet Ellington
text: Great customer service pulled right up to car hop fast service and excellent food. Thanks for wonderful  breakfast.

name: Sara Carroll
text: Excellent, as usual!!😁Need to open one in Troy!

name: Chesspiece
text: One of the best family restaurants in Montgomery

name: Jay Cox
text: Pretty good food here.  I had the Cuban and my wife had a Reubin.

name: Jerry
text: Locally owned and always delicious.

name: Sherilyn Morgan
text: Awesome food. Great Service.

name: Chris Anderson
text: Great service, good food

name: J S
text: Ask for Mary Ann.  Good people , Great food.

name: Kathy Smith
text: Always excellent!

name: Lisa Jones
text: Longer wait times due to Covid but still good food

name: chris fraley
text: My daughter and I had such a great time tonight. The food was really good. Our server was so sweet and patience with us. She was wonderful. I can't remember her name. Blonde hair, she wore her hair in a pony tail. Her personality was fantastic. I had changed my mind several times on what to order and not one time did she looked sour in the face. She smiled through the whole process. She made me feel really comfortable. Thank you.

name: Leah Morgan
text: Food and Management was great.

name: Belinda Averitt
text: I have tried this restaurant twice now over a 2 month period. Both times I was seated and left alone with no service. Gave it 15 minutes before walking out....both times. Would never recommend this restaurant. Oh, and there were only 3 other tables with customers. Wait staff (I counted 6) were all clustered together chatting and not attending to customers. Definite thumbs down!!

name: Daniel Gordon
text: The food was freshly made and delicious, the service was excellent and the pricing is more than reasonable! I wish I could give this AWESOME restaurant more than a 5-star rating.

name: Elliott Gilmore II
text: My first time going to this location and everything was good and fresh.

name: Carolyn Phillips
text: I always enjoy my visit every time I eat here.  The employees are very courteous and the food is always very good.

name: Shane Sexton
text: Not terrible but not great prattville chappys is much better from my experiences

name: Sharifay McIver
text: The customer service was great, she made sure we were taken care of. I ordered the club sandwich (warm) which comes with potato chips and one side. I would get it again but not with the tomatoes. Make sure you get the little icecream cone before you leave.

name: James McNees
text: Great Deli lunch menu.

name: Bill C
text: Good food but busy for lunch, expect to wait.

name: Nicole M
text: Always five star service and great food!

name: Saundra Soden
text: Food and service was great as always.

name: Michael Gilbert
text: Great food. Great service. Tasty ice cream!!!

name: Kurt Matisak
text: The food is great, and the service  is great. But when you order breakfast  of the menu and it shows the picture  of the meal exactly, that is what should look like when the bring it to your table. There is one waitress that can't seem to do that . She  Always always smothers your biscuit with  gravy. If i wanted  that i would order that. I like to put jelly on my bicuit and drip it. I fixed the problem!!! I just  stopped  going to the one in peppertree. And now go  Carmichael Road.

name: M Remi
text: Chappy's always has a good atmosphere and great staff. I enjoy that they don't have long wait times for seating or eating. Food is very good. Restaurant is very clean, however the busing can be done a bit quicker sometimes. Not good to see when you walk in.

name: Amy Brown, Residential Alabama
text: I love that they are gluten friendly and knowledgeable. Food is always fantastic

name: Jacki Tucker
text: Atmosphere is great and the employees are a joy!

name: John Griffin
text: I love Chappy's deli! Never a bad meal or experience. Don't go a whole lot, but when I do I always am pleased. I know it's a deli, but get the chicken  fingers and fries with the spicy honey mustard! The Reuben ain't bad, either! Or the club sandwich! Great potato salad! Always great service from a friendly staff!!

name: Victoria Walker
text: I’ve never had a good experience with this location. Me and my family ordered our food and we didn’t receive some items that we asked for even though they weren’t on the recipient. Car hopper looked very annoyed and not friendly. Asked for no lettuce on my wrap and received a ton of lettuce. I order this every time and always have complications with our meals.

name: Ashley S
text:
This place never disappoints. Jalapeno ranch and honey mustard is amazing with the apple chicken salad wrap.  The grilled chicken club is good too. We also love the cole slaw because it's oil based, not mayo.

Will definitely go to this location again.

name: Matt A.
text: Stopped in for breakfast. Food and service was too notch, general manager was very nice. Recommend this restaurant.

name: Thasnoxi
text: Great shrimp poboy. Fast service. Bit pricy

name: Kelly Head
text: Service was great, breakfast was not the best honestly. Kinda disappointed. Love Chappy's typically.

name: Event Horizon
text: The biggest problem I have with Chappy's is Selection - I like so many things on the menu. Excellent food (especially the burgers, chicken salad and Onion Rings!). Fast, fresh, friendly and well priced. Thanks! Isabel Gordon

name: Ryan Gueret
text: The entire staff was friendly to me when I walked in the door. I ordered something over the phone "to go." When I went to the counter to pay for my meal, the young nice lady recognized my voice from the phone and that made me feel very special because I was not having a good day due to a cancer scare I had. The food was hot and delicious. I recommend this restaurant to anyone and any family.  It was made to be family.

name: Bad Looter
text: top notch accidentally gave my order to someone else were some amazing about it that i'm writing this review almost 3 weeks later. big thanks to everyone involved only had to wait 5 min for a full remake.

name: Brad Hummel
text: Service and food were great! I am new to the area and will definitely go back.

name: Jacob Mallinson
text:
Food is usually always fantastic, and always offers a unique flavor among other spots in town, but tonight I called an order in 17 minutes before I got there. Well the result when i got there was i still didn't have food there ready for me even though i was told 10-15 which isnt the end of the world, but i watched as the cashier after I had arrived took another employees order and her food was magically ready before mine was. After she had only waited 7 minutes. My total order time was 28 minutes. Not happy about this at all. Your paying customers who place there order first should obviously be first priority. I will not continue to spend money here as long as they fail to put the customer first. Not to mention the cashier said nothing to me when i was handed my food. I swear eating in Montgomery becomes more, and more of a headache everyday. Very low quality customer service! 2 stars only because the food was great as usual, will make it 5 when Chappy’s learns how communicate with their customer, and treat them them with respect along with prioritizing orders.
UPDATE: I have been back, and two times in a row the BUFFALO CITY wrap was TRASH literally chunks of batter (super dried up chicken) with a smudge of buffalo sauce on both me and my wife's wraps. To top that we were given one ranch to dip both wraps, a order of onion rings, and sweet potato fries! No more second chances Chappy’s yall have lost whatever touch you used to have.

name: Gene Exline
text: So awesome!

name: UnbiasedReport
text: One of the things that I really admire about Chappy's Deli is their sandwiches. There is no competition for it. They have a wide assortment to choose from and they are always put together so nicely and neatly. My job typically gets deli sandwiches and chips from them often. That make good for a quick meal. I suggest getting the tuna fish sandwich and also the chicken salad sandwich is great too.

name: dreadstalker MaS
text: Scott may very well provide the best wait service I have ever been around.  Amazing with kids.  Food was quite good, but the experience was one of the best I have ever had in dining.

name: L. Ronald Stabler
text: As far as Deli's go, Chappy's is tops.  Very good food and ambience.  Service is beyond good.

name: Gary Weaver
text: Service and food is always great! From breakfast items to salads, cold sandwiches or hot, heart healthy or health conscious to a down right good burger. You can go for soup or soup and half a sandwich. Top it off at the end with great desserts or just have the complimentary ice cream in a cup or cone. Multiple locations to choose from. Our family loves Chappy's. Some times we have a hard time choosing what.we.want because it is all really good.

name: Marshall Miller
text: Everyon was friendly, place was clean. Not the absolute best burger I've ever had, but I wouldn't send it back or anything.

name: Vann Lackey
text: Excellent food and excellent service

name: Craig Longshore
text: I been there quite often and they never disappoint. Food and service always the best.

name: Maya Trimble
text: Awesome staff! Made sure my order was correct for me. While I waited I was offered something to drink. Very friendly and great customer service! Keep up the great work:)

name: Brad Doucette
text: It's been awhile since I've eaten here. Wow, the remodeling looks great. Service excellent, food as always is fantastic, and a complimentary ice cream; yum.

name: fannie spencer
text: Awesome

name: Rozanne Robinson
text: Food was excellent and our server was AMAZING! Very friendly and very efficient!!

name: Claire McCann
text: Grew up in Montgomery and have always loved this place,  as does anyone who goes there.  Having moved back to Atlanta a few years ago, I was super excited to go back on a recent family visit,  and enjoy my fave- the veggie burger and fries. My daughter and I specifically planned our journey to include stopping there when we hit town that Saturday night  2 weeks ago. Where do I begin?... There were like 5-6 people at the front desk, which was a little confusing in itself. They seemed to be way overstaffed. But they were  all as nice as they could be.  But nice cannot make up for mistake-upon-mistake. First,  I placed the order to include no condiments, and extra lettuce & tomatoes. I mentioned it again as several girls were discussing the order,  and even saw one go up to the window and verbally repeat that to the cooks. Also asked it be cooked well. Second, I had told them we'd be eating outside bc I had my puppy with me...a little bit later,  I asked for something to clean the table off with.  It took a long time for the order to arrive (it was only 2 simple items), but they brought it in sacks, not having remembered or registered the fact that we were eating outside. Which caused the fries to steam inside and get soggy.... they had to go back in and put the orders on plates. And when mine came out-zero lettuce or tomato, and not well-done.  There really was no excuse for any of that to happen: listening and paying attention to details, and follow through are key in customer service positions.  They were all SO friendly,  and nice,  it makes this difficult to submit.  But I feel management needs to know.  I don't think anyone in charge was there that night.  Just overall not my best experience at Chappy's...

name: Billy Nelson
text: Great food and service.

name: Mark Berry
text: I love the chef salad and it's a lot..lot of ingredients and the best salad I have ever had!!

name: Gary Kribel
text: Usually everything is good here. Only issue I've had is with the gumbo. We are far enough south that any gumbo served should start out as a roux - theirs tasted like canned Campbell's chicken and rice. Order anything here other than the gumbo and you will probably be pleased.

name: Jose Parra
text: The food and service was absolutely amazing. I will go back here again. It's that simple, amazing!

name: Melissa Nickels
text: The biscuits and gravy were outstanding. My daughter had the waffle and bacon. She finished every bite which is rare. She said it was the best waffle and bacon ever! The breakfast sandwich my husband ate was also delicious. The service was fantastic and the restaurant is very clean and upbeat.

name: Scott Youngblood
text: Had a wonderful ham sandwich on white toasted bread with cheddar cheese, chopped onions and regular mustard.  My waitress was extremely kind and kept my Coke Zero glass full.  At the end of the meal got a free, little chocolate ice cream cone.  Teriffic experience.

name: DJ Jesse James
text: I love coming here when we're visit our family. The food comes out quick and delicious and the staff is the definition of southern hospitality.

name: Hugh Wilson
text: Good food and good service.  Angie is great! Tea and coffee are pricey.

name: Tim Lipinsky
text: rRREAT FOOD, GREAT SERVICE, and GREAT PRICES! The Chappy's Deli at Peppertree is basically in heart of Montgomery, but if that is too far, they have another location at shopping center on corner of Carmichael Rd and Perry Hill Rd. Or you can check them out in Auburn and Prattville. Enjoy, you wont be disappointed!

name: Shirley Weeden
text: Great service with wonderful sandwiches and soups. My husband loves the chicken and dumpling soup. I love their club sandwich.

name: Tia Holt
text: Staff always pleasant. Best location here. Food made to order and come to you hot.

name: Bonnie Phillips
text: Hats off to you the Chappy's Crew at Peppertree!  Our church, Brewer Memorial/Pike Road, ordered lunch on Saturday. Not only was the sandwiches delicious, the fresh bread was out of this world!  Top it off, the delivery was early!

name: Aquarian Queen
text: Friendly and received order quickly.

name: Lance Smith
text: This place is terrible got sick last two times I ate there last time thought was a fluke now this time same thing and it was all cold after waiting nearly 35 min for our breakfast to come put biscuits are stale and hard and eggs cold they don’t take pride in their food at all won’t be back and the service isn’t good either waitresses preoccupied

name: Andrew Miller
text: Great food, service was ok. I definitely prefer the Perry Hill location.

name: Desiree' Cozier`
text: The service was okay, but this place has gone down. The food wasn't all that great, and I had some loaded baked potatoe soup that was so thick I could've choked on it...the bathroom was not clean and it just felt dirty! I will more than likely just go to the hospital or Perry Hill Rd location.

name: Keesha Jones
text: Lovely staff! Food was excellent, but portions seemed smaller than we remembered from previous visits. Always welcoming and fun!

name: Melanie Johnson
text: Usually when I go on to Chappy's I get better customer service. I don't know what happened today. There is a cooler when you walk into Chappy's where they have desserts. I got my own dessert out of the cooler not a problem. I took my dessert to the counter paid for it. When I was asked do I want a bag I was handed a bag to bag my own dessert🙄. I had to ask for a fork and some napkins 🙄and I was handed the fork and only one napkin LOL🤔. I had to asked for more napkins and when I did the lady next to me laughed. Should  not have had to bag my own dessert and ask for more napkins🙄. Customer service negative. Food still GREAT!!

name: clay stratton
text: This restaurant has a great atmosphere and it's so vibrant and lively and I knew my waitress very well and I really enjoy myself when I go there to eat

name: Brian Barber
text: Fast, friendly service and large variety of deli favorites make this a great place when you can't decide where to eat 🤗

name: Arthur Habermann
text: Wife and family likes it. Me, soso. Never get fresh bread when I order a sandwich. IMHO

name: Jim Starling
text: Good food and service.

name: M Greene
text: So Good! The service  was exceptional.   We ordered Philly Cheese sandwich and it was really good.

name: thomasandmindy
text: Classic deli tastes. Friendly staff. Has been a staple in Montgomery for many many years for a reason.

name: Kim Tomberlin
text: Love this place. Great breakfast my waffles are always the best and the service is without a doubt the best. Lunch is so good no matter how busy they are you get the best. I go here a lot and will be back every week.

name: Lisa Kerr
text:
We live in Florida but work in Montgomery quite often. Always stop in for dinner, sometimes twice in a week. Excellent service, super friendly, informative staff.
Great menu-best cheesesteak around. Keeps us coming back again and again. :)

name: Richard Mora
text: Good place to go for a 45 min lunch break. Good service. Good food. Large menu. Inexpensive. Excellent desserts. Free ice cream

name: Rebecca Smith
text: The service was great, the restaurant was clean, but the food was nothing to write home about. Don't get me wrong the food was good, but you can get sandwiches anywhere. It was just like any other sandwich place.

name: NC Franklin
text: Great food and lots of low calorie, healthy choices.  The sweet potato fries are a favorite and the veggie burger is very good.

name: Scott McNelley
text:
A true Montgomery institution. More than a deli. A big part of the Community. This family owned business is what it is all about!

Fast service, take out, catering, delivery, respite trays, all great food!

Family & child friendly all the way. If you are new to Montgomery you need to make this connection ASAP.

Breakfast, lunch or supper all wonderful!

name: Tranelia Harris-Grady
text: Great service, awesome food and good prices! Love the sweet touch of free icecream and their willingness to customize meals for you!

name: Joyce Vaughn
text: You can't go wrong with Chappy's! Quality food at a reasonable price. And, it always feels like home when you visit Chappy's Deli. This particular location is usually pretty busy but you can get in and out for lunch or a family dinner.

name: Stacia Robinson
text: I'm the self-appointed President of the Chappy's Deli Fan Club! For 26+ years, I have been a thrilled customer of ALL of their locations. The bedrock of Chappy's Deli is the wide variety of menu choices, consistently well prepared and customer service beyond reproach. I highly (and often) recommend them for dine-in, take out and delivery. Chappy's is the type of place where you can eat several times in one week and not get the same thing twice (unless you just wanted to) because the breakfast, lunch and dinner menus have so many choices. Can you tell that I LOVE Chappy's? 💥

name: Robert Thornton
text: Great deli and the kids eat free Wich is great. I always get something from the specials menu and am never disappointed.

name: Laird Culver
text: Hells yeah! This is a great place to eat. Food is awesome. Try the hummingbird cake!

name: Stacy Benefield
text: Love the food. Lots of options. One of the few places I rotate through several favorite dishes. I special order the chef salad with mixed greens instead of iceberg. My other faves are maple turkey croissant and chicken salad apple wrap. The owners and management are EXECELLENT and other staff is usually pretty good.

name: Kat W

text: Chappy's is a Montgomery (and Auburn and becoming Prattville) institution with a well-deserved reputation for family-friendly good food, good service, and reasonable prices.  My wife, Barbara, have a standing date for breakfast there every Saturday morning we are in town.  Our favorite, among many great choices, has become the blueberry waffles - if you get them, make sure to ask for extra blueberries - to die for!  Barbara eats there for lunch almost every day M-F and has about four-five favorites.  My favorite lunch & sometimes dinner meal is the chicken salad apple wrap. but the salad plates are also very good - and the Ruben is the best in town.  Bottom line - it's a great deli!

text:
Firehouse makes a pretty decent sub. This place was packed though and took way too long for what is a simple meal.

It's usually better about getting your meal ready but who knows, maybe it was just an off day.

They continue to have the best bucket prices in town so if you need buckets for anything and don't mind a lingering pickle smell for a while you should buy them here and not a box store.

resp.text:
We're sorry to hear about the less than stellar wait time, Brian. We appreciate you being a fan of the food and taking the time to let us know about your experience. name: TIMOTHY JAMES
text: Every time I go to any Firehouse Subs, my order is always complete, the staff is always professional and courteous, and the food is always fresh and hot. Today, I utilized the app to pick up at 8pm. I only live 5 minutes from this restaurant and when I got home not only was my order wrong but my food was cold. I placed my order around 7:15 to pick up at 8pm. I think they made the food early and just allowed it to sit until I picked it up. I've  posted several reviews on different Firehouse Subs restaurants but today this particular restaurant did very poorly.

resp.text:
We value every one of our guests and their feedback, Timothy. Comments such as yours help us to continue to learn what areas we can improve upon. If you are willing, please contact the general manager of the restaurant. That way, they can discuss your experience as well as a resolution to the issues you listed in your review. We hope to hear from you soon!
Sabrina/Guest Services

name: Karen KR
text: Last night was maybe the 2nd time that we went to this location. We had 3 sandwiches in our order. While they were in the little oven (toaster...whatever you call it) the oven caught fire. Needless to say we didn't get any food, they refunded our money and gave us 2 brownies for our time. Mind you it was already after 8pm. I appreciate that the employee tried to make up for it but it was already a bad evening and this topped it off. I do hope that the fire department was called and came to make sure everything was good.

resp.text:
Thank you for bringing your recent visit to our attention, Karen. We want to assure you that your issues and concerns have been shared with the proper leadership to review. Thank you again. Have a wonderful day!

text: The only reason this is a 4 star instead of 5 is because they left off my extra bbq sauce. Restaurant is clean staff is usually friendly. I love the digital drink machine. name: Anna Elkins
text: My mom and I had a great dinner! We were greeted as we walked in by the cashier. She had a visual diagram of the sandwiches sizes that was very helpful. I got the Club on a Sub with the Loaded Potato soup. It was very hard to choose between all the tasty looking sides. My mom ordered the Turkey Bacon Ranch sandwich, as well as a sandwich to go for lunch tomorrow. Needless to say we had a complicated order! But they killed it! Everything came out perfect and the cashier even offered to leave her to go sandwich cold so it didn't wilt. Gave her packages of mayo/mustard on the side, too! It's always nice to support a place that gives back to our community, like the $80k they have given to Columbus fire/relief. We will be back!

name: Ashley Havener
text:
Today my husband and I went in around 2pm to get some sandwiches to go. They were just a little busy nothing a well trained staff couldn't handle.

We ordered a streak and cheese no mayo, and 2 medium Italians no mayo with pepperoncinis.

1st problem they didn't even know where on the cash register pepperoncinis were so she said she would just write it in.

2nd problem when we got home and opened our food to start eating the were no pepperoncinis on the Italians and so little cheese you couldnt even find it if you were looking. The streak and cheese was streak only.

The staff of about 5 or 6 people seemed scared and overwhelmed by the very small rush they had. When I say small I mean there was maybe 12-15 people most of whom already had their food.

resp.text: We appreciate your patronage and your feedback. Hearing that your order was not made correctly is very upsetting, Ashley. We strive to provide quality service and accurately made food, for each and everyone one of our guests. We are very sorry and will ensure your comments are passed along for the private owner to review and address internally. Thanks again, Ashley, for providing us with this invaluable feedback!Desirae/Guest Services

name: Mariah Glass
text: Our 1st time there. I had planned to try a pizza per the good reviews but the seasonal French dip won me over. Very good, the meat was cut nice and thick. The Au jus sauce had a nice flavor. I had it as it comes with no substitutes, the flavors were good and hearty.  We also tried the club sandwich which I was told was very good also. Crab and lobster bisque was better than some I  had in Florida. Staff and management very friendly and hospitable. We dined around 7:30pm on a Sunday and the atmosphere was cozy and relaxed. We picked up some of their chicken salad and lobster bisque soup from the to go market section. Nice feature especially if you need to grab something quick.  Chicken salad has pecans, celery and grapes in it, tasty but I like a few more grapes myself 😊. Nice experience, will definitely return!

name: Denise Ruiz
text:
Ok. So we have been waiting for a long time to try this place out since we didn't want to drive to Auburn to try that one.
First walk in it is very impressive and a very nice re do on the Atlanta Bread Co layout.  Friendly staff and very fast service from the time you order. We arrived at 11 right when they opened since it has been very busy but from the moment you go inside, the order counter is right in the doorway which doesn't allow much space to wait to place your order.
The soups are to die for and the salad was amazing. The pesto chicken sandwich was a bit much for my liking . It had too much pesto and almost no chicken.
The only main thing why I couldn't give it 5 stars was the fact that like every 2 minutes Andrew was coming by talking to us. I mean , ok, maybe we are more introverted than most but come on, we couldn't take a bite and here he was back again talking to us and trying to clear our plates. We joked about the next time we would go back we would get our food to go so we could enjoy it.
The kids got a pizza which OMG was sooooo good . Couldn't understand what the big deal was to just put pepperoni on half but no big deal really.
We def wanna go back and try other items on the menu for sure.

name: Lesa Monk
text: I LOVE the place.  The Tortilla soup is great!  And the Caesar salad was wonderful.  Try the pizza, crust is great.

name: Cherokee Bailey
text: My husband and I had a great time eating here.  The food is very good and even the new service since Covid19 came out was good.  The new atmosphere in the restaurant was very friendly and we had a great time.  He has pizza, and I had the mac and cheese  and we share the salad, our favorite salad is the black and blue.  We love blue cheese dressing. Lol. The roast beef is very good in the salad though.  They have a variety of food and so far all food we have had there, has been to die for. ..haha  my husband and I have found out that it's steak slices and not roast beef in the black and blue salad...

resp.text: We really appreciate your thoughts and feedback and look forward to continuing to service you as a customer!
