text: Fresh, good food. Amazing staff with southern charm.

name: Kevin Ray
text: Fresh, good food. Amazing staff with southern charm.

name: Inja Gordon
text:
The direction in coming into this establishment is not a "good flow"... I didn't see anyone at EITHER cash register so as I went to take my mother to the restroom I came back up and asked where do I place my order order as there still wasn't anyone present at any register. I went to the front with one of the ladies. I asked her about her suggestions and I order d a sandwich based on it with a fruit cup for my mother. I ordered a veggie pizza with no artichokes, no olives, no goat cheese and no basil garnish with a large bottle of Acqua Panna spring water. Whwn was all said and done we BOTH went through the order THREE times but there were STILL a few discrepancies. I was never offered a bottle opened for a NONscrew top so as the lady looked at me struggling thinking why would they give nonscrew top without offering to open it? I walked up and a male came to me and asked me did I need help? The same lady who took my order then came by me and asked me did I need help and I told her this was not a screw off top and sarcastically said that was I supposed to open this with my teeth. She just walked away. The guy said sorry about that and opened it. Sat down and soon after the food was brought to us by the same girl and I noticed my mother was looking extra hard at the fruit cup. I asked her what was wrong and she didn't want it... I asked her was everything okay until I saw the hair on the fruit. Totally disgusted I took it up to he kitchen and told the same girl who seemed to dismiss that there was hair on the fruit and said would you like chips instead. I got my mother her chips (at least I know that we had a better chance of it being sanitary since it was in a bag). When I finally was about to eat my pizza that was clearly on the burnt side I noticed that there was an ingredient that I specifically asked NOT to have on my pizza that was still put on my pizza. Side note my mother said the turkey sandwich was not that bad. When I came in here there was one couple and one last sitting by herself. There is no reason why this place was not spotless, better service and customer care. Future reference if you want to have a successful business the following is crucial: good customer service, CLEANLINESS, attentiveness. I will not come back. Please check your food and proceed with caution.

UPDATE: I spoke with CURT(IS) and explained the whole situation. He was extremely receptive and apologetic. He also offered to reimburse me but I refused stating that maybe he could provide a free meal to someone else. Hopefully, he can get some of his staff retrained and to standard.

name: SnailLord
text: Went here yesterday and I’m 100% sure the cashier was high. He stared at the screen blankly for quite some time, asked us what we ordered multiple times then went back to staring at the screen. He then said our order back to us about five times over, and even then he got the entire order wrong. The whole ordering process lasted at least five minutes for a simple order of Mac and cheese with a salad. We stood there correcting him time and time again while a line formed behind us waiting for their turn. I couldn’t even get a good look at this guy’s face because his hat was pulled so far down to hide it. I used to really like going here, but if that guy is the cashier again I will not be coming back.

text: We haven’t ate here since it was closed due to the virus and we picked up food today and I am really disappointed. We ordered my son the kids Mac and cheese and the container was not even 1/3 full of macaroni. He could’ve ate it in a few bites. Waste of money! I don’t think we are going to frequent this restaurant anymore.

text: Roast beef sandwich is very good. Although advertised as medium rare,  it was overdone. Also, a couple spots where there wasn't any meat. I had to open it up and rearrange it which left a thin covering. The sides seem a little small for the price.  All that said. It was still very good and we will return again and again. Friendly staff and clean environment. Job well done

text: We really enjoy this place for their pick two combos. My wife gets the soup and salad and I get the soup and sandwich. The tomato basil soup and the half roast beef sandwich are great! Servings are large so get the cup of soup and half salad/sandwich unless you are sharing or just incredibly hungry. Prices seem a little high until you taste the quality and see the serving sizes!

text: Good food selections and very tasty. Best bread & butter pickles I've ever tasted.

text: Great sandwiches, split the Italian and the chicken salad with my wife. Both top notch.

name: NICOLE TORRANCE
text: First time eating here. Went with family. Food was EXCELLENT!!! Will go back again mos def ❤

name: Miriam Eve Tidwell
text:
The food is different from most fast food places. The meals taste home made. You can taste the ingredients.
Every person that worked there was smiling and helpful. You don't clear your own plates up.
Salads are huge. Ask up front for less arugula. We had the shrimp and avocado salad. Lots of shrimp and a huge portion of avocados. We also had the chicken soup. Had an eastern flavor.  The Cesar salad was full of ingredients. And they have a table with all kinds of extras like pickles and croutons, watermelon rinds, oinions etc...
Pizza may just be the best I have ever had.
I had the Margarita and my husband had the Mediterranean with chicken. The flavors were perfect together.
Last we tried the rich and creamy lobster bisk. Pow we were stuffed!
This my folks, will require many do overs!

name: joe johnson
text: Food was good but stuff was very unprofessional. We were sitting by the drinks and staff was drinking in front of drink machines. A waitress was cleaning up the drink area while coughing all over and talking about getting off work. This will be my last time coming here for sure

text: I would like to know how did the staff get so friendly. That is definitely a plus. It is pretty busy today however everything is moving very quickly. Greeted me with a smile and took my order with ease. Restaurant looks absolutely amazing. The food was delicious. The macaroni and cheese was so creamy and cheesy what a little twist. Everything is going great. The sandwich was fresh the ingredients to Fresh every taste complimented each other. Thank you so much for my experience. I'm glad that you are here.

text: Always good!  I love their salads especially the Chicken Caesar salad.  The club sandwich and broccoli cheddar soup is great too!  And dont forget a slice of cake! name: Dottie Adams
text: A few years ago while my husband was in med school, Newks was a go-to location for his study spot. I ate many a meal there while he studied with his classmates in the evening. Ever since then, I've been hooked and was happy when this Columbus location opened. The staff there do work really hard to provide a nice experience. I'd recommend trying the Ultimate salad or the Spicy Shrimp Pizza. Both are great! Lunch does get busy, but evenings are a bit quieter. Overall a nice place to grab a quick meal or a great place to hang out for a bit.

text: The steak soup was good. Roast beef sandwich was just so dry, with no mayo or spreads available to put on it. Management not knowledgeable about the food (I asked about the lower calorie options on the outside menu) and did not offer to find out. My friends liked their pizzas. Not worth going back for me.

We decided that this was because it was the first thing we ate that day and got a to go box. IT LITERALLY WAS SO GREASY THAT IT SOAKED THROUGH THE BOX. Don’t get the pizza from here. I did go back and get a sandwich from this place later and it was good, so that’s why I gave it three stars.

name: Vee Bee
text:
Food was horrible, with a bad presentation. The tomato soup tasted as though it was rewarmed with lots of grease floating in it. The pizza was nothing like all of the other Newk's in the Atlanta areas. It was thin, and somewhere between warm and cool although we waited 20 minutes while they 'made' it.
Called to complain the same night, rude young folks literally playing on the phone. I asked for a manager from the start, and got one after repeating myself for approximately 8 minutes. He too was young and offered a poor excuse for the food, particularly the soup. He said that it probably had been out too long. Smh
He offered a credit for the soup that we never picked up.
We swear by Newk's in Dunwoody, and Newnan, GA, but this one in our home town will  NEVER get our business again. They have improvement to do!

name: will compton
text:
I am not one to usually care to write reviews, good or bad, but I felt that this one deserved it:

Tonight I ordered a meal from from Newks Eatery here in Columbus through the app Waitr (DO NOT EVER USE THIS APP THEY ARE HORRIBLE). Everything went smoothly until when I received my order, I realized that two things that I had purchased were missing from my bag. I was frustrated to say the least, so I called the restaurant to have the problem fixed.

I won't go into every little detail about the mess of what happened afterwards with Waitr, but I did want to give a shout out to the manager from Newks, Kayla, that helped me throughout the whole process. She really went above and beyond. Not only did she refund the money for the desserts, she also got a waitr driver back out to her restaurant,  even stayed late after they closed waiting on the driver to pick them up, and also included in an extra half sandwich for my troubles. She promptly called me back every time she had an update, answered my call every time I called, and handled to situation in the most professional and savvy way. She was the only person that saved the day and saved this situation from being an absolute disaster. THANK YOU KAYLA!!!

On a side note - Waitr is the worst, most poorly managed food delivery service company, and really service company in general, that I have ever used. They were the real problem in this whole situation and were basically running around with their heads cut off. Not to mention, this same situation had happened to me before while using the waitr app, this one just happen to top them all and be worse than anytime before. but again KAYLA SAVED THE DAY!

When I  go to Columbus to visit her...I can't wait to try Newk's.

I had to explain to her that this was my first visit and no, I didn't know the menu.  I ordered the roast beef sandwich and got the whole sandwich with a side of Mac and cheese.  The Mac and cheese was good but the sandwich was totally tasteless.  I ate half the sandwich and left the other half.  Sorry, but the food was bland to me and I don't think I'll be going back.

text:
I dined in Friday and Sunday. Friday night was awful. I waited hours for my pizza. I was angry and hungry. The store looked horrible. I had no idea what was on the round table or what it was until a dread headed server told me while finally serving my food after hours. She was the nicest person I had spoken to at Newks. Sunday was much better. I was greeted very nicely at the door so much enthusiasm especially for the morning time. Some of the servers looked very rude and like they had attitudes when you ask for anything. I luckily got the dread head server again whom remembered me from friday. She greeted us with a smile which was very warming, she is very sweet. Welcomed me back and served my food. Instead of pointing at the round table like the other server did when I asked a question she told me where I could find it and offered to bring it to me. Today the food was much better and out faster. But you really need to fix your servers attitudes and their conversations. One server smelt of marijuana and the to go area two ladies where complaining about customers all morning. I wanted to move away from that area. If you don't like your job quit! The dread head server is also very hot and looks very in shape :)

PIZZA IS THE BEST THING ON THE MENU!!!!!!!!!

name: Gwendolyn Thomas
text: I frequent other Newks and have never had an issue before and if I did, it was handled professionally and with care. Today, I decided to try the one in Columbus, Georgia; well, the cashier was very friendly and very nice to me. I ordered two soups and only received one soup as I didn’t pay attention to my receipt as my total is usually the same every time I go. I alerted the young lady who brought my food to go to me. She got a supervisor or someone in charge to tell her my issue. She was very unprofessional telling me my soup was not free and I would have to pay for it! I then explained to her that I worked daily and can pay for my soup and I didn’t ask for you all to give me the soup for free! I simply asked to fix another one. When she saw I was then frustrated, she tried to “clean it up”! No ma’am! Too late! And to make matters worse, once I drove home, I opened my soup and realized I was given less than half of the soup; which by the way was $3.99! I called the manager Sam and he did not seem to care about my issue all he kept saying was uh huh ok. No, sir! Then, I had to ask him what he was going to do about this to make sure it didn’t happen again and they needed to replace my soup! Overall, I’m very dissatisfied and will continue frequenting the Newks in Newnan where they seem to care about their customers more!! People work hard for their money and expect to be treated kindly!

resp.text: Whoa.  Thanks for letting us know about this.  We want to make this right & get better so it doesn't happen again. We will let our management team know about this.

name: Walter Newsome
text: Horrible service. I picked an online order up on time, they had microwaved it. So it was all a soggy mess. Had about 5 meatballs on a footlong the rest sauce despite ordering extra meat. They need to put meatballs on sandwiches, not spaghetti sauce. Fresh ain't the word.

name: Scott Staton

name: bridget sanchez
text: Came to restaurant at 9:25 pm on a Tuesday night Dec 5th after a wrestling tournament and ordered 2 foot long sandwiches, young man not only didn't listen to what I wanted but toasted sandwiches after I said NOT TOASTED then I informed him the wrestling team was coming in and he got mad cuz it was 30 min b4 closing .......i feel sorry for the 3 people that walked in at 10 min to closing as we were leaving.......

text: The food is good,people are nice.the only thing I seen that looked stupid and out of place was these three teen aged guys ,hanging out in the subway sitting on the tables,definitely need to be trained on how to act in public.

text: Loved It😘😘

text: Server didn't change gloves especially after touching the cash register. Did not change gloves between customers orders.

name: Briana Morris
text: Food was pretty good but they had advertisements and posters for the sliders and then when i tried to order some they told me they did not have those.

name: king henry
text:
I was at the Florala Subway today and ask the girl that was going to prepare me a meal to were a mask. She refused and started yelling at me inside the store.

Alabama Governor Kay Ivy has made it mandatory that everyone wears a mask because of COVID 19 spreading.

Where is Subway management in inforcing health rules? What happened to the customer is always right?  I'm sure the sales of this store is underperforming because of its staff.

I am a two-time stage, 4 cancer survivors and I will not put my life at risk. This girl has no clue who her customers are and what kind of health issues they are dealing with.  Staff and management do not care about their customers. Mater of fact the girl screamed that out at me as I walked out of the store.

Avoid this COVID 19 spreading store.

name: Levi Cleland
text: Wonderful fresh best sammich this side of the Mississippi

name: Erin T
text: Delish. Everything seemed to be just as fresh as should be. That sandwich was made just right. The girl listened and did a great job.

name: Teresa Jones
text: Normally I like subway.   But with covid, and everyone being more careful my experience here was so bad I couldn't eat the sandwich even though I was hungry.   The person waiting on me seemed put out anyone was even there, I was the only one in line.  I ask it toasted, which seemed to only make it worse.  My bread was stale, she forgot the Mayo so it was dry, but the worse part she wasn't wearing a mask even though others in the store were and half way through finishing it she rang me up and then went back to finishing my sandwich and handling everything never changing gloves.   Yuck.   I couldn't  bring myself to eat it.  I managed to choke a bite down.   But just couldn't keep going.  Next time I'll just go to Hardee's.

name: Julie Taylor
text: Employees not friendly and they are skimpy on the vegetables and sauces on the subs

text:
Be careful when ordering online from the website! You'll get home and your sub won't be what you ordered, but you will have paid the same. And the salad??? Wilted as if it was made last week.  Also, as a walk-in order the staff that build your sub, they are very impatient and rude!!!!! Rolling of eyes and sighing alot. 😞
They do pretty good with the pizzas, no attitude's there.

SO MAYBE IT'S SUBWAY ITSELF OR THAT THE STAFF ARE RUNNING THE REGISTER'S WAITING ON CUSTOMERS THERE.  RUNNING BACK AND FORTH TO SUBWAY.

name: Mary Potts
text: Best Subway I've been to! Thanks for a great meal.

text: Sandwiches were very good. I showed man working that we had a coupon. Manager came out to help and made my husband sandwich then rang us up while mine was finishing up. Charged us regular price. I told her we had a coupon. She said she couldn't change it! Ended up paying almost $5.00 more than we had to.

I truly feel that the cashier knew what she was doing and argued with us nonsensically.  We got ripped off, had a bad experience and she didn't even make my sandwich right.  Avoid this one at all costs.

name: Levi Long
text: This subway is the best subway we have ever eaten at and gets better each and every time! The quality is fantastic and customer service is top notch! I recommend this subway to everyone over any other! We most definitely will be back. We go at least once a week.

name: Miguel Landry
text: I visit this restaurant many times a year! This is my favorite spot to eat.  I visit this spot regularly. The cooking is of high quality, the staff is polite and the prices are decent. I like being in this restaurant to have a rich dinner.

resp.text: Thanks Miguel for your review! We hope to see you again soon!

text: ...And so was my 12 inch sandwich. Great service and great food!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your review!  Please let us know if you need anything!  Thanks for coming!

resp.text: Thank you for your review!  We look forward to seeing you!

text: Had a awesome experience in this spot with my wife. The food was served quick and the customer service is just fantastic. Prices are reasonable.

name: Nikolas Harris
text: This place is has great staff and good food that Shanna Luitze is just a nut job who should probably avoid going out in public if she can’t properly socialize in the first place.

name: Shanna Luitze
text: Horrible customer service tonight by a kid named Josh. He wouldnt listen as I said things 3 and 4x then when i got a little frustrated he started throwing stuff and then was a total smartbutt. After he threw the cheese off the sandwich I asked for the managers number. I looked back at him and he said "take a picture itll last longer" wow. The manager took his defense and said maam when we are busy that's how we put the cheese on because they are on a sandwich time limit.... yet had he listened he could have done the sandwich way faster and without being so rude.

name: Billy Thomason
text: Great sandwich, quick service.

name: Karen Harris
text: Ashley was waiting on us and she was very nice and sweet did a very good job and very helpful

name: Thomas Palmer

name: Jay Pulliam
text: Everything is always very clean, and the service is quick and generous. It's a good place to grab a quick lunch during a break.

name: Christen Oswald
text: Grate food. Supet fast at making it and gray when you eat it. Even when busy!

name: C Travis
text: Everyone is friendly and everything is clean.

name: Diane Franklin
text: Love Subway

name: Jeremy Gossett
text: Nice sandwich

name: Brenda Horsley
text: Good food

name: Diane Franklin
text: Love Subway

name: Amber Galvan
text: Had the half salad & soup, I had the lobster & crab bisque & there were shells in the soup. Can provide pictures for proof. I had to clean our table myself. The slaw tasted old. But the staff was nice. That is my only positive note.

resp.text: We really appreciate your thoughts and feedback and look forward to continuing to service you as a customer!

name: Rashmi Karki
text: Awesome taste .worth price and fresh foodie

name: Linda Brown
text: Traveling on I-85 and remembered eating at this Newk's in the past. So called and placed a ToGo order. Order was ready as promised when I went to pick it up. Staff super friendly and food was great. Will definitely return.

resp.text: Thank you for the 5-stars! Hope to see you again soon!

name: George Martin
text:
Extremely disappointed and uncomfortable.. Visited Newks for the first time on Sunday between 3 and 4 pm. It was empty. Took a while before we were helped. My wife and I both ordered a sandwich and soup. We noticed almost every table had trash and food. I don't mean that in a "every table - but really like 2", I mean well over a dozen at least.. The hostess said, "sorry about the mess, I haven't gotten around to it". We sat outside and it was a disaster. I mean, I've actually never seen something so bad. We were there for over an hour and the hostess never moved. She sat on her phone and never cleaned a single table. The iced tea was not good and I was concerned about sanitation honestly.. I don't think the dispenser has ever been cleaned and I felt like drinking it might make me sick. It tasted off. The chicken salad sandwich was disappointing and the bread was very tough to bite into. The lobster bisque that I was looking forward too must have come pre-made and frozen. All I could taste was cheese. Plastic utensils and 1 napkin each, but I let that pass because it may be a COVID restriction. We had to go and ask for the bill and when I said thank you to the 3 staff working, they just looked at me with dead expressions...

I'm not sure if this is normal or if this is how things run when management isn't around and just young employees are there, but I was actually appalled. Mind you, the state of the restaurant didn't bother me at first - perhaps they were swamped before we got there, but over an hour went by, with us as THE ONLY people there, and they never busted a single table. I did not take a picture because I didn't want to scare people away, but wow... I mean, wow... I only ate half my sandwich because I felt so uncomfortable with the sanitary conditions.

name: Debbie Hodge
text: I had the Newk's Special Salad. It was fresh and very good. It had a special dressing and a variety things on the lettuce- artichokes, grapes, blue cheese, nuts and other good things. I eat at Newk's often and I also like the shrimp and avacado salad.

name: Kim Deal
text: Chicken Salad sandwich is fantastic. Social distancing is enforced, masks are optional.

resp.text: Hi Kim, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. We really appreciate it.

name: Jane Chaffee
text: We always stop to eat there wait in town. Awesome

resp.text: Thank you for the 5-stars! Hope to see you again soon!

name: Susan Davis
text: Went in store at 6:30pm. No one at floor except girl cleaning. All waiters standing around. I had to ask if open shook head yes. Same person came to register I asked if pizza good shook head yes. I asked if she could talk she said yes'm. So I decided if they didnt want my business I left. I am not from there so I will not be going back.

name: Eric Selz
text: The food was awful and extremely overpriced. Friendly and courteous staff got it two stars.

name: Shane Senn
text: Best salads an soups in town love the atmosphere an the homemade cakes

resp.text: Thank you for the 5-stars! Hope to see you again soon!

name: Becky Culberson
text: Salad was well dressed. Pizza needed longer and more basil but that could be a personal preference.

name: Faye Haag
text: At the Opelika location last night, I  ordered a Margherita pizza. A friend had eaten one there and sent a picture-- looked great. My pizza came with Very Little mozzarella and NO Basil. When I  sent it back, it was returned with a few sprigs of parsley ( I know the difference) and no cheese.  My husband and I  had just left a medical clinic where we had been for a couple of hours. I was tired and hungry and frankly did not want to be That Customer!  Please don't let your kitchen send food out to customers like this! Don't want free food! Just want what's on your menu!

name: Connie Williams
text: Try the pizzas, they are utterly amazing!

resp.text: Thank you for the 5-stars! Hope to see you again soon!

name: Taejun Park
text: Spicy Shrimp is the best. Just try it.

name: Amy Hutchins
text: We always enjoy the food. I was really happy with how they are being careful and proactive about keeping things sanitary, clean, and you at peace about not being concerned with anything. They are doing a great job with how they're handling this outbreak.

name: Paula Newton
text: The food was great! But the bathroom floor and toilet are disgusting. I was here two weeks ago and thought they had been busy and not able to attend to it. But I don’t guess that was the case. Same disgusting mess as two weeks ago.

name: Jim Napier
text: Food was perfect. Manager was great.clean. love the salad bar extras.

name: Duane Brown
text: Disappointed this time. Had the caesar salad with seasoned shrimp. Not as good as it used to be.

name: Suzanne Woodall
text: Can't get a better salad anywhere so far. I've looked. Sometimes they are overdressed so I order dressing on the side. I've been to this newks many times (maybe 20) and the salads are consistent. Sandwiches are meh and leave much to be desired. They are mostly bread and little fillings. Soups are OK. I would never order another pizza. We ordered a pizza once with chicken and when we told an employee that the chicken tasted like jerky her reply was "yeah, we don't sell a lot of pizza with chicken because it is really dried out." I had to insist that the uneaten  pizza be removed from our ticket. My kids really enjoy the kids meals. Service is lacking most of the time and the restrooms are nasty more than not. All in all if you want a great salad and maybe an ok cup of soup on a cold day- this is your place. Last time I was there I paid $10 for a half a salad and a bowl of soup with a water. My friend paid $12 for half a sandwich a cup of soup and a tea.

name: Kevin Kinsey
text:
Disappointing. Plain and simple.  Newks is one of our favorite stops foe grabbing lunch but tonight was our first time doing take out and it was not so good.

Ordered two items:

Black and Bleu salad and my wife said it was great.  Fresh. Etc.

Southern Salad (mine) appeared old.  I say this because the lettuce was wilted and dominated by stems.  Had to pick through it to remove all of the 'unsavory' parts. Purple onion was so thickly cut we had to rechop it, etc.

I hope this is not the norm as I can go down the street next time if I want chicken salad and I know it will be fresh and good.

name: Christie Ray
text: Love the food at Newk’s but am starting to be concerned about the cleanliness. Visited at 3:45 on a Saturday. There were 3 occupied tables hardly anywhere to sit. More than half the empty tables had plates/bowls/trash still left on them. The tables that were clear had trash and such in the seats or were sticky. Several employees were congregated at the front, chatting. The bathrooms are disgusting and need a deep clean.  If they don’t clean the rest of the restaurant, I worry the kitchen is not getting cleaned either.

name: Donald Autery
text: Fruit bowl had a hair in it and the rice krispy treat looked as though it had been bitten. Horrible quality control all around. I will stick with the Newks in Newnan.

name: Steven Bulin
text: It tastes good, don't get me wrong. The menu isn't as diverse as I would like it to be, and there aren't a lot of options. Also, good luck finding a salt shaker.

name: Yonah Carriers
text: Newk Q sandwich is awesome!

name: Stacey Ernstberger
text: Love the food here, but the service needs a bit of work. The cashier was not helpful at all, and got confused at simple questions  - additionally she didn't seem to understand the menu. Her attitude was enough that we almost left. However, the food was great and the server had a very good attitude.

name: Trudy Morgan
text: The cashier tried to be nice but he needed help with the register and called for the manager. She proceeded tell me what I couldn't order, then told me what I could.  I informed her I ordered what was allowed in the first place. I asked for no tomatoes, no mayo and extra mustard. My sandwich had tomatoes and mustard was dripping everywhere. I've received much better food and service in Atlanta.

name: Joseph Rice
text:
I really enjoy the black and bleu salad. Good amount of steak for the price and the salad portion is very fresh.

Today I also got the 6 cheese pimiento mac and cheese as a side. It was 5.99 but it was barely a cup of food. This price is a rip-off for the amount of food. It was delicious but not worth that price.

Additionally I have been to this location twice and each time the person taking the order has been sullen and not welcoming. I think it was the same person both times. A smile and a greeting would be nice customer service.

name: Matthew McArthur
text: Another great Newk's food and dining experience. Would have given 5 stars but most of their employees were all gathered up and on their phones. Literally saw a family have to go find someone to come up and take their order.

name: Robin Ellis
text: They have cauliflower pizza crust, and it's good. Cost more but it's better for you.

name: Jada Mitchell
text: Food is always good. The employee are always respectful ! I will always come back

name: Bruno Ulrich
text: Great clinic. Staff so very accommodating.  And to top things off, Dr. McLean is very thorough and a great lady.  I make the trip from Auburn every six months even though there are dermatologists in town.  And I don't plan to change.

name: Tom Turkington
text: Good sandwiches, soups, and pizzas (more like flat bread). From a fast-food perspective, this is about as good as it gets.

name: Melissa Heigl
text: I love Newk's. Locations are clean, food is always fresh and served quickly. The salads are really generous, but I deleted like the sandwiches are on the smaller side. I love the condiment bar with it's many choices. I can customize my meal and feed my toddler some crackers or breadsticks too!

name: Allan Phillips
text: Nice place. Good food but, a little pricey.

name: sandy simon
text: Good food and quick service.  Wude range of menu options.  Reasonable prices.

name: Chris Surles
text: Awesome food and service!

name: James Persons
text: Had a great experience!! My family went here for a late Sunday lunch. I had an Italian sub with pasta salad. Daughter had kids pizza which was not expensive given that the drink was included. The bbq pizza is also a great pick. The service was also very quick.

name: Bruce Sandlin
text: Shrimp po-boy was good, gumbo was not.

name: Carol Gottlieb
text: Always fresh food. Everything tastes good. Staff friendly.  Clean and lots of room.

name: Janice Roberts
text: I love this place. Food is always top notch. Staff is always friendly. Can't go wrong with anything on the menu. I also enjoy their tomato basil soup.

name: Chang Park
text: Food has no season on the chicken sandwich

name: Alesia Lyles
text: Good food. Filthy bathrooms. Worker sat in stall over 15 minutes when only one toilet was working. When she came out, she had left a mess. Men’s bathroom was in no better shape. The least you could do is keep the bathrooms clean. Mad3 my experience there bad. Wondered if worker actually went back to prepare food after leaving the mess in the one working stall.

name: Wilson Staubitz
text:
The food preparation needs some classes on how the cross contamination works
Rarely change gloves while working on different orders, touching stored items and then adjusting garments and hair then preparing individual items of food ie: avocado then back to digging into stored item containers
I could go on
Should've made a video but waited to receive my order.

name: Bonnie Edwards
text: Loved the food, the staff was friendly and I will be back!

name: sean ramey
text: Really well put together comfort food, sort of pricey but definitely tasty

name: Greg Jones
text: Seriously this place is amazing. The app is easy to use and the food is fantastic. I order my lunch on the app walk to my car and drive maybe 3 blocks park walk in and the food is ready. Keep it up!

name: Paul Joseph
text: Not a bad place to get a good sandwich over lunch time. Here's a little tip if you get there during a crowded time, Waltz on over to the take-out line and place your order there, and just tell them that you are dining in. I have saved myself many hours it seems over the past few years by doing that little trick. May I suggest the Royal Sandwich with banana peppers. That is my favorite. Overall I find the food very good but for the cost of a sandwich and drink it is a little pricey for this area. If you just looking for a sandwich and a drink you can go to Jersey Mike's or Subway or Which Wich and get a good sandwich, chips and drink for more reasonable price, but don't short Change yourself you have got to try this place

name: Dave Hagman
text:
Casual order at the register and seat yourself restaurant.
Pro tip:
View and decide what to order before hand to avoid feeling pressure to order.
I would certainly go back.

name: J Walters
text: Good prices, foods always really good and those sides are already yum

name: Lisa Roberson
text: Great food and Great service

name: Wendy Parrish
text: We both had the pick two- sandwich and soup - and it was so good. The warm soup hit the spot on this chilly day, and the sandwich was a tasty filler.

name: David Moon
text: Excellent food and employees. Very courteous staff.

name: Andrea Clark
text: Food and service were excellent.

name: T Potts
text: A little slow on service but Mac and Cheese was very good. Veteran discount given

name: Carolyn Gibson
text:
While traveling from GA through Alabama. I’ve eaten several times at Newks in Tiger Town shopping center in Opelika.
Today I stopped for lunch & was very disappointed. I ordered a shrimp & avocado salad. I love both of these foods, but today my salad was topped with avocado & every piece was brown. Very unappetizing.  I was so disappointed & had to pick off every piece of avocado. I like green fresh looking avocado.  And food there is not cheap.
May not be stopping by anymore.

name: William Hodge
text: Clean,courteous, professional experience. A healthy and tasty alternative when you decide to dine out.

name: Rosa Holloway
text: Love the food and the family atmosphere. Great place to eat.

name: Kathy Perkins
text: Had a delicious veggie pizza. Friendly and helpful staff.

name: Morgan Carpenter
text: Fantastic... excellent food... very quick service... BRAVO!

name: cindi greer
text: Long line at 13:00. Food served fast. Chef salad was fresh and good. Daughtet in law had the chicken salad sandwich and said it was delish.

name: Rob Burks
text: Food is good but this time the soup was cold.

name: C M
text: This used to be my favorite place to eat. Within the last few years the location has slowly went down hill. You can tell management is slacking & the employees are just not happy. The establishment is nasty - for example: the round table is nasty, the plastic containers to put condiments in are missing, the drink station has what appears to be mold growing around the tea dispenser, & the booths haven’t had a good cleaning in forever. I’m done going here until the management gets better & someone is hired to actually clean.

name: Joshua Cleveland
text: We are a family of 5, soon to be six, and this is it number one place to go. The food is delicious and fresh and the price is reasonable. You will not be disappointed.

resp.text: Thank you Joshua ! We are so glad you had an awesome visit, hope to see you again soon!

name: mike green
text: Food was decent. Staff was setting in a corner talking. The two staff members working in the kitchen went to their phone often. Then I witness one wipe his nose in a tissue, throw the tissue away and then pick up a plate and deliver to another customer. I stopped eating right then! Dont think I will be back.

name: Potato Banana
text: Newk's Eatery was delicious, I recommend the salmon ceasar salad, bye far one of  the most delicious thing I've ever tasted

name: Mary Margaret Grigg
text: Very popular place. We went back next day but they were closed Wednesday before Thanksgiving. Sad for us but good for employees.

name: Mckenna Ware
text: Mac and cheese came out stone cold and couldn't get anyone's attention to get it fixed. A lit pricey for something that tasted like it was poorly heated up in the microwave

name: Ed Shikoski

name: Dee Bradley
text: Great place.

name: Jeanee Snowden

name: Linda Masce

name: Carl Morgan

name: Claude Fortin

name: Diane Peterson

name: Hobie Henning
text: Good food, but a little on the pricey side for a quick meal. I really enjoy their loaded potato soup. Their wifi is very bad though. Don't come here and expect to get work done.

name: Bryan Oley

name: denise lensgraf-landers
text: Love the freshness if the food and the staff is excellent in ensuring you are happy with your food ... Oh, and, bread sticks... Can't say enough about the free bread sticks !!!!!

name: Victor Cuevas
text: Very good. Great staff. Try the veggie pizza. Fantastic.

resp.text: Thank you Victor ! We are so glad you had an awesome visit, hope to see you again soon!

name: Brandon Boyd
text: I was served a hair in my caviar. Had to ask for the manager. She wasn't proactive. Other than that the food was good. No avocado 🥑 in my wife's salad.

name: Carolyn Jorgensen
text: Veggie pizza, I hope it will be made the same every time I go.

name: Christopher McLeroy
text: Always a great place to eat! Clean and quick service!

name: Shirez

name: Daniel Stoneback
text: I always get the ultimate salad so I can't speak to much else but that salad is delicious for the price.

name: Jody Noles
text: Always good food.

name: Quentin Seaborn

name: keita stephens
text: Love the salads and pizza one of my favorites lunch spots

name: Mark S.
text: Awesome food and customer service

name: Randal Roberts
text:
Newk's is super good food. It's a bit heavy, so come hungry.

I strongly suggest the Debra or Newk's Q.

resp.text: Hi Randal ! Thank you very much for your wonderful review! We work really hard to offer the best food in a welcoming environment. Hope to see you again soon !

name: Susan Culberson
text: Very good food, a lil pricy.

name: Sammy Patrick

name: Deborah Camp

name: Allen Kinzalow

name: EastAlabamaMedia

name: Anthony Brown

name: david kimsey

name: Nicole Laliberte
text: I LOVE the Mediterranean pizza here💖💖

name: Rhett King
text: The Newk’s Q pizza and the Ultimate salad are where it’s at! Good BOGO deals often too.

name: Dakota Gregg
text: Great food, great staff

name: Paul Howell
text: Always great food no matter what you get.  I recommend the spicy shrimp pizza though.

name: Samantha York
text: Here for lunch. Staff extremely friendly.  Great shrimp po boy sandwich

name: david kimsey
text: Always a good bite.. the new Thai chicken soup is great

name: Kevin Espey
text: Fied shrimp poboy had not fried shrimp... Roast beef poboy was not great.. roast beef was tough .

name: Deborah Camp
text: New Greek salad is perfect.

name: Jennifer Neal
text: Awesome place for lunch,  chicken salad is the best in town.  German chocolate cake is to die for!

name: Nicole Laliberte
text: I LOVE the Mediterranean pizza here💖💖

name: Rozanne Robinson
text: Good food and service!

name: John Dicke
text: Good food, decent price

name: Marise Shotts
text: Busy, little bit noisy, good service and good  food.

resp.text: Hi Marise ! Thank you very much for your wonderful review! We work really hard to offer the best food in a welcoming environment. Hope to see you again soon !

name: John McCarthy

name: Spencer Plasse
text:
Visited yesterday for the first time. It’s an off the beaten path style restaurant and did not disappoint by any means.

I was very impressed by the burger. It was perfectly cooked and the sauce added a lot to it. The fries were very crispy and had just the right amount of salt. Their sweet tea was also great.

I also tried a peach milkshake, which was pretty decent. The service is fantastic and the prices are average. I would highly recommend it to anyone. It’s well worth any drive!

resp.text: Thank you, Spencer! We are thrilled to hear about your experience and that you loved the food. We appreciate your business and hope to see you again soon!

text: Online ordering did not speed up the process of getting our food. It was suppose to be ready at 6:30, we got our food at 6:50. We did not get sauces for onion straws or chicken fingers. We did not get the drinks with our combos, which I didnt realize til we were half way home..... Hamburger Heaven usually does great.

resp.text: Shannon - We are sorry to hear about your experience and would like the chance to make it up to you. Please give us a call at 205-631-1339 or email me at allen@thehamburgerheaven.com. We appreciate your business!

text: Went to drive through and when I got home with multiple orders everything was perfect. No ketchup on 1, the works on 1, nothing on 1 and combo on 1. That never happens at most drive through. Give these essential workers 100%

name: Jonathan Grigsby
text:
Off the beaten path hamburger joint.
Has that ma and pa feel to it at least the location I went to in Gardendale.  The hamburger patties are thick and juicy even the sliders are not to be underestimated.
Craving a huge homemade style burger try the Holy Cow burger with thick cut fries or thick cut sweet potatoe fries my personal fav.  Lastly they have the best banana pudding just like my  grandma used to make delish.  Highly recommend if in the area.

name: David Thomas

resp.text: Thank you for your business, David! We think we have the best customers, too!

resp.text: Sandra - I am sorry to hear about your experience and would like the chance to make it up to you. Please give me a call at 205-631-1339 or email me at allen@thehamburgerheaven.com.

text: The lady working behind the counter was very polite!! The breakfast was perfect. I had 2 fried eggs and they good perfect over medium.

name: Maria Kalaff
text:
I ordered 4 chicken tenders & fries last week. Allena M, took care of me.
When I arrived home, the tenders was so HARD & BURNT, my dog even
refused to eat it.  I was so disappointed! They must have new management, that doesn't care.  I paid $10.76.  My last time there. I went to Pulblix the next day, & ordered chicken tenders. It was so much better.

Good luck on your nasty tenders & deceiving people with a smile!

name: Jeremiah Johnson
text:
I generally give positive reviews for my dining experiences, but this Hamburger Heaven in Gardendale broke my culinary cherry! The food was fine but the customer service was despicable. We experienced good service from our drive thru cashier. She was nice and pleasant; but when my wife realized that she was missing her fork and dressing for her hamburger salad; that's when it all went haywire.

She pulled around to go inside and when she encountered the manager about the mistake, he first questioned her about whether she had a salad or not and when she wanted the dressing as well to eat the salad with he made her feel like a common thief! It was like, because we are  minorities, a 1960's lunch counter uprising. The manager should be ashamed of themselves. Customer service is an art form and this person made our otherwise good experience a bad one.

resp.text: Hi, Jeremiah. My name is Allen Folse, and I am the owner of Hamburger Heaven Gardendale. I was the one who spoke with your wife today. I did ask if she ordered a salad but only because it is our practice to make sure a dressing is included in every salad and I wanted to make sure I addressed the oversight with my employees so that it didn’t happen again. I apologize for any misunderstanding that may have caused and invite you to give me a call at the restaurant if you would like to discuss any of your concerns. We value each and every one of our customers and hope to see you again soon.

name: Amber Allen
text: I absolutely LOVE this Place.. only This Hamburger Heaven here in Gardendale,  has never failed me. The budgets are thick and very good!!! No thin patties here... KEEP UP THE GREAT JOB GUYS!!

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words, Amber!

name: jason clement
text: Oh my goodness! I really really love this place!!!!!! Love it! Best burger you can get anywhere. I just don't know how they do it but man they are good. I don't even live around there but I visit every once and a while and I always stop here. So good!!

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words, Jason!

text: It is your standards fast food chain with a Christian music twist. The restaurant was fair cleanliness could’ve been a little bit better in the bathroom and in the dining area. The staff is super friendly and the food was cooked well the quality was good. The shake was very good   The southern lies were decent. Definitely not worth $3. Overall it was a good experience and I didn’t hear again. I’ll be willing to try a breakfast here!

text: So yummy the food was hot the milkshake was off the chain!! So Delicious yall need to try this place out!!

resp.text:
(Translated by Google) Thank you, Laangela!

(Original)
Thank you, Laangela!

name: Ragan Butler
text: They have changed their fries and they were horrible. The grease was old and the fries were fried hard and were crunchy. Bring the old fries back please.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback, Ragan. While I can assure you that our grease is changed regularly, it sounds like your experience was not up to our standards. I would like the chance to make it up to you. You can call the restaurant and ask for Allen Folse or email me at allen@thehamburgerheaven.com.

name: joe richardson
text: I was disappointed to find out that they was drive-thru service only. I was supposed to meet a family from Kentucky there and had to find another place to meet them and eat at the last minute.

resp.text: Joe - We are sorry that you were disappointed. We have signage outside the restaurant and on social media alerting our customers that our dining room is closed or has limited hours due to ongoing challenges caused by the pandemic and its effects on staffing and operations for our restaurant and many others. We appreciate your patience as we navigate this unprecedented event and apologize for any inconvenience our limited dining room hours have caused. We hope you will gives us another chance in the future.

name: Chris Hackney
text: Great hamburgers, but tried the breakfast today.  Excellent pancakes, gravy biscuits, and smoked sausage.  Give them a try for breakfast!

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words, Chris! We're glad you enjoyed your breakfast experience.

name: Tamera Crawford
text: I came to hamburger heaven on a Tuesday night about 6:45, so I know it’s a rush for dinner. if you’ve been through the drive-thru at the hamburger heaven in Gardendale, you know that from the menu to the checkout window you can see the person taking your order. When I was giving my order for my whole family, anytime I added anything else this young man Taking my orders seemed to throw his hands around and roll his eyes as if it bothered him I was getting more than one thing. I noticed when I moved up one car length at a time through the drive-thru, i noticed he seem to be doing this with everyone, not just me. As I got up to the window he let me sit at the window for about five minutes with the line backed all the way up before he even had the drinks ready like usual or my order paid for just standing at the screen taking orders… but the line wasn’t moving. While the food has always been good here for me, service is more important. It turns out this is the owner son, Nick, who is so bothered by taking orders to the drive-thru. After I sat at the window waiting for him to take my card to pay for my meal for about 5 to 6 minutes, Allena(I assume was her name, it was on my receipt the lady handed me)  finally came to the window, gave me my food, and helped clear out the drive-through line because it seemed like Nick wasn’t doing anything. I could hear him cursing and see him throwing his hands around anytime more than one thing was added to an order if he were to say “is there anything else?” not to mention my meals were cheeseburgers with everything but pickles onion and tomato, and i got plain burgers with ONLY pickles onions and tomatoes..👍🏻Maybe it seems like because he’s the owner son he can act how he wants… That doesn’t get you very good service reviews and I most likely will not be back to this location, Because while the food can be great, the service still means more.

resp.text:
Tamera,

Thank you for letting me know about your experience. Please accept my apology for the behavior you witnessed and know that it is out of character. While there is no excuse, our store did have an unexpected volume of business this evening due to the devastating effects of last night's tornado on our neighboring restaurants in Fultondale.

Unfortunately, this proved to be a frustrating challenge for a teenager still learning to handle high stress situations. Rest assured, this will be a learning experience for him.

I value your business and want every customer to feel as if they are treated with respect when they visit our restaurant. I would like to make this right and compensate you for your meal. Please call me at 205-531-8766 or email me at allen@thehamburgerheaven.com. Again, thank you for your feedback and bringing this to my attention.

- Allen Folse

name: mandy page
text: They didn't get my order right at all. The food is ok.

resp.text: Mandy - We would like the opportunity to address your concerns and make up for your incorrect order. Please email me at allen@thehamburgerheaven.com or call 205-631-1339 if you would like to discuss your experience.

name: KAREN JONES
text: The lady at the front, Leslie I think, (cheerful make-up) was wonderful! She told us what burgers were perfect for what we were looking for since I had my 8 year old with me. The food was fantastic!! Burgers were fresh, hot and delicious and the onion rings were fabulous.  I got my daily dose of iron for sure 😁.

text: They have the greatest milkshakes and soft serve. Every food item I've ever had was really good except the French fries which are ok and definitely not needed.

resp.text: Thank you for your business, George! We think our customers are pretty excellent, too!

name: Dez Brown
text: The past two times I've been here within the past week my order was messed up each time!! The first time 9/22/20 my two burgers were so burnt that the cook that day tried to cover it up with melted cheese and tons of sauce. I had to throw away about $10 worth of food bc it was too burnt to eat. All you could taste was burnt hamburger meat that was hard as a rock. My family and I decided to give them another try tonight 9/26/20 the cook left off my bacon that I ordered with my burger. So I went back to the restaurant and explained what was going on to the sweet older woman at the register. She had the cooks remake my burger again. I got back out to the car only to discover that the cook screwed up by burger yet again!!! This time by giving me a completely different burger than what I ordered. I did not take it back a third time bc I was dealing with a cranky toddler and was just beyond frustrated with the cooks. They need to get better cooks or properly train their cooks.

resp.text: We are sorry that you did not enjoy your experience and would like the opportunity to address your concerns! Please give us a call at 205-631-1339 and ask for Allen or send an email to allenfolse@bellsouth.net.

name: Bill Marrs
text: The staff working drive thur young man  had mask on, the lady didnt. Lady on counter no mask. Fries were over salted. Burgers were very good.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback, Bill. I do require all employees that come in contact with our customers to wear a face covering. I have continued to enforce this requirement and address non-compliance immediately. I have installed cameras throughout the restaurant and check in multiple times a day when I am not on site. We also check the temperature of each and every employee every day when they come in and have greatly increased sanitizing the dining room and kitchen on a consistent basis with quaternary ammonia sanitizer. Our last health inspection score was a 96. I hope this helps ease your mind. I appreciate your business and invite you to give us another try. - Allen Folse, owner

text: Food was excellent! I liked that we were able to eat inside without worrying about social distancing issues. The lady that took our order wasn't super friendly and seemed a bit annoyed but other than that, very happy with my visit.

text: I've eaten here time and time again, but when I first walked into this store in this town the first thing I noticed was the Christian Music playing over the speakers. name: Adam Dover
text:
I have been to three HH's since moving to the area two years ago and this is by far leaps and bounds the best one.  The staff really makes it good.  Granted the building is in slight decay and food (though solid for fast food) won't win any food critic awards, you feel like you in a very loose, friendly laid back environment.  You see a lot more personality from their workers and they almost always chat you up about completely random things just to kill time if it is slow there.

But my favorite thing about this place is it serves your dogs (pets) bones at the drive thru.  One time they had ran out of bones so he came back with strips of bacon without me even asking.  Later found out you are not supposed to give dogs bacon....But there was no ill will there.

name: Jessica Allen
text:
The drive through system at this location is the worst design I've ever seen! Wrap around the building twice just to order?! Merging twice in a drive through?!
I've been to many different Chick Fil A's in many different states. I've been to busy locations in cities multiple times larger than Daphne.
Never again will I even attempt this location.

name: Super Mom Cooley
text: I shared this on my personal page but also wanted to give kudos here. I tell you what....Chic Fila has it going on. They should train ALL fast food restaurants!!! The line was wrapped around the building THREE TIMES. They had FOUR people in the RAIN serving the guest to keep the line moving. I got in line at 7:54 and had my food at 8:11. That is 17 min for about 50 cars. It would take other FF places that long to serve 5. They are COMMITTED TO EXCELLENCE and do it with a smile and friendly. Good job chic Fila! These girls need a RAISE!

name: Jan Serrano
text: I love Chick-fil-A and always go to this location. The food is good and hot most of the time but sometimes they don’t give you everything. Very nice employees when I do curbside pickup. The delivery service I didn’t really like they take a long time to come and the girl didn’t even knock or anything to let me know she brought the food. If I wouldn’t have checked my phone I wouldn’t have known.

name: Phyllis Jones
text: First visit to this location. Pleasant experience! Tried the grilled spicy chicken. It was ok. I think I'm just tired of fast food.

name: Crystal Osborn
text: The only place where the salad still tastes good even when they forgot to give you your dressing and toppings.

name: ArkanShadowFox H.E.B.
text: Our food was not really up to par. First, my sister's salad was missing its avocado ranch, and my food was not great. My fries were over salted and chicken was burnt tasting on the outside.

name: Jennifer Northcutt
text: Service is super fast,even when the line is wrapped around the building! Don't let the long lines fool, it's really only about a 7-10 min wait. Staff is always in good spirits!

name: David and Diana George
text: We ordered on the app and showed up at the appointed time to pick up our food.  We parked in the place where we were instructed to park.  We waited 20 minutes for the food.  I finally had to get out of the car and flag down an employee.  5 minutes later, our food showed up.  No apology, no explanation.  We have been to other Chick-fil-A's and always received great service.  This one is an anomaly.  I don't recommend visiting this location.

name: Wyatt Brackin
text: They show up every morning about 430 to prep there food for quality and prep their minds for achieving greatness

name: L0RD CRONUS
text: So.. the drive through line is very very long around noon. Not their fault but still something to be aware of when coming to this location. Somehow with the drive through and the pick up curbside they still manage to be reasonable quick. By quick I mean it only took me 30 minutes to get in line, order and leave. Other franchises I'm sure it would if taken way longer. Food was very hot and fresh when I picked it up, stage was very friendly and organized for the amount of traffic they had. Very happy with my visit, I recommend going here when it's not as busy, but if you go at lunchtime you pretty much know the deal.
